Reviews.Title: “The best hotel, by far”
Reviews.Author: Rema M
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at the Liberty, the service is impeccable. - the Valet staff is always smiling and typically has your car ready even before you call for it - the Front Desk consistent sincerity is welcoming (especially Patrick!) - the Concierge and Sales and Management Staff is always ready to offer a helping hand (Peter and Calvin) - the restaurants and bars are great, and always a social scene despite the night of the week I have stayed at the liberty for the past 3-4 months on a weekly basis and I must say, this is by far the best hotel I have stayed at. When I tell my local friends where I am staying, they are utterly jealous and shocked that I get to stay at such a luxurious hotel. This is truly a luxury collection hotel that is in a class of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stateside....so Far”
Reviews.Author: Shannnon C
Reviews.Content: This has been the best hotel my family and I have ever stayed in Stateside, so far. We loved it. The staff was exceptional and it is very family friendly. We are definitely planning on staying at this hotel again. The architecture is wonderful and it has a great location. We ate at CLINK several times and it was an exceptional restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: Doubleeagle
Reviews.Content: Very innovative redesign of former jail - enough of the prior jail remains to get a true feel for the central cell block. Clearly one of the pricey Boston Hotels but seems to be worth it. Would rate staff a full 10 of 10. Lobby scene later night is worth watching although unclear how long the current "It Place" will remain so. Somewhat concerned that the rocking lobby bar would impact ability to sleep but there was zero transmitted noise. Similar concern about arriving ambulances at Mass General but once again not an issue. Our room was not one of the rooms with a view but it was comfortable and nice. Location is excellent as it sits at the base of Charles Street - the trendy uphill walk up to Beacon Hill. Also easy walk to North End, Boston Garden and Fan. Hall area.

Reviews.Title: “Break Out of the Quotedien with a stay at the Liberty”
Reviews.Author: BCGosnold
Reviews.Content: This very cool modern hotel in a great location in Boston is designed around an old stone prison. The lobby soars above you with balconies that once held pacing guards but now is filled with Jimmy Choo-heeled yuppies and Boston Brahmin who needed a place to stay after visiting hours at the adjacent Mass General hospital. Steps from posh Louisberg Square and Beacon Hill, you can shop and dine in spitting distance from Boston's most famous residences. Most rooms are in the tower behind the huge stone entry-way. Bathrooms mimic the stone vibe, and amenities are very upscale. The city views over the Charles River and Beacon Hill are stunning on the upper floors. Food in the casual eatery "Clink" is good, if a bit predictable. The after hours bar scene in the lobby is half the fun. Secure one of the comfy wing backs and people watch. You may even see a ghost or two -- the history displayed in the lobby reveals the prison was eventually shut down for "inhumane conditions." Thankfully, with a multi-million dollar facelift, you will feel more like a princess than a prisoner at the end of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but they back it up...mostly.”
Reviews.Author: niwiro
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel is situated perfectly for a weekend in Boston if you want to splurge and are planning on visiting the North End or going to the Garden. The staff is great aside from one concierge who seemed a little put out that I was asking for a corkscrew but she did tell me I could order one from my room phone, no big deal. The valet solves any problem with finding parking and at only 40.00 per night for your stay it takes away any stress that can cause. The champagne they offer upon check in also helps alleviate any stress. The hotel is kept up well but does have a restaurant smell since their are multiple restaurants connected to the lobby. The rooms are nice and the water pressure of the showers is great, it's like a massage. The view we had was of the Prudential and Hancock towers as well as the Charles River and the Citgo sign. The rooms were fairly quiet and the mini-bar was stocked full with $10 M&M's :) Definitely better reserved for a romantic weekend than a business trip or family stay but still a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property Great Food Average Room”
Reviews.Author: AteT00Much
Reviews.Content: We ate a breakfast, a lunch and a dinner here and they were all excellent. How can you not like the property? The common areas are special. But the rooms are a bit "used" and not quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel that offers stunning views of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: DriftingDuo
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel is such a nice change from the massive chains spread throughout the country. This was once an old jail, and they have used this uniqueness in their hotel. The hotel key cards have old prison keys on them. The hotel bar is called "Clank". You can see old brick and old photos of the jail itself. The room was beautiful and clean, but best of all was the amazing view of the city!! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful hotel and lobby, rooms are just OK”
Reviews.Author: AlliBum
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel is a beautiful property and the restoration of the hotel (previously a city jail) is remarkable and worth the trip alone. From various parts of the hotel you can see the old brick, jail cells and remnants of the former building. It's an impressive place. The front desk staff and check-in process was efficient and very accommodating (a glass of grappa a welcome surprise too!). Room service was fast, the food was better than expected and though Boston's outrageous taxes can easily run up the fee, I feel it was worth it. So, the no-so-good part -- the room's cleanliness. I feel like every time I stay at a Starwood property, I get the same "so-so" approach to cleaning. The bathroom in my room was particularly average -- there was splatter on the wall by the toilet and sink, there were a few random hairs in the corners of the bathroom room and a few random splatters higher up on the mirror. In fairness, I didn't call the front desk to complain -- I was only there for one night and was generously upgraded to a room with an incredible view of the city so I overlooked those things. But, the room was loud due to the HVAC system and there is also very little soundproofing between the rooms. Not the best night's sleep... and the bed was just OK... very oddly lumpy. As a Marriott Gold member, I can see a clear difference between the two chains and for me, I'll stick with Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Djfin
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms and very good service. Only concern is that the lobby turns into a dodgy nightclub stupendous scene at weekend evenings

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to rate higher but hesitated”
Reviews.Author: msbeck
Reviews.Content: The hotel decor was very nice and our rooms, overlooking the Charles River were wonderful. We just encountered a couple of problems that made me give this hotel an average rating. I had booked a one bedroom suite for our family of 4 because I was told that the couch was a pullout couch. The morning of our arrival we received a call from the hotel asking if that was what we wanted because there was not a pullout couch in the room they had for us. We were asked if we wanted connecting rooms instead and said yes (rollaway beds were also offered). When we got to the hotel our rooms were not ready but were told they would be after lunch. We went to lunch and got a call that one of the rooms was ready but the other one wouldn't be ready until 5:00 pm as they were shooting a commercial in our room. We were fine with it and continued with our sightseeing. Our rooms had a spectacular view. The bathrooms were spacious but had a very tiny shower. Don't know why they would not have made a larger shower and perhaps put in a smaller tub or no tub at all. We were excited about our room as it was a suite with a connecting room (we were expecting 2 regular rooms). Thought we had been hooked up but upon check out we realized that we had to pay for it. I thought they should have mentioned this to us when they called and we switched our reservations. On our last night at the hotel there was a very loud party going on above us. At 2:00 am security knocked on our door assuming we were the ones having the party! Couldn't they hear from the hallway that it wasn't us? Did they check the register? We were a family with 2 kids! No apology or anything from the hotel. I know it was a mistake but acknowledge it somehow. That said, the staff we encountered were very professional and nice. Ate at Scampo and it was great. Also ate at Toscano on Charles St. and had a wonderful meal there.

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: disneygirl41
Reviews.Content: Went to the Liberty Hotel for a night to celebrate my anniversary. Hotel is very unique. It was very cool how this former jail was turned into a hotel. Upon arrival we were given champagne. They also offered pink lemonade too. The room was really nice with a beautiful bathroom. We opted to park over at the hospital garage. It saved us $22 and it was only a 2 min walk around the corner. The bar alibi was really nice. We had a few drinks then took a cab to Davio's which had great Italion food. Upon check out they had complimentary coffee & tea. I would definitely recommend this hotel. If the weather was warmer you can walk across over to the Charles River.

Reviews.Title: “The staff treated us so elegantly”
Reviews.Author: BMB1105
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after surgery and was treated so well. The staff treated us so elegantly. The room was exceptional and the attention to detail from food to dÃ©cor was excellent. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, cool and relaxing too!”
Reviews.Author: jeeper333
Reviews.Content: Charles River Suite amazing!!! Comfy bed and furniture. My only strong complaint is the upholstery needs shampooing (smudges on legs of couches/chairs) and nicked bedside tables. May be no big deal to many people, but at this price point, the entire suite should be impeccable. Hotel staff very friendly and knowledgeable. So fun to make your own "pub crawl" between the lounges right in the building! Location great for walking the city (especially if you know Boston well) or interested in running around the Charles.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic architecture”
Reviews.Author: Catherine K
Reviews.Content: It's gotta be the most impressive hotel lobby in the world. The welcome glass of bubbly is a lovely touch. The rooms are pretty "par for the course" - very nice, but nothing out of the ordinary. I agree with another reviewer that the sound-proofing is poor, and add to that noisy a/c, so they weren't quiet nights. Very close to the science museum, the waterfront, and right by a T stop. But we enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are basic. Common areas are fun. Location not great unless you need to be near MGH”
Reviews.Author: BarbBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in a great location unless you are going to MGH. The rooms are very basic and the beds are not comfortable. The rooms are definitely due for a renovation. The bottom sheet is not fitted and, thus, the bedding is a mess by morning... which is a pet peeve of mine. The hotel is in the old charles street jail, so that is a draw. The rooms are so boring that the hotel only gets 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall”
Reviews.Author: Kaotcgd
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd trip to the Liberty in a year and the first time we stayed in a suite. I have to say that, compared to the regular rooms, the suite is the way to go due to the poor soundproofing between the rooms and the halls. In a suite, you have two sets of doors between you and the hallway, and the bathroom is between you and the neighboring hotel room, so it is much easier to get a quiet night's sleep. The first time we stayed in a regular room last spring, unfortunately, we were right next to a suite which had what sounded like at least 50 young,drunk people partying into the night. Even with their door closed and ours closed, we could hear everything, and of course they insisted on wandering up and down the hall whooping it up. We were moved quickly though to another room upon calling the front desk, which we appreciated. The lobby is great, but it does turn into a major nightclub on the weekends. If you're up for partying, it is great, but also a tad pretentious. Dinner at Scampo: the food was good. The service (with the exception of our primary server, who was very experienced) was so-so at best. We sat at the bar to wait for our table, and the female bartender had absolutely no personality whatsoever. It kind of left us cold. Then, upon being seated, the hostess seemed very confused about where to seat my husband and I and brought us to a 4-person table that had someone else's jacket there. Then she checked with the front desk and told us that we could sit there "if you want", so of course we took it. Then, two busboys came out and hung out at the computer by our table and started goofing around. I guess what I am saying is that the staff could have been slightly more professional for the way this place is raved about. Our primary server was great, though, and we have no complaints. Food was good, but I don't know if it is 5-star or is Scampo just a little pretentious itself because the Liberty is the "place to be" for the in crowd?

Reviews.Title: “The Liberty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: looper63
Reviews.Content: The Liberty is a great hotel that's close to the Garden, the North End, and Cambridge, right across from the Charles River. Beautifully renovated old jail with several dining options and clubs. We did not eat here, but the restaurants and clubs were busy each night. I was upgraded to a great room with excellent views of the city and river. The room was very comfortable and well appointed. Everything is new and clean. The check in was a snap, and valet was always quick. I have no trouble recommending this hotel as I will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite Boston hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rupacked
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! It's not cheap but fits us perfectly. Wonderful service from bell/door men, valet (left two bottles of water in the car fo the ride home), front desk, etc. We requested early check in as we were going to a 1:00 Bruins game and the room was ready at 11 am! Love, love the lobby! The lobby bar was hopping after the game, there are lots of chairs and couches and nearly all were taken. The atmosphere of this hotel is chic and upbeat and much more of a youngish (we are in our fourties) crowd, it's upper market but not at all stuffy. Rooms are small but really nicely kItted out and have a modern yet cozy feel. Wine glasses and corkscrew are provided (nice touch) as wall as a cocktail shaker and cocktail glasses. The mini bar included several nice half bottles of wine with a good selection of beer and mini bottles of liquor. At the foot of Charles street and near the Garden it's a great location and we will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it would have been better.”
Reviews.Author: aperry79
Reviews.Content: I have dined here many times but this was the first time staying in the hotel. My husband and I were staying for the weekend. Arrived on a Friday. Valet guys were friendly and accommodating. Very smooth check in. But they should have more than 1 person working. No upgrade available for Starwood Gold.. They gave my husband a glass of champagne I enjoyed a lemonade. Had lunch and dinner at Scampo. Jess and Lisa are bartenders and were both fantastic! I am 5 months pregnant and Jess made me the most fabulous speciality drink! She really went out of her way to make us feel special. Dinner was out of this world! Pizza was fabulous and the parpadelle pasta was perfect! Scene is great... Down side: rooms are tiny, I had a room with a queen bed and it was ok but I got my sister and her family a room for a night and the 2 double beds were so close to each other there was no room to move in her room. They couldn't even bring up a cot because that would have been a fire hazard. Our tv channel guide didn't match up to the tv. Impossible to watch anything. I had to personally clean my remote control. The towels were like sand paper. The walls are paper thin, I can tell you exactly what the people in the room next to me we're doing and their plans for the day. There was no privacy tag for the door, not even that cool solitary thing that some people get. I was in bed taking a nap with my husband not fully dressed and the housekeeper came right in! We went to catwalk for drinks, everyone ordered their drinks and I told the waitress that I was pregnant and would love a fruity non alcoholic drink to have the bartender come up with something! She brought me orange juice! Straight orange juice! Very disappointing after such a great cocktail from Scampo the night before. She was not attentive and didn't seem to know much about anything. I wish I could say that I would stay here again cause I am a Starwood Owner but I probably won't. But I will eat at Scampo again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Nicole E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is crowded and trendy and unless you are a young single looking to mingle, it is not worth the price of a room.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise for Boston”
Reviews.Author: NonaKim
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels - at least one a week - so I usually have an immediate reaction to one where I haven't yet stayed. First of all this location, while she-she and high end (Beacon Hill), is very difficult to get to with all of the one way roads and construction - be sure to stay away during rush hour! But it's right across the street from Mass General Hospital so if you really get aggravated like I did, you can always check yourself in right as the chest pains start. The lobby is beautiful - the restaurants and bar areas look very inviting. The room service order was quick and courteous but the meal was average at best. The rooms look and feel like a Westin (sorry!) so for a business traveler this is good but I wouldn't call it luxury by any stretch.

Reviews.Title: “The Liberty is what the W aspires to be”
Reviews.Author: NCinDC
Reviews.Content: I visited the Liberty Hotel for three nights in late January. It was my first time staying in one of Starwood's Luxury Collection properties and the Liberty delivered on providing a luxurious stay. The combination of history, room amenities, restaurants, service, atmosphere, and location made the stay one of my best experiences at a hotel. As someone who loves history and architectural preservation, the Liberty was a natural fit. Television screens in the lobby and informational books in the rooms provide guests with the history of the hotel, formerly known as the Charles Street Jail (built in 1851). The prison theme is used in every aspect of the hotel. The massive lobby is beautifully decorated and incorporates the prison stairwells and jail bars. The lobby ceiling appears to be the original woodwork and the four large black chandeliers are nice touches. During check-in, I was offered a complimentary glass of champagne by Patrick, the friendly front desk agent on duty. The room was tastefully decorated and includes a nice minibar selection, high-tech phone system, and a complimentary bottle of water (a rarity nowadays). The bathroom was gorgeous; the tub was nice, but the gray-stoned shower wins hands down. Turn-down service was provided each night and housekeeping always did an excellent job. The "Do Not Disturb" sign is nowhere to be found; instead, a "Solitary" sign and large cell key is provided. Instead of an ice machine, a sleek cooler with individually wrapped plastic bags of ice is on each floor. I suppose that cuts down on the noise; it was a nice touch. Also a complimentary business center (two computers with printers) is located on the fifth floor. I didn't visit the Catwalk Bar (3rd floor), but Clink (2nd floor - lobby) offered a good breakfast. It's also open for lunch and dinner, but I can't vouch for those menus since I ate at Scampo (first floor) instead. Wow, that restaurant didn't let me down. You can read my separate review of Scampo, an Italian-with-a-modern-twist restaurant, but the jist of it: great service and one of the best sirloin steaks I've ever had. Each night Alibi (first floor) and the entire lobby (Liberty Bar) turns into a packed nightclub of sorts. The DJ music and crowds could be overwhelming for a family with kids walking through the lobby. But the people enjoying themselves didn't seem to cause any problems and were generally very friendly. Besides, I think the numerous security personnel kept everyone in line. Each night a different theme takes place in the lobby. For instance, Thursday night featured a fashion show (the escalator from the first floor turned into the "runway") and an energetic jazz band played Friday night. There was a line to get into the hotel, so be prepared to show your room key to the doorman/bouncer after 10 or 11pm. The Liberty is conveniently located across the street from the Charles/MGH Stationâ€Ž on the Green Line. It's three short stops to Harvard Square (I had a great time walking around Cambridge), and a 15-20 minute T ride to Copley Square. The hotel is one block from Beacon Hill; it's a 15 minute walk to Boston Common and a 20-25 minute walk to the North End. (tip: try Al Dente for dinner and Modern Pastry for dessert if you're in the North End) If you forgot hairspray or don't want to pay minibar prices for sodas and snacks, a 24-hour CVS is across the street from the hotel. I honestly don't have anything negative to say about the hotel. I usually offer some "advice" to management when they read these reviews, but all I can say is, keep up the good work. I shall return. Full disclosure: I'm a Starwood employee, but my stay was not business-related, I don't know any of the Liberty Hotel employees, and no one has asked me to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Liberty Hotel is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Lemarier59
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Liberty Hotel in January. This is the old Charles Street Jail. What a beautiful property. When turning this jail into a hotel they did not take away a lot of the "guts" of the jail. There are still bars on many windows and tables for dinner tha sit inside the "cells". The view is incredible and the lobby bar is a lot of fun. Ate at Scampos and had the Lobster Pizza which is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place with interesting history”
Reviews.Author: fredette
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. We were in Boston to see family, but it was fun returning to the hotel every night to see what was going on in the lobby and soak up the lively atmosphere.There was a very happening fashion show on Thursday night and a band on Friday night. Not sure of the program on Saturday night because we got back late and tired and didn't stick around to see. Place was packed, though. We got a very reasonable rate( for Boston) on booking.com. - averaged out to $170 a night. I know their rooms can go for much more. Unless you are young and like to party all night, ask for a quiet room. We requested one, and the staff was very accommodating. They put us on the 14 th floor of the new wing and even gave us a room with a view of the river. Good location near river and across from the "T" ( subway). Also right near beacon hill's Charles st.- a very nice neighborhood. Free coffee available in the morning. I wish they hadn't taken it away by 9:00 on weekdays, though. The room had great bathroom- lovely tub and separate shower. Good bath products. Very comfortable bed and lots of pillows and good comforter . My husband slept much better than usual- had to wake him or he could have slept till noon! Good wireless connection. Sorry I can't comment on restaurants or gym as we didn't use them.my daughter said they are popular in boston,though.

Reviews.Title: “An experience hotel.”
Reviews.Author: okiedover
Reviews.Content: You are greeted with a glass of good champagne and it gets better from there, nice rooms wonderful staff . The food in Clink was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Architecturally beautiful with great service. Won't disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Colleen W
Reviews.Content: The hotel really has done a great job of bringing the unique character of the old jail forward into a cool hotel lobby space. We went for a night out for my Birthday and the hotel was nice enough to send up a bottle of Prosecco, a birthday balloon and two chocolate cupcakes on a platter with Happy Birthday written in chocolate. It was very thoughtful!! A bit on the room and amenities: Room size is adequate, but not huge. Decor is simple and tasteful with a modern/classic style mix. Rooms are very clean and new. Bathrooms are equipped with Molton & Brown products (I don't personally love them, but my husband and lots of people do). They offer bathrobes and plush towels in the bathrooms. The lobby bars are also great at the hotel and even room service was prompt and tasty. Note that the lobby bars/restaurants are very popular right now, so the lobby on a weekend night can be crowded and you have to have your room key handy if you want to be able to get in. They are sometimes full to capacity and then close the lobby for non-hotel guests. I would stay again and now that they are a Starwood Luxury collection hotel you can earn and redeem starwood points. So that's even better!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't mind being sentenced to a longer stay...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingIguana
Reviews.Content: The prison theme was tastefully done, the soaring lobby ceilings captivating. My room, 1509 in the tower, had a lovely view of the city. That same huge window turned out to be a bit of a problem as the tab curtains let in the twinkling city lights a bit too much when we did try to sleep- bring a blindfold if you like darkness when sleeping. Trying to check in during "happy hour" in the lobby, which is also a very popular bar, was a little crowded, but there was a complementary glass of champagne to compensate. Our room was clean and quiet, nothing out of this world, but there was a very comfy bed, and a quiet hallway, although we knew that far down in the "clink" (hotel bar/restaurant) there was much cavorting on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip. Interesting place”
Reviews.Author: Freak77
Reviews.Content: Interesting lobby. Hotel is very lively and staff is helpful and friendly. Rooms are nice and well appointed. Hotel is near many roads and they do a pretty good job of getting rid of the noise. Food quality in room service was fair, not great but staff makes up for that. All-in all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “short overnight for hospital visit”
Reviews.Author: RIBluebird
Reviews.Content: I stayed last night in what turned out to be a very last minute booking so I could be near MGH. The have a MGH rate which was great so I can give high marks for value. If I paid the list price rates, my value would have been a bit lower. The lobby is impressive. The old prison theme is nicely done in the hotel. Although, like another poster, I expected to see more of the theme in the hotel rooms. The lobby bar was busy and inviting. Ordinarily, I'd be more of a bar fly but that wasn't on the agenda for this visit. The room was nice and a fine size for one or a couple. The room overlooked the courtyard. Not an issue with this trip as I was there for a few hours of sleep and shower, but for a vacation, I'd probably want one with a better view. My room had turn down service and was ready for me. This was a bit surprising as I think I arrived less than an hour after the reservation was made. The bed and linens were comfortable. There were some elements of the room that seemed to be showing a little bit of age (some minor scratches, stain or burn mark on the carpet, there was a little bit of rust on the bath caddy), but overall I found everything to be clean. There was no noise from the lobby or city and I found the room to be nice and quiet. The mini bar was nicely stocked. The room darkening curtains were nice and I didn't even realize it was daylight when they were closed. I found the room to be a bit too bright at night. The clock and the phones had very bright back lights and glowed like nightlights. There may have been a way to dim those, but I didn't feel like dealing with it. I ended up covering them up with a towel to get some more darkness. The shower is on the small side compared to other comparable hotels in the city. It took FOREVER for the shower to get hot, like several minutes. I kept turning it up and turning it up. I was getting to the point where I was going to get dressed and call down or bite the bullet and take a cold shower when it got HOT. Once hot, it was hot. The TV channel changing is a bit slow and the trackball part of the remote had some gunk under the edges that was visible sometimes. I'm a bit of a neat freak and think hotel remotes are pretty gross in general and probably look for proof. It is probably not something the average person will notice. The coffee in the lobby in the morning was a welcoming site. Overall, I would consider staying again, either as another short overnight for a hospital visit or for a getaway with my spouse or friends for a weekend in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Our belongings "magically" disappeared. Fitting for the old Prison”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: Now, here's the bad news. Our clothes were stolen and we received zero help from management. We called repeatedly and our calls were never returned. Note to management: please do not respond because you will be wasting your time. You did nothing to help us. So own up to your error and learn from it. Don't write me some condescending, half hearted response. The facts are that clothes were stolen and you did nothing. As far as our stay, the story behind the hotel is interesting and the theme is played up very well, perhaps a little too well. Check in was a breeze, no upgrade, but that was not big deal. They did, however bring us to the wrong room, but we were quickly taken to the room I had reserved. Unfortunately, we had a view of the office building next door. The hotel is clean, modern, a bit chic and tasteful. It ties in well with the theme. The valet is slow, as many people eating there or going to the bar clog up the entrance. I understand the probability for another traveler to have a similar experience to ours remains low. But it is not about what happened, its how it was handled.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the character, well run property”
Reviews.Author: RoadGuy11
Reviews.Content: In te age of cookie cutter hotels it was really a breath of fresh air to stay at a propoerty with a story and some character. I was really impressed with: -the work that was done in designing and renovating the old prision section of the hotel and the way the story was told, really cool -the staff was terrirfic -the nightlife and bars - I live near Boston and had no idea this was such a cool place On the downside - I expected to be sleeping in a renovated cell but wound up in the 'tower' (read - the new hotel that was bolted on to the prison). The room and was nice (not superluxury but well done), quality amenities, nice view and so on....but this part of the hotel didn't quite measure up to the historic section and frankly what I had expected. No specific complaint and I probably should have moderated my expectations but that was the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Service, Crappy Valet”
Reviews.Author: scriptkidd
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location - close to downtown, Nice Views, Historical Hotel, Good Night Life Cons: Slow Checkin Awful Valet - They scratched my new car and refused any responsibility for it. The manager did reverse my valet charge, but I suggest if you love your car, do not valet here.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: pappilan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty Hotel because of its proximity to Mass General, so the loud partying in the handsome central atrium at night was a liability. But the rooms were large and quiet and comfortable, the food at brunch, lunch and dinner always good, and the service so thoughtful and professional it made up for it. The hotel has a fascinating history too, discretely woven into the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Liberty Hotel and found it to be a wonderful place to spend the night. From the moment I pulled up to the Vallet to the time I checked out, everything was fantastic. What I like about the Liberty is the incredible and one of a kind interior of the lobby. It is a renovated historical jail. They even have some of the original bars from the cells. In the winter the hotel is a great place to stay because it has everything you could want right there. The restaurants are amazing, especially Scampo. The bar area in the lobby turns into a fun social gathering for all ages and often times has a fashion show, a DJ spinning tunes and the list goes on. It's probably the hippest most fun place to stay in Boston. And in the summer they have outdoor areas to sip cocktails or have some appetizers. Location is fantastic as well. It's across the street from the Charles River which is great for running, walking, or biking. It's also across the street from Boston's famous Charles Street of Beacon Hill. And at the end of Charles St is the entrance to the Boston Commons and Boston Public Gardens. I especially want to thank Theresa Z. who was at the front desk and checked me in. She has an infectious positive attitude, wonderful smile, and finds a way to get what you need done rather than telling you that it won't be possible. She understands and lives customer service. JT Side note: If you are traveling with a small to medium sized dog, the hotel is very pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Parents Overnight Date”
Reviews.Author: 26.2er
Reviews.Content: My Significant Other and I took a 24 hour sneek away date night to Boston just before Christmas to have a romantic time together. This was my first stay at this hotel, I've stayed in Boston before for business and pleasure. The architecture of the hotel was interesting and eclectic. I loved the champagne at arrival. The service from the valet was spectacular as it was a cold night and my SO had not been able to find his winter coat before we left (we just moved). All in all it was romantic and fun. One recommendation I would make is that they need to have coffee makers in the room for those of us who need coffee asap in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for entertainment”
Reviews.Author: TonyYandow
Reviews.Content: The lobby is amazing. Nothing like the typical luxury hotel. We were there the week after christmas and they still had christmas trees hanging upside down for the lobby ceiling. The rooms are very nicely appointed, the bars and restaurants had incredible food. All of the staff was very professional and accomodating. At night the lobby turns into one big bar. Great for meeting new people or socializing.

Reviews.Title: “New Ownership, Unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: NycToonces
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Liberty twice before and loved it. The rooms and service were first rate, as they should be for an expensive hotel. The ownership has changed recently and the service has gone downhill so much that I doubt we will be coming back. We were there for three nights recently and there were many problems: 1. The electronic room keys rarely work. After the first day when I could not get back in my room, the front desk told me that cell phones or other electronic cards cause a problem, so to keep the card isolated. They gave me two cards, just in case and I kept the cards in an outside pocket of my leather handbag with *nothing* else in it. I emptied the pocket just for the cards. Result? Second day, neither card worked. The cards did work in the elevator, which requires your card to get to your floor, but not for the room. Back downstairs, where I got new cards. This happened every day we were there, sometimes 2x a day. Each time cost me 15 minutes of my day to go up to my room, then back to the front desk, wait for the new cards, then back up to my room. I can fairly say that all the trips back and forth cost me a solid hour of my time. One night, when I could not get back into my room and went to the front desk to ask for new cards, yet again, the man behind the desk took my old cards and slapped the new cards down on the counter, all without a word. I asked him if this was too much trouble, as it was pretty annoying for us and he told me it was no fun for him either. Not sure where to go with that. Sorry I was one of those awful guests who like to be able to get into their room! By the way, I happened to ride in the elevator with one of the front desk staff and her card did not work either. She was muttering about it under her breath, so it appears to be a problem for everyone. 2. The toilet clogged up. Okay, unpleasant, but that can happen anywhere. It was in the morning and we were on our way out to breakfast anyway, so I let them know we would be out for 45 minutes or so and could they send someone to fix it. I was assured they would get right on it. Surprise! We came back, amazingly the card still worked, so we could get into the room, but the toilet was still clogged. Back to the front desk to wait in the lobby, as we didn't really want to hang around the hotel room with the plumber. Another half hour and the front desk came over to let us know we could now use our bathroom. 3. The bathrooms are getting a bit shabby. The tub has a lovely stainless steel caddy in it, one of those shelves that sits across the tub and holds sponges and soap. The caddy was rusty, which is pretty unpleasant to look at, quite honestly. Plus, the floor tiles had what looks like tar on them, probably from the previous tenant's shoes. I would not say the room was dirty, just not quite up to the standards of an expensive hotel like The Liberty. I love this hotel, it is absolutely gorgeous, just beautifully done, so I am hoping these are growing pains. But I will check for other reviews here before I book a room there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, unique, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Impactdancer
Reviews.Content: A gorgeous hotel, with a lot of character and an amazing reception/lobby/bar area. Originally booked because trip advisor listed it as one of the top ten most unusual hotels and it certainly is worthy of that. If you are reading this, you probably already know the hotel's history, so won't bore you again with the details. Really enjoyed every minute and Scampos, the restaurant downstairs, is definitely worth a visit even if you just have one of their delicious, gourmet pizzas. High quality rooms, public areas and service. Just a few minor disappointments that could have an affect on it overall. 1. The showers take a good 5-7 minutes before the hot water comes through. 2. Cleaners need to rotate or check the freshness of the complimentary body lotions because ours smelt musky and off. They should also check all the relevant literature and accessories are in the rooms. We had no minibar price list or do not disturb sign. I think this is because they are so unique, previous guests had taken them as memorabilia. 3. Although every other member of staff had an amazing attitude, one guy serving drinks in the lobby at 1pm ish on our last day (Jan 2nd) had a really bad attitude and he really didn't deserve the tip we left him. No idea why we left a tip, habit by that point I think. 4. We understand that local taxi drivers have a really low opinion of one of The Liberty's doormen and are not shy in telling customers about it (not sure exactly what he has done to get this reputation!). Saying all of this, these complaints really are minor and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone for a memorable stay in Boston. Go to Bar Lola for tapas - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice visit with great restaurants nearby.”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelleB
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and really enjoyed our visit. Nice lobby, good ambience, convenient with adjoining Clink restaurant & lounge. Mid-week they have different events in the lobby to attract and entertain. We especially liked the Wednesday night Jazz trio. Scampo is also located in the hotel and it excellent. Hip place to be and be seen it seems! Nice contrast of the historic Charlestown jail and modern hotel. Friendly staff and complimentary champagne at check-in, turn down service, etc. Our room was nice and fairly quiet for Boston which was nice not to have a lot of street noise. Located in a quiet part of town means it is a litlte out of the way of activities and attractions, but easy enough to get around with the "T" station right across the street. On the negative side, they need to get softer towels. Oh my! I've never seen towels like this before. They were like sandpaper. I actually cut my knuckle on them. A hotel of this caliber should have nicer/softer towels. They offer complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning which was nice, but they did run out this morning at 7:45. At turn down service they give u complimentary water, but with 2 registered in a room you'd think they could spring for another 25 cents and leave TWO bottles of water so each guest could have one instead of just leaving ONE for two guests. I would recommend this hotel to others because they are doing a lot of things right ... it was very clean and the restaurants are fabulous. We tend to be out most of the day and by evening we want to stay close to the hotel so this was ideal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Kathi L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a weekend stay, and we were so impressed with the service and location and it was such a romantic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel; great bed, great service”
Reviews.Author: mpark730
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on a Friday night in December and had a great time. The room was very nice, on the cozy side, but not unexpected for a city hotel. The in-room amenities were great; tv, very comfortable bed and linens, couch. The hotel is very clean. We were wondering if it would be loud in our hotel room because the lobby area/bar areas are very active (lots of hotel guests and locals/other tourists and music) during the weekend nights - but there was no spillover. We actually liked the way we could grab a drink and snack in the main area and have fun and then retire to our room without having to go far away. The complimentary car service was terrific too. No waiting for a cab! The location is nice, right on the Charles and next to the T stop and Beacon Hill, so easy and quick (<15 min) to get to Downtown Boston or Cambridge without having to be inside either

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Jenminem
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on New Year's Eve, and was awoken at 7 am by something in our room buzzing. It wasn't a smoke detector, it wasn't a carbon monoxide dector, but something coming from behind the TV. We had to call the front desk to have them take care of it. It took them about 10 minutes to send someone, and then it took that person about 15 minutes to take care of it. I can't think of a worse time for this thing to start buzzing than 7 am on New Year's day, when I've paid twice the normal rack rate for this room. I was very upset and called the front desk to complain. The person was insincerely apologetic. He offered to comp me for the breakfast order I had placed the night before. I was fuming, and ready to leave the hotel but my partner just wanted to go back to sleep. When we received the comped breakfast the next morning, they messed up the order. To add insult to injury, they later billed my credit card for the comped breakfast! The food here is average, the room is average, but the service is abysmal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvsdogz99
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there for 5 nights for the first time and we LOVED it! From the gorgeous Christmas decorations in the lobby (decorated Christmas trees hanging upside down from the ceiling!!) to the glass of complimentary champagne upon check-in (and a nice glass of sparkling lemonade for our 10 year-old!) to the lovely accommodations.....not to mention the superior service. We ate dinner one night at Scampo and it was wonderful. The food was out of this world. We will definitely stay there again when the need arises!! The only complaint I would have would be that our double beds seemed a bit small. It was fine for our 10 year-old but to me they seemed to be oversized twin beds rather than a true double bed, albeit they were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: KennyTizzle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the night of my company Christmas party. The lobby during Christmas time is breathtaking. The room was clean and well maintained. Had any and all amenities I would ever need. My only regret is that it was a one-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great bars... Less than mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: lauren w
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I live in Boston and have been to the bars at the Liberty often, but have never stayed the night there until this past New Years Eve. Upon arrival, the concierge was pleasant and accommodating, but understaffed considering the huge event that the hotel had going on that particular evening. Once we finally were able to check in to our room, we realized that they had us on the top floor on the corner, which we thought was an unexpected upgrade. However, once we opened the door, we saw how wrong we were in that assumption. The room was poorly maintained, with scratches and random paint marks covering all the furniture. The bathroom was decent, but had a rusty bath 'caddy' holding the bath products, which was somewhat of a turnoff. The closet door had a cheap hinge on it that lead me to believe that it was broken, until my boyfriend figured out how to open it as we were walking out the door to check out. We ordered room service for lunch which was not only inedible, but probably the most overpriced meal I have ever had ($60 for a salad and a cheeseburger). Overall, I would most certainly never stay at this hotel again nor would I ever recommend it to anyone; I think that a Holiday Inn is cleaner and has better quality rooms than this hotel. For $500 a night, it was definitely not worth it and I would stay at the Four Seasons for that price. With that said, the lobby is beautiful and it is still one of m favorite places to go out and get a drink in Boston. Scampo is also an amazing restaurant; they have a wonderful wine selection and high quality food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to hang out - - Rooms don't live up to the lobby”
Reviews.Author: flastatebucs
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at this hotel. I travel here on business. Driving up to the hotel is quite a cool sight. When you enter up the escalator and then up to the lobby you are wowwed by the character of the building. What a fantastic idea and theme. The vibe was very energetic and the staff has always been top notch. My issue with this hotel is that for the price you pay, I'd expect a much better room to equal the coolness of the rest of the hotel. The rooms were very clean and a decent size. For example, the towels were very thin and non absorbant. Something you'd find at a Holiday Inn. The beds were very very average. I'd give the comfort a 5 out of 10. Also the bed linens were just, again, average. Lastly, the water pressure for the shower was very light. Other times that I've stayed in Boston, I've stayed at the Nine Zero and the Bay Back Hotel. These hotels I'd prefer to the Liberty Hotel. I've also eaten at Clink - - which was outstanding !!! Just upgrade the rooms and this hotel would be well worth the price to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable common areas...rooms standard”
Reviews.Author: penntf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Liberty Hotel one night and really enjoyed the atmosphere in all of the common areas. The hotel used to be an old prison that they converted to a hotel. This is actually one of Starwood's luxury properties. Here are the details: Check In - The check in experience was wonderful. We arrived via cab and the bellman took our luggage and was unbelievable nice and friendly. We took the escalator to check in and were met by a nice woman and a glass of complimentary champagne (nice touch). The entire hotel staff was wonderful. Lobby - The lobby is so cool with the old original brick walls of the prison exposed. They have a few bars in this space and they're great. My wife and I got a drink at the bar and hung out for a while and listened to some live music. Great atmosphere. Rooms - Very clean, but very standard. The windows are floor to ceiling and we had a great view. The only issue that I have is that the hotel is very impressive, but the rooms are underwhelming. They almost have a modern feel. I feel as though they should have carried some of the same themes from the prison motif into the hotel rooms. I would have also hoped that they kept some of the exposed brick or original beams. Don't get me wrong, the rooms were nice, but way too standard for a "luxury collection" hotel. Restaurants - We didn't eat at any of the restaurants, but have heard that they're wonderful. They definitely look outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “This Jailhouse Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Texastravveler
Reviews.Content: We were on a trip to the Northeast to show our grandson (6) a little history. What better place to go than Boston, what better place to stay than the Liberty. He kept looking for the details that were "jailey," and there are quite a few, but no prisoner ever lived with this kind of luxury. We took the Duck Tours which he loved and he also loved watching those boats go into the water from the window of our room. The funkily named "The Clink" is a quality restaurant. It is often full--so beware that you need reservations. When this happened to us, they found us a quite table upstairs on the "Catwalk," the bar. The location of the hotel is superb for those who like to walk and enjoy the ambience of the city and the Charles River. I believe they said that you could borrow a bicycle for a ride along the river--but we did not do this, so perhaps you rent them. In any case, we enjoyed the walk--or run for our 6 year old. This is not an inexpensive hotel, although like most big city hotels, the deals are a little better on the weekend. I hope you find it as much fun as we did.

Reviews.Title: “At first if you dont succeed....fix it:)”
Reviews.Author: jgdogwood
Reviews.Content: It is seldom I start out being put in a room that I hate, have a problem with the valet and room service and have my attitude turned around on a dime....but the service and management at the liberty exceeded my expectations. I am the first to understand human error but to strive for a satisfactory result is true excellence Thank you Liberty Hotel & the Staff Jeff PS Dont face the alley:)

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: EscapeNow
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 10 on a Sat night, the lobby could be mistaken for the hippest club in Boston. This didn't ditract from a speedy and welcoming check-in and complimentary glass of champagne (Italian pink lemonade for the 6 year old). I have stayed in a number of luxury hotels around the world, but our Liberty room, topped the list for comfort. Terrific mattress, down pillows, perfect thermostat, incredibly quiet, great shower pressure. Beautifully furnished & maintained. The hotel itself is quiet special architecturally, a very sensitive refurbishment of the old jail. A number of small touches that I love? iPod dock, free morning coffee in the lobby, laptop sized safe & super fast complimentary WiFi. Staff were so helpful - we experienced a 7 hour turnaround on our laundry, they safely held our pre-delivered package, they assisted with the icepacks that we required for our onwards journey. Steps from MGH, a CVS pharmacy, train station, and the upmarket restaurants and shops of Charles St. On the fourth and final day of our stay in a Deluxe King Courtyard View room, our daily service didnâ€™t arrive until 4.15pm. Given that we were leaving the following day, it wouldn't have bothered me, but I had requested one to be done by 4pm, because I had friends arriving for a drink. A small let down on an otherwise terrific experience. Would not hesitate in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, high quality hotel with a nice location”
Reviews.Author: ncg1983
Reviews.Content: This is truly a unique hotel in central Boston. A former jail (until 1991!), this property certainly has some interesting history. The exposed brick and courtyard/atrium is really fun and looks great. The rooms were quite nice as well, with high end finishes and touches. The location is quite convenient, as it's adjacent to the Charles Street T stop and very close to downtown Boston. Would highly recommend for a business or leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel with Historical Significance”
Reviews.Author: LeftyWilbury
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here one night as a quick getaway with my wife. The hotel is housed in a former city jail which dates back to the 1800s. A full make-over in 2007 has transformed this hotel into one of the coolest hotels in the area. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by all staff including the valet (parking is expensive, but you are in a city with expensive parking anyway). The unique multi-storied lobby blends the former jail space with modern touches and is an inviting place to hang out. We received glasses of champagne and headed to our room which was in the "new" wing. While the room was nice and clean, it was decorated rather blandly in contrast to the lobby and the "old" portion of the hotel. We dropped our bags and headed back to the lobby for a pre-dinner drink. Here the service dropped off a bit, we waited for 20 mins for our order to be taken and then another 5 to 10 mins to be brought our drinks (nibbles arrived very quickly in comparison). The waitress was very nice and apologized for the wait and the next round was much quicker. Upon returning after dinner the place was rocking. The bar downstairs (Alibi) was packed with attractive young people dressed up for a night on the town. The lobby was filled with similar folk and the 3rd floor "catwalk" provides a perfect place to people watch and is exclusive to hotel guests. Although we didn't try the restaurants, we are told that both Clink and Scampo are pretty good, if expensive. All in all I'd definitely recommend this hotel for people who are looking for a fun hotel which offers more than the expected. Similar to a "W" without trying hard for the "cool" factor. Next time, I'd like to stay in one of the rooms in the former jail portion of the building.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: lynette14
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay to celebrate my husband's 40th. We arrived on Friday at 5 and were immediately greeted by the staff. Chris, our bell hop, was extremely knowledgeable and his insight helped us plan our nights accordingly. As we followed the escalator up we realized what a fantastic looking hotel it truly is. Check in was no problem (free glass of champagne although we declined) and our room was clean and we could see the Charles from our window even though we had a direct view of Mass Eye & Ear. Who cares, there is so much sight seeing to do down in the lobby! It did appear they were short-staffed on Saturday night, but since we were guests we could sit up on the third floor and look down and people watch while having our drinks - very nice. We also could by-pass all the people waiting to get into Alibi. Very sweet. Pro - We found the bathroom to be larger than expected and I liked that there was a shelf under the 2nd mirror for all my girlie stuff. Con - The towels and robes have been bleached so much they do feel like cardboard. Pro - the bed was comfortable. Con - the tv kept shutting off. Free wifi is always awesome and it was cute that the phone and tv both had my name on them. Con - Clink was not that great. The staff was eh. My advice on the menu is to add some selections that appeal to the meat & potatoes guy. My husband was lost. They also desperately need to broaden their beer selection in all bars. That said room service was fast even though I was told 20 -30 minutes, our meals arrived quickly. Pro - The T is right across the street which made getting to Downtown Crossing and Quincy Market easy (2 stops up). We did use cabs Saturday night and the Door Men had a heck of a time getting them. Thank God we allowed enough time before our show started. By the way The Wayans Brothers were awesome. Alibi is a lot of fun. We found the crowd fun to watch and the DJ on Friday was awesome. We also liked dressing up for once. The ladies dress in high heels and dresses so I was so excited to dress up. Alibi starts to get really crowded around 11:30 so I would advise getting there way earlier. We lucked out both nights (Friday we were there around 10 and Saturday around 11:30) with finding tables that weren't reserved but again it was by chance. All in all we enjoyed our stay at Liberty and will come back. Beautiful hotel, great staff, and it was nice to see people dressed up for once!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous lobby, smaller room.”
Reviews.Author: DrTToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty over the US Thanksgiving weekend. Upon walking in, we were impressed at the layout of the lobby...very impressive, and posters outlining the heritage of the building as a former jail. Check-in was quick and champagne was offered. Later when I needed to talk to the front desk, it was a bit slow, but nothing too bad. Front door staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was smaller than expected as we had a "deluxe" room that was supposed to be more than 425 sq ft. We had a crib in the room, and it felt a bit cramped. The turndown service and ample complimentary water were appreciated. We missed having a coffee maker since we needed hot water for baby bottles. The barware was very nice however (clearly this hotel caters to a different kind of guest!). Bed was pretty comfy, and the bathroom was lovely. Overall a good experience, and I would recommend this property as the location was a great starting point to explore Beacon Hill, and it was a change from other chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeoTheo
Reviews.Content: Being a former prison, the cool factor of this hotel is almost reason enough to stay here, but combine that with friendly service, two restaurants, decent little fitness center, nice rooms, and most of all the free glass of champagne upon check in, and you have a really nice hotel choice. I give it only four stars because it's not the highest end hotel in the world, but it is very stylish, has nice Molton Brown bathroom products, a nice selection of wines and snacks in the room. iPod dock, big bed, everything is clean and nice. Free internet connection in the room. Rooms are good sized. Chocolates with the turn down service. Good location next to the riverwalk and Charles Street. Wish I had more time to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: hopeful953
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel recently to attend a wedding. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the room was clean and nice. However, our room was on the side of the building which faced an alley leading to Mass General Hospital. This was apparently a delivery entrance for the hospital, as well as the place that the garbage dumpsters were emptied. Several times during each night, I was awakened by very loud "crashing metal" noises. In addition, the closet was the smallest one I have ever encountered in a hotel room, and there were only three small drawers for clothing. When I took a bath, the faucet handle fell off into the tub. Even though we received the discounted rate for the wedding attendees, I felt it was very overpriced compared to other hotel stays. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Missing the Small Things”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this property before but upon my second stay I felt I needed to do it again. There were some things that were lacking this time around and I wanted to let them be known. The hotel is nice, the rooms are clean, it's a decent stay. I stay in many luxury hotels around the country but this time the Liberty was lacking. There are certain things I expect and they did not deliver. The bed was not comfortable at all. The mattress was lumpy and hard. They only supplied 3 small pillows for a king bed. I had to use all 3 to equal a normal size pillow. The tv was really small compared to other hotel rooms I have stayed in. The valet and bellman were not very good at attending to the guests needs. One night there was a line of about 5 different parties and we all needed cabs but there were none to be found. Some people actually walked down to Charles St and flagged down cabs. That should not happen. Just an overall lack of care for the guests. I will be staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravelgal523
Reviews.Content: The liberty hotel was an old jail that was renovated to be a modern hotel. Our room had an amazing view of the Charles river. The nightlife in the hotel was very happening but the hotel rooms were very quiet. Location was great! Next to the red line stop and Charles street. It was a short walk to Boston commons and fennuel hall. Only negative was the hotel restaurant, clink, had awful service. Very slow and they gave us the wrong food.

Reviews.Title: “Left poor last impression”
Reviews.Author: Charliebugs_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel two weeks ago. Everything went well. Accommodations are great. Lost drivers license in bar. Followed up with waitress next day who indicated that she had found it and turned it into security. Waitress confronted security guard about the missing ID. Security claimed they never received it...

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless Night”
Reviews.Author: MBM66
Reviews.Content: We had a very disappointing two night stay at the Liberty. The main problem was that sleep was impossible between the hours of 2 and 5 am due to drunk hotel guests yelling, fighting and talking outside of our room. Our room was near the elevator so that location contributed to the problem - and it did not seem like the noisemakers were the same room or group. Notably, we did not have this problem on our first night at the hotel. The hotel did have some positives, the champagne upon arrival and comfortable rooms, great location, and a beautiful and unique lobby. In addition, the valet staff was wonderful. We called the front desk with the noise problem, and they did come up right away. Because the noise seemed to be people from the elevators, it was hard to stop. We were also disappointed with the housekeeping staff. On the first day, they failed to remove our dirty champagne glasses from the room, and on Saturday morning, after the sleepless night, they entered our room at 9:15. I'm not sure whether the walls are particularly thin, we just were unlucky, or whether this hotel attracts the party crowd, but the night was so bad last night that we will avoid staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken C
Reviews.Content: I had originally heard of the Liberty Hotel while watching a local news program. The hotel was originally a Boston jailhouse that was renovated into a luxury hotel. The lobby still retains much of the original structure, including the jail cell bars. The front desk staff was very helpful and because it was my wife's birthday, they gave each of us a glass of champagne to take to our room. In the room they also had a chocclate cake set up for her. We were very impressed. The room itself was very comfortable and modern in decor. The hotel also had several bars and restaurants on site including Alibi and Clink. Alibi is a pretty fun place to socialize in the evening. We did not get a chance to eat at any of the restaurants on site, but they certainly looked nice from outside. Liberty's location on the Charles River makes it very central to most of the major hot spots in Boston. If you're looking for a great, upscale hotel teh Liberty Hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “a serendipitous stay!”
Reviews.Author: danielle_1027
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Liberty Hotel for 1 night after the hotel I originally reserved had an issue with its pipes that rendered some of its rooms unavailable (i.e., it was overbooked). After arriving at the Liberty, it didn't take long for me to feel happy about being re-routed. Upon checking in, the receptionist was very welcoming & even apologized for the mishap at the other hotel, which was no fault of the Liberty. The hotel lobby is stunning & the history of the building is *perfectly* integrated into the decor. The hotel isn't in the most desirable location (adjacent to Charles / MGH) but it's 1 block from the Red Line T & walking distance from the North End (15 min max). My room was spacious (including a large bathroom with tub & shower) & had Molton Brown toiletries & the most beautiful neutral colored cashmere blend cable knit blanket over the bed vs a traditional hotel duvet. I received complimentary champagne at check-in & there was free coffee in the lobby the next morning. The view from my room was of a motorway, but I wouldn't expect a 2nd floor view to be particularly nice anywhere. Service at The Clink was painfully slow, but I would rate my breakfast a 7 out of 10. Overall, my experience at the Liberty was fantastic & I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston or Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money~disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Nordic1
Reviews.Content: Boston is well-known for it's ridiculously priced hotels (4star and above), but this one takes the cake. My husband and I are in Boston quite often for both work and pleasure and have stayed in a number of hotels in the area. We decided to try the Liberty even though it was priced higher than other hotels in the 4+star category. For over $500 per night we got a very tiny room with basic amenities and 2 dirty glasses of champagne that were left by the previous guests. When asked about a possible upgrade I was told there"was nothing in my category or class" What does that mean? After spending $500 for one night I would have paid a little a more to see the river instead of practically being able to touch the "Eye Clinic" and see patients in their exam rooms. The staff were friendly and there is a definitely a young vibe happening. We ate in the more casual restaurant (there are 2 on the premises) and the meal was good as was the service. One suggestion for management would be to get some kind of light positioned outside so that taxi's can see that there are people waiting. It took over 20 minutes to get a cab one evening. There are hotels in this category that will provide you with more bang for for your buck. Avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Historic location with modern facilities”
Reviews.Author: Trekking48
Reviews.Content: The former Charles Street Jail, circa 1851 has been renovated into a modern hotel, keeping many of the historic elements, including some of the original cells in the lobby bar. Check-in with Calvin Cherry was a fantatic experience, including the complementary champagne. The new tower rooms are modern and clean. Located in Beacon Hill, great location for visiting Boston. Love staying in a hotel complete with updated facilities with such a unique history. Part of the Starwoods Luxury Collection for all you SPG point collectors.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJKCAT
Reviews.Content: We've been to the Liberty before. Although an expensive place to stay, there's not a hotel like it anywhere in the area. Perfect ambiance, food, drink, decor and the service/rooms are beautiful. This time we were there during the "surprise October snowstorm". We had planned a birthday weekend and had to cut it short in order to get back before the storm hit. Without any ado, the front desk cancelled our reservation, apologized for the inconvenience (like the major storm was their fault?) and wished us luck getting home. I was delighted (and surprised) that they did not make us pay a cent for the night we didn't stay - even though there wasn't a 24 hour notice. This experience just makes the Liberty the only hotel choice we'll make when visiting Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great view for 4th of July”
Reviews.Author: AdziaB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unique. Beautiful inside, the room was nice & cozy. The bathroom was perfect!!! There are lounges & restaurants in the hotel which was convenient. Had the view of the river & fireworks through my own window! Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Different; trendy; dorks, geeks and models”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrierMD
Reviews.Content: I've stay here a few times. My experience has been remarkably consistent. The hotel is an upscale boutique hotel, a converted former jail. The service is typical "hotel trendy" (pleasant, but cool, no follow-through. Examples: room not ready; they take your cell, promise to call--don't. Concierge-not present or too busy; they do like to offer champagne, which is nice). The hotel is next to Massachusetts General Hospital and is convenient to dowtown Boston, Beacon Hill, and the MIT/technology complext just across the river. It also has a popular bar/nightclub. Thus, it has an interesting, mixed ambience and clientele: dorky academics and doctors; technogooks, and beautiful people/models etc. Rooms are sparse and modern. Fitness center is decent. The Red Line part of the "T" is right out the door. Each time I've stayed here has been fine, but I usually prefer top-notch service, thus my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: cbmullen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! And what a great place to people watch! We stayed in the jail section. They said it might be loud at night, but we didn't hear a thing. Didn't even have to drive into Boston. We took the bus to south station, then hopped on the red line of the T, and the hotel was right across the street.. Within walking distance of the north end. We ate at the Clink restaurant which was excellent! I would absolutly stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: SaradaSatapathy
Reviews.Content: I satyed for 7 nights and this hotel is the happening place basically in the evening. The fashion show and the live band was awesome. All the services provided is being simply excellent. The staff attitude here is simply excellent. I would prefer to stay here in all my visits in future. I recommend this hotel to one and all who happens to read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Architecture, history, luxury, outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: AutumnSkylar
Reviews.Content: This is a unique hotel in the world. It has a breathtaking architecture and decoration, insteresting history and an outstanding service that is not in your face. It is conveniently located in Boston, next to MIT Sloan buildings.

Reviews.Title: “A unique find”
Reviews.Author: Courtney S
Reviews.Content: We cashed in Starwood points for a last minute stay in Boston and are glad we picked the Liberty! It is a really neat hotel, didn't feel like a cookie cutter big chain. We were greeted with a glass of sparkling wine at check-in. The room and bathroom are a standard layout, but they include several extras that make it a bit different: Molton Brown toiletries and various glassware to use during your stay, so we weren't drinking wine out of water glasses. We did have a major hiccup upon check-out, which is why I only gave it a "very good" rating: we had to wait twenty two minutes for our car. When we paid $42 for parking, we were not happy to wait that long, especially when we were headed to the airport for our flight home. And the most bothersome part was that it took fifteen minutes before anyone tried to explain to us what was taking so long. Other than that, we really enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Liberty!”
Reviews.Author: lizisaacs
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Liberty, I realized I left my laptop in the cab that I got out of. Despite a busy night at the bar, many members of the staff jumped in to help me out. The valet was calling different cab companies, security was reviewing camera footage and the front desk was offering me free champagne to calm me down :) The cab driver came back with the laptop and a fabulous vacation followed. The restaurant was great and the service was excellent. It is the ONLY place in Boston I will stay at in the future. Thank you Chris in Security and Akeem at the valet!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the historic and beautiful Liberty Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beachbum426
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend getaway and the hotel was gorgeous. When you first enter the hotel, it takes you back to when it was once a hotel with their prison cells and the large open check in area. The rooms are very clean and the hotel staff was amazing! Our room wasn't quite ready but they offered us champagne and sitting in the lobby was great! you could take in the history as well as the elegance of the updated hotel. The atmosphere was great! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Liberty”
Reviews.Author: dmacq
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Liberty because of their Halloween party. When I saw that the Liberty got mixed reviews on service, I was a little nervous. However, I was pleasantly surprised because the service was outstanding. Alison at check-in was very friendly and the complimentary glass of champagne was a nice touch. The room was a little too close to the elevator for my taste. However, when I spoke to Calvin and requested a room change. He said, no problem and moved us to a lovely room with a view farther away from the elevator. The rooms are nicely appointed, the beds and pillows are very comfortable. The bathrooms are modern with bathrobes and ample space. The location is good for the Back Bay, but not within walking distance to Faneuil Hall or the harborfront. The hotel was over $400 per night (which was probably due to the Halloween party), however I have stayed in most of the finer hotels in Boston therefore I don't think it is a value. I would recommend the Liberty, but make sure you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel in a modern luxurious setting!”
Reviews.Author: zarma1
Reviews.Content: The bedrooms were beautiful... I loved the lobby. The hotel has an active night life and both restaurants are delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “History + elegance + vitality = Liberty”
Reviews.Author: msfrolic
Reviews.Content: After only viewing the hotel online, I was very impressed with the entire property in person. We arrived at 5:30 p.m., before their evening social event. Even though our room was not quite ready (check-in is 4), they offered us champagne while we waited. Just sitting in the lobby and taking in the richness of the building and seeing evidence of the actual jail was amazing. A suggestion, if you are staying on a weekend, do not ask for a cell room as they are right above the lobby and the noise level depending on what's going on could be a distraction. The lobby is transformed nightly in to something different, one night a catwalk for a fashion show, another more like an upscale club. The room was great, wonderful views (worth paying extra for) of the river and city. Great sunsets from the room and in room dining that was quite impressive as well - definitely not your typical "room service". Great restaurants and bars abound in the hotel and nearby and easy access to the T - Boston's subway/train system. Can walk easily to Charles Street, Newbury Street, the Gardens, North End - really a central location. If the symphony is in town, that is worth visiting as well. Overall, very satisfied with the Liberty and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tom2002a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty Saturday 10/22. To get right to the point our biggest complaint was check in. From start to finish it was over an hour and a half. Valets overwhelmed 10 - 15 minutes, then up to what looked like a short check in line. At the Liberty, they easily take 10 minutes plus to check in a guest. They serve a glass of champagne and engage in allot of chit chat that if thereâ€™re wasnâ€™t a line might be ok but there was a building line and it wasnâ€™t. Then we are told the room wasnâ€™t ready please have a seat in the lobby - we look around and there are at least 5 other parties waiting for rooms and seats were hard to find. If we were early Iâ€™d understand but it was after 3pm and there is no excuse. When we got up to the room it was fine with good views and quality furnishings but small compared with other 4 Diamonds in Boston. Down to Alibi for a drink, sit for 10 minutes without service and we give up. Went over to the Scampo restaurant for dinner - no complaints at all. Scampo is top of the line with great service. Up to the room and notice the Lobby is packed with 20 somethingâ€™s. Turns out on Friday and Saturday nights the Liberty Lobby Bar is the place to be if your in 20â€™s. We pass the bathrooms and youâ€™d think you were at a 1972 Zepplin concert -- heavy waves of pot smoke. Up the next morning, no paper outside the door and no coffee maker in the room. Down to the Lobby to find the air has cleared but the self service coffee has run out - over to the Lobby â€œJailâ€�? restaurant another 10 minute wait for coffee. Look whoever rated this 4 Diamonds from Triple-A wasnâ€™t there when it was busy and was very charitable in putting this place on the same tier as Bostonâ€™s other top hotels; The Taj, Elliott Hotel, etc. The Liberty is a definite notch or 2 below with smaller rooms and obvious property management issues. There is much better available in town at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Randy W
Reviews.Content: Best specialty hotel we have ever stayed in! The suite was incredible with amazing views. Restaurants were a little pricey, but the room value was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel museum”
Reviews.Author: Grangalo
Reviews.Content: What a special place to be! The place is a museum by itself. The restauration of this place is wonderful. Really nice lobby with a louge style bar. Walking distance from the public park Boston garden. The only bad comment is that the carpet of our room was dirty, but all the rest was very nice. Nice mini-bar in the room with a large selection of alcool.

Reviews.Title: “Unique,interesting and fun”
Reviews.Author: marica810
Reviews.Content: I read about this hotel in a magazine about interesting places to stay and always wanted to try it. We live in nearby RI so our trips to Boston are usually day trips.
