I bought a certificate at an auction for 1 night at the Liberty and Breakfast included so we made a night of it. We are Boston Bruin fans so we bought tickets to the game against Tampa on the 8th of October.Our room was in the tower away from the Lobby . The view was not great (mass general) but it was clean and nice. (I figured we were there since we had a certificate-which we did pay for). I would request a room with a view next time ( and probably have to pay more).The check in process was a little slow but we did arrive before check in and our room was ready so all was fine. We decided to eat dinner at one of pubs near the TD Garden so can't say much about hotel restaurants for dinner. When we came back from game with our Bruins attire on we couldn't believe the amount of people dressed up and waiting in line to come in the hotel. Felt a little under dressed but we were in a great mood from Bruins Victory so we went to the The Catwalk for a couple of drinks. It was great. Its only for hotel guests and we could relax and we met some nice folks. Highly recommend the Juniper Blossom ( I think that's what it was called). I was tempted to try some home made potato with smoke truffle salt but was still full from our dinner. Next time!. We did not find the noise from the lobby a problem at all. We went to Clink for Breakfast and it was very good. Our breakfast was included with our certificate but my Credit card got charged. One phone call to hotel and charge was removed. Wish we had stayed longer to try the outdoor patio and Scampo. Will definitely come here again. The location was perfect,.. Could walk around Beacon Hill and we walked to the TD Garden ( About 10-15 min walk) There was a T station directly across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: msserene
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Liberty! It is so beautiful and fabulously decorated. The lobby and lobby bar area are just amazing to hang around in. Our room was fabulous and the view of the Charles River a great bonus. Loved the bathroom. Great walk-to location, too. Could walk all over Beacon Hill neighborhood, to the Commons quickly and the areas around there, the Charles River shore, etc. Enjoyed the lobby bar so much we stayed and ate dinner at the bar. Great bartender, good drinks/wine/beer menu and really good food. Very quick to on ramp to airport----were at airport in ten minutes after checking out. Oh, and when we checked out and got our car from valet, they had put two bottles of "Liberty Hotel" water in our cup holders. Not one complaint---all was just great. We will certainly stay at the Liberty Hotel when we go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: scootyp470
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights in September (2011) for a business trip. I cannot comment on the room rates as we had a corporate group rate and it was picked up by our company. The hotel itself is very cool with it's histroy as a jail. The television in the room showcases the history of it and it's pretty facinating. Room was very clean, food in Clink & Alibi were great. The staff at the hotel was on par with a Ritz. I would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Shameless Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuideReader
Reviews.Content: On the way home from a business trip in DC, flights were delayed far into the evening and I knew I would miss my connection out of Boston. While sitting on the runway for over an hour, with a cell phone rapidly running out of power, I needed to find a place to stay there -- I wasn't going to land until after midnight. With a dying phone, I called all the places I had stayed on previous occasions. All were full. Not wanting to arrive at midnight with no options, I asked for recommendations. The only place that had a room available was the Liberty which I had never heard of. I knew it was an upper end hotel (I did ask the rate) and figured it was better than sleeping at the airport. When we pulled up to the entrance, the cab door was opened by 3 very drunk young men who invited me to step out as I was trying to pay the driver. The hotel behind them was pulsing with techno-pop music and the entrance was swarming with equally inebriated people. I made my way to the front desk by weaving my way through a lobby jammed-packed with hundreds of 20 and 30 somethings, dancing, drinking and having a seriously good time. The band was in the lobby. I could not hear a word the front desk guy said. Through pantomime and yelling directly in each other's ears, the front desk guy and I got more or less squared away. He handed me a key and then pointed to the elevators. By this time it was nearly 1:00 AM and I was pretty much finished for the day. I reached my room (which was in an adjacent tower removed from the historic building) and found the TV on, playing a self-congratulatory loop about the history of the hotel which for more than a century served as the Suffolk County Jail -- hence the name "liberty" which I found horrifyingly insensitive and actually rather perverse. The room was small and unimaginative, the touted thread count a deception, and the room pretty grubby and gray. No tub. Shower cleverly designed to seem larger than it actually was, and lined with some kind of plastic "stone" veneer. Nothing at all special about the room, and yet the rate was $700 for one night. Seriously. After my hard day of travel, I would have felt better about treating myself with a really great room. But this rate for this room was outrageous and impossible to justify. Frankly, I would have felt ripped-off at $400 a night. I understand (from their video) that there are more interesting rooms in the original jail building, but I think they are twice the price. The hotel brings in business by serving as a night club. I commend them for their creativity, and would have forgiven the chaos at my arrival had it been a bad luck, one-time thing, but apparently, they have a party of one kind or another going on several times every week. Finally, I can't begin to say how arrogant and insensitive it is to have actual jail cells with bars as the architectural focal point throughout the main part of the hotel. The brink and vaulting ceiling of the lobby are truly beautiful, as is the original ironwork throughout, but they are JAIL CELLS. I could not think of anything other than the suffering that must have gone on there for a hundred or more years. The developer should be ashamed of himself for turning a prison into a an over-priced penal Disney Land and dismissing a serious societal issue.

Reviews.Title: “For an expensive hotel could be much bette”
Reviews.Author: Rohit R
Reviews.Content: It is supposed to be a luxury hotel, but the attention to detail in a true luxury hotel is lacking. First evening, the bar lost our order and it took 45 minutes to get an order of fries. They made up by complimenting our drinks, but it would have been good if they had got our order right. Room is OK, bed is a lot less comfortable than at the Sheraton. All TV channels do not work (channel 33 - USA for example), and our toilet flush needed to be adjusted each time to make sure it did not run. Not what you expect from a high end hotel. Service was acceptable, not exceptional. The lobby is a night club at night and loud, which means that it is not possible to relax in the lobby after hours. The location is awkward for cabs, it takes a lot of maneuvering to get taxis in the midst of all the traffic. Would certainly not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, with nice rooms, and great location”
Reviews.Author: DCHOTELGUY01
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood member, and there were few good choices in Boston the night I stayed here. I paid close to $400 a night, which is more than I usually would spend. The hotel is very nice. It has a very interesting history as a converted prison from the late 1800's. It is a bit trendy and hip, which I enjoyed. The lobby is especially cool. I did not try either restaurant, but they both looked good. They are lots of local neighbor hood places to eat and drink to just a short walk to Beacon Hill. The rooms are nice, see the pictures attached. I stayed in room 1103 with a great Charles River View, and City View. Get a odd number room, on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Chaotic and Sloppy: valet stand at the Liberty on a Saturday night”
Reviews.Author: tellalltraveler
Reviews.Content: Last Saturday night I drove a friend and myself to the Liberty Hotel to meet up with some other friends for drinks. While I know the Liberty is extremely busy on weekends, I couldn't help but be appalled by the unprofessional, sloppy service at their valet stand that night. After jumping in my car, the valet slammed the door shut, revved the engine to 30MPH to go all of 200 yards down the driveway, and then left my car running and unattended there. I watched all of this in horror, as my BMW - the most important of all my worldly possessions - was left idling by itself, almost inviting any passerby to jump in and drive out the other end of the driveway with it. I could not believe that this was the service I was expected to pay $20 for. I recounted this episode to the manager on duty that night, and while he was somewhat sympathetic, he did not offer any sort of monetary rectification. Suffice it to say, I will make every effort to avoid the Liberty's valet stand going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Richard
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the hotel liberty and had a great time there. We had a room on the 13th floor and stayed there Sunday to Wednesday. it was spacious with a huge bed and a great bathroom (particularly the very deep tub). The lobby is spectacular and a great place to have a drink. We also found the staff very friendly and helpful. Great location too, both in terms of seeing the sights in Boston and transport for further afield (right by a metro stop and good for the airport and driving out of the city).

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel on the site of Boston's former jail”
Reviews.Author: CarpeNox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a one night "getaway" at the Liberty Hotel on the Charles River in Boston. The Liberty is an appendage to the old Charles Street Jail and provides a unique lodging experience. The atrium of the old jail forms a multi-story lobby with balconies leading to the former cells. Rooms are in an integrated addition and provide everything you would expect in a modern luxury establishment. The service was attentive without being intrusive. The bar off the lobby, aptly named "Clink", was very busy on a Saturday night and we appreciated having a room on a higher floor away from the noise. The room size was slightly above average for a city hotel with room to relax on a couch near the big window which afforded a grand view of Boston by day as well as by night. Rooms are not inexpensive but you get commensurate service.

Reviews.Title: “But, if you're interested in staying at a club....this might be the place for you”
Reviews.Author: 700mumtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a historic property centrally located in Boston. However, herewith are my cons with the hotel (this is my very first time to review anything....) 1. The hotel turns into a full out club on Friday and Saturday nights. Complete with bouncers, velvet ropes for the line around the hotel, and hotel employees dressed like they are out on the town. 2. The noise level (Friday night featured rap artists) through 2 AM is on par with a club. Pick a room above the 6th floor if you actually want to sleep. 3. The prison theme is big at the hotel. Apparently, this extends to the bathroom towels. Thin and scratchy. 4. Ummm..my personal pet peeve. Gross, long hairs on the shower wall that stayed there all THREE nights we were there. Not a big fan. Wouldn't go back. Our friends stayed at XV Beacon. Would probably check that one out instead.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel facilities were great, staff need a little encouragement”
Reviews.Author: zarainlondon
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at the Liberty Hotel as my other hotel that i had booked in was fully booked. I arrived late afternoon and was quickly checked in, the lady at check in offered me a glass of champagne which was nice. I'm not sure if i was upgraded, but the room i got was larger than i thought i booked. I had a hallway and a large corner room overlooking the river. The bathroom was huge and had a lot of empty space. Definately a good size. The room had great amenities including all molten brown products and a well stocked mini bar. As it was my first night in boston, i decided to utilise the hotel restaurant and bar for dinner. I had two drinks at the lobby bar and then went for dinner at the clink. Whilst sitting in the bar, a lot of the staff appeared to be standing around talking to each other and ignoring a lot of the guests. As someone that travels alone regularly i am used to eating by myself. I must say i did feel slightly ignored by my server. As a lone diner i am more inclined to tip more, however in this scenario it was not the case, i felt like i wasn't explained the menu and noticed the servers talking and interacting more with guests dining in couples and groups, i felt a bit ignored. The most attentive person in the restaurant was the bus boy. I almost wished i could have directed that my tip went to him. He was by far the hardest working person in that restaurant. I watched as he chatted with guests (myself included), was on the ball with clearing and topping up and with running food. I wish i had gotten his name so that i could mention it as the other staff could have taken advice from him. He actually made an effort and smiled the whole time. the food was okay, i had the chicken though it wasn't anything special. The hotel itself has an impressive lobby and is definately worth a look, and the rooms and facilities were great, if only the staff could be a bit friendlier this hotel would be great

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: JMacHtown
Reviews.Content: Lobby was ridiculously loud at night (rap group performing one night). Hotel rooms were just okay, although the view/location was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not blown away”
Reviews.Author: traveloracle1964
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay here as a result of Hurricane Irene. We took refuge in Boston, rather than sit if our in Cape Cod. It was pouring with rain when we arrived, one take an escalator from the entrance to the lobby/reception/bar. The noise was horrendous, once we reached the check in desk (10 minutes), it transpired that there were 2 weddings going on simultaneously and guests from both seemed to be everywhere, as were dogs, one the size of a horse. So firstly if you are looking for a very loud cacophony and a menagerie, this is the place for you. I had 2 rooms, was upgraded for one of them to a corner grand deluxe, nice enough, though only one bedside light for a twin set up, a little odd and when I mentioned this to the duty manager, his response was perhaps the hotel wasn't for me! That aside he was friendly enough, though needed some serious training when it came to customer care. The second room was a little cramped; basically it was nothing special, though nothing bad. The gym is located at the end of the lobby/reception/bar beyond the lifts, itâ€™s a windowless cupboard and looks like an afterthought. We had one meal in the evening at the hotel and thereafter ate out, very uninspiring. How this hotel can be part of any "Luxury collection" I have no idea. The problem with it is that is doesn't quite know what it is and who itâ€™s catering for. Once they sort that out, then perhaps it would improve. Finally, though I hope this was a one off occurrence, the hotel parking team lost our car they had parked and it ended up after 45 minutes for me to have to go and find it in the 7 storey car park, strangely it was park right by the entrance! Yes the location is good, but the hotel is well...................itâ€™s just ordinary, feels like any airport hotel chain, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “not friendly”
Reviews.Author: Val39Kent
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in 2008 with some friends. One evening- after a hard day's sightseeing- one of our group dozed off (in an easy chair- and quietly) while we were having a quiet drink in the main lounge. A member of staff immediately came over to us and said that 'they didn't permit people to sleep in the lounge' and that we 'should remove him immediately or management would be called'!!! A group of 4 well behaved, money spending, 50 year olds !! We needed a couple of minutes to rouse our friend - during which time a member of the management hovered around making sure he was leaving the area! It looked a great place, good location, clean good rooms- BUT I would NEVER stay there again or recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelcdn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September while attending a convention. Since I hadn't booked it myself, I didn't bother to use tripadvisor to research it first. Which made it a nice surprise when we checked in, since the hotel was everything I usually look for. Lots of character (it used to be a jail), luxury (the bathrooms and beds were great), and unusual touches (the lobby becomes a bar, and they have special events for dogs, art shows, fashion shows, etc.). The location is also great, located across the bridge from Cambridge, near Beacon hill, and within easy walking distance of lots of historical attractions in downtown Boston. Price seemed steep - we got a special rate of $259 as part of the convention, but I've heard the regular rate is almost double that.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious hotel with an interesting past”
Reviews.Author: bernandpaul
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel is in a great ocation on Charles Street overlooking the river. The most fantastic thing about this place is that it used to be a jail, one famous inmate was Malcolm X. The staff are so gracious and you are offered a glass of sparkling wine upon check-in. The restaurant is excellent and overall the vibe is hip and relaxed. Running path along the river is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Drsugar
Reviews.Content: Our fifth stay was as fantastic as our first stay in this superb hotel, which is a brilliant and award winning makeover from Boston's notorious old Charles Street Jail (which was Court-ordered to close several decades ago because of overcrowding). The comfort of the rooms, world class quality of the food outlets, and especially the excellent level of personal service will continue to bring us back to the Liberty Hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Bonus”
Reviews.Author: SandraR2001
Reviews.Content: We were due to visit Cape Cod but decided to stay in Boston because of Hurricane Irene approaching. We booked at the last minute not knowing what to expect. The reception is very impressive and the staff were all friendly. Our room was lovely, clean and the bathroom was gorgeous with lovely Molton Brown toiletries. The complimentary tea/coffee in the morning was a nice touch. We had lunch and dinner in Clink and both were excellent and good value. Our dinner in the Italian downstairs was excellent too. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A great place and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Polar_Caver
Reviews.Content: Sitting in the hotel as I write this. Great service, very nice hotel. Great location, but you do really pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every Starpoint!!”
Reviews.Author: jammer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty for one night on our way to Bermuda. Delta had us staying at the airport or a hotel, so we opted for The Liberty. I am so glad we did! It was a short ride from the airport. We were treated with a glass of champagne and a very helpful staff. We had dinner at the Italian restaurant at the hotel. Food was excellent, but the restaurant was very noisy. It was a Friday night and the bar was hopping. Dinner was pricey but worth it. The hotel, a former jail, is truly a work of art. I loved everything about it. It is very pricey, so Starwood points let us stay in an upgraded room with a great view at no cost. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Bash!!”
Reviews.Author: Runnergirl89
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Liberty for New Year's Eve this year. We had a fantastic time! We have stayed here before for a wedding and a weekend getaway. This trip was just as good as the previous ones. The lobby of the hotel turns into a giant party after dark, weekends and especially holidays like New Year's. Last year's theme was Masquerade, so everyone was all decked out in their Mardi Gras and Phantom finest. The different levels of the lobby, and the different ballrooms had different DJ's playing completely different music. We had a blast! The room itself was very nice. The linens and bed were very comfortable. The bathroom always has great toiletries. There is a separate standup shower and bathtub, so you can take your pick. There is an electric candle in there for ambiance. The only downside is that the lighting in the bathroom isn't the best for getting ready, ie applying make-up. But, it's not a bad trade-off for what you get in return. Check-in and check-out can get a little crazy, but it's a very popular hotel, so you just have to be patient. We ate brunch at Clink in the morning on New Year's Day. They have a delicious make-your-own bloody mary bar. The food was good, not 4 star quality, but definitely very tasty. If you're in Boston and want to stay at a unique hotel, try this one, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Liberty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pking24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Liberty Hotel the day before Hurricane Irene hit landfall. The Hotel is very interesting architecturally. The room we were in had a view of the harbor seen as a reflection in the Hospital window across the way. The room was not cleaned well and showed signs of wear, odd for a newer property. The Hotel lacked a pool and a good workout room. The best thing about the hotel is the restaurant Scampo. Excellent italian food. Worth the time to seek out. The location is excellent to Charles River Esplanade. The Hotel permitted our dog which was great. We were to be upgraded to suite but left early because of Irene. The concierge and front desk help was very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: data_wrangler_nyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Liberty Hotel for a night on a business trip, and was very happy with the property. Rates were fair, and my room was very comfortable and well laid-out. Nice touches included a variety of glassware at the mini bar (including martini glasses), a really good selection of stuff in the fridge and snack drawer, two robes, iron & ironing board in the room, etc. Worth mentioning as well that the bathroom was HUGE. The bar downstairs -- Alibi, get it? -- was a ridiculously hip destination, and when I got back to the hotel around midnight it was PACKED, and they asked to see my room key before they'd let me in. Went down for a drink, and especially the patio was clearly a destination night spot in Boston. All in, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic architecture, gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: Mikomajor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Liberty on Starwood points on a quick stopover in Boston, and I wish I'd been able to stay longer & take better advantage of the hotel - the architecture is very creative, yet chic (especially the lobby that's an amazing open space): an old prison turned hotel. The rooms and amenities are great (granted, I was upgraded and had a nice suite), and the views are fantastic. I had a choice between this and the W Boston and the Liberty is by FAR a better choice on all accounts,: the W is just tacky and unoriginal in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: jmfortin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couples weekend...had dinner in the Embersol Suite and everything was just wonderful. We stayed in a "regular" room, but it was great...very comfortable and clean, fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachandgolf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my brother and his wife stayed during the Labour Day weekend. Actually my brother is the one who found this hotel online -- we all thought it was really cool to stay in a former jail. The architecture is amazing in the lobby. Our room wasn't ready upon check-in so they offered us an upgraded room at no charge. We ended up staying in a corner room that was just amazing. Huge bathroom, huge bedroom, very comfortable bed, tv and free internet. We absolutely loved our stay. The hotel is close to a lot of different things to do -- park, shop, dine -- whether you are walking or taking a very short cab ride. The rate for the room was very reasonable and we would absolutely return for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location & food, but hold on the attitude”
Reviews.Author: HBandWF
Reviews.Content: I recently joined my husband (a returning guest) for a stay at the Liberty. Although the lobby was everything promised - cool with a great party vibe, the attitude of the staff person checking me in immediately put me off. He was rude and condescending and acted like he was doing me a favour by "allowing" me to stay at "his" hotel. (Unfortunately this wasn't a one off, as a later interaction yielded the same attitude!). The complementary glass of champagne somewhat lifted my spirits and I headed to our spacious and well appointed room. Disappointing was the shower - you had to let it run for at least 5 minutes to warm up, then it only had one temperature - HOT and no water pressure. Quite the opposite was the AC which sounded like a jet plane taking off and no matter the set temperature, blasted cold air into the room. The frequently replenished Molton Brown toiletries however, were appreciated but the wifi never worked! The best thing about this hotel is the nightlife and the restaurants. Scampo is amazing and the view from the mozzarella bar made for a fun and tasty evening. Alibi is a great place for a drink as is the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the spot for nightlife!”
Reviews.Author: Lbachman789
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family for my sister's birthday. It was beautiful and the person in guest services, Calvin was amazing! He got us a reservation for dinner at a great resturant and had champagne for us as we registered. The bars had great drinks and were hopping all night. Seemed like the hot spot in Boston! The rooms were very nice and so were the resturants. The only part that I didnt like was the water pressure in the shower. I had to rinse the shampoo out of my hair with the bathtub facet because the pressure was so bad. Other than than that I highly reccomned this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT POSH PLACE TO STAY IN BOSTON AT REASONABLE RATES - GRAND RECEPTION !”
Reviews.Author: billandzeny
Reviews.Content: A chic, hopping place for visitors and Bostonians. I was greeted with a bottle of wine on ice, a slab that said HAPPY BIRTHDAY, a chocolate cupcake and a fresh bowl of sweet strawberries when we arrived !! What a grand treat for our first time visit to celebrate my birthday ! Great, notorious history. Walking distance to antique shops and wonderful breakfast/ lunch eateries on historic Charles St., posh South end, and the museum of Science. Close to the river. Across is a train station to take you downtown or the wharves. Take a train to the Sam Adams Brewery (past Ruggles) into Stony Brook, and hop off China Town for a wonderful Chinese cuisine on your way back. Don't forget to visit the North end, with its wonderful, delicious Italian cuisine. Go to Bricco's for dinner - one of the top 10 best Italian restaurants in the U.S. Go to No Name Restaurant by the wharf and have a delicious lobster dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkinfl
Reviews.Content: A former jail has been transformed into a high end, upscale hotel. Great restaurants within the hotel. It is wiithin walking distance of Beacon Street and small shops and restaurants. Also, not that a far walk to Boston Common and the Public Garden. Welcoming glass of champagne upon arrival. Bathrobes and slippers. Well appointed room. It is also near Mass. General Hospital. Great choice if you are looking for a luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky boutique hotel that makes jailhouse chic”
Reviews.Author: 1775DC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Liberty Hotel for three nights in August. We loved location - we were in close proximity to Beacon Hill and we could walk across the street to watch the sailboats. The hotel itself is funky and hip yet still has traditional luxuries. The "Solitary" signs outside the door, the beautiful exposed brick walls, and the catwalk jailhouse atrium with enormous black iron chandeliers were subtle and fun ways to bring out the history of the building. The towels were large and of high quality, the bath products were ample and made by Molton Brown, our bedroom was spacious, and we had a fantastic bed --- the mattress, pillows, sheets, and blanket were all high quality and made for the perfect night's sleep. I was recovering from food poisoning and slept a lot - housekeeping was accommodating: cleaning the room only when we were out (sometimes not until the evening) and even asking if they could help me with anything. My husband votes it his Number One hotel experience. And I rank it high in my Best Hotels List, too.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overhyped”
Reviews.Author: v4nnm
Reviews.Content: My Boston-based friend recommended this hotel to me, although she had not stayed here - only used the bar downstairs. Regardless, the website looked good (don't they all?) and on arrival the lobby is a big 'wow'. However, there the good stuff ends rather abruptly. For $400/night, I was expecting more. A lot more. For example, when i walk into a room with a price tag like this, I don't expect the bathroom tiles to be simulated tiles; I want real tiles. Tiles that make my feel tingle. When I'm in the shower, I want to hear the water on tiles, not a 'cheapo' plastic base that the water bounces off, spills out of all over the bathroom floor and around the shower mat. I want a nice view - not one of the airconditioning units in the adjacent hospital (ok, I know not all the rooms are going to have a great view but come on!). On the plus side, it was a very quiet room, excellent drapes that kept all the light out and a super-comfy bed. We also used the bar downstairs for a party of about 30 and the service there was very good. I didn't eat at Clink. Wifi is reasonably fast throughout the hotel. Check-in was prompt and efficient, glass of champagne if you wanted one etc. Courteous reception staff. But, overall ... overpriced, over-rated and over-hyped. I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "luxury" Hotel-Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Sam K
Reviews.Content: This accomodation was one of the worst experiences for my family and lovable golden retriever. From the outset, it went from bad to the worst. Not "pet friendly." Upon arrival at 3:30 pm, the room was not ready, even though check in is 3:00 pm. Clerk asked if we could find something to do for awhile...in 85 degree heat in the middle of Boston. We waited a few minutes and asked if there was another room availlable. She found one on a lower floor but could not give it to us until a manager overrode the original reservation. This took another 20 minutes. The room was very small and despite the website representation that a dog bed and bowls would be available, I had to call and waited another hour for them. Poor dog was thirsty from waiting in the heat. The TV did not work so front desk had to send an Engineer to troubleshoot. He had to contact cable provider, which also took awhile. Doors/walls were paper thin and there were children running up and down the halls late at night. Despite best efforts to keep the dog from barking...including letting him sleep on the bed...the imposing security guard was called by neighbors and we were told that we would be asked to leave in the middle of the night if it continued. The kids finally went to bed and all was quiet. Upon checkout we were double billed for one night's valet parking ($84.00) and spent more time correcting it. Terrible experience!!! If you have a pet, stay at the Fairmont; excellent by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “We expected a lot more from this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lkkack
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 4:00PM and our room was not ready. Check in time is 3:00PM. We were told to take a walk around the hotel area and give them our cell phone number and they would call when the room was ready. We finally went back at 6:00 PM because they had still not called. Our room was ready but we had to stand in the long check in line again! This was very disappointing. The staff that is outside, valets and others were wonderful and very friendly as well as the hostess at Alibi in the morning. The check in people need to take some lessons from them. The rooms were very nice and very clean and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous--we all agreed”
Reviews.Author: museumgrl
Reviews.Content: After a positively miserable night spent at Hotel 140 in Boston, I found a fantastic deal for the Liberty Hotel and booked it for our next night in Boston. I knew the moment we entered the driveway, this was going to be a great choice. Yes, the parking is expensive. It's a city. You just have to deal. You can search for metered parking near the hotel. From 8 PM to 8 AM, that's free parking. Upon check-in which was cordial and efficient, my husband and I received two glasses of champagne. When we opened the door to our courtyard room, my husband gave me the look which means, "How much are we paying for this room?" The truth was, we paid the same rate we paid at the grim Hotel 140. We had a huge room with plushy carpet, floor-to-ceiling windows, an exquisitely appointed bed, and, to ice the proverbial cake, Molton Brown toiletries in the enormous bathroom. Yes, this is a noisy, lively place. If you need absolute silence, I would not recommend this hotel. This is a former jail, so the rooms radiate from a central enclosed area. Noise reverberates up that area. We live in a very noisy city, so noise is not an issue from us. I would stay a week in this hotel and hope I can find a good rate the next time we are in Boston. This place is very cool.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel convertied from an old jail!”
Reviews.Author: andrewv45
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast, good service, great bar and patio in evenings. Hip , Cool but still comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: My trip to Boston was only for 2 days but my experience inside the hotel was very good. The room was fairly large with a sitting chair, desk and king bed. The bathroom was almost as big as the room and included a stand alone shower and a soaking tub. The hotel staff was very nice and always wanting to help. The glass of champagne at check in was a nice touch that goes a long way to remember a hotel. The only complaint I have is that the mattress and pillows were sub par. For such a nice hotel the mattress was not that great. Other than that it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed staying at the Liberty Hotel/ ignore the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: stetson
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our two children and got a King room and a Double room on the 13th floor (1310/11). Our room had a great view/ the kids room had no view at all. The jail aspect of the property also made it a bit more special. The location is great with restaurants nearby. We also borrowed some bikes for a ride down the Charles River. We were there only one night and did not try out the bar. We did get Campaign at check in even got a night cap after dinner on the house. The baths were very nice and the entire room was very clean. Valet parking was $42, but very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool, luxurious and awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bos2n
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for the weekend last month while visiting family. We got a rate that was very reasonable (for their basic room) and it did not dissapoint. The room was plenty big, very well appointed, had a nice view of Charles River. The minibar is AWESOME. Granted we couldnt afford to eat anything in it, but the quality of items were a reflection of how well they do things at the Liberty. The bed was really comfy, the bathroom was huge and has a shower and bathtub. Overall the quality of the room was 5 star. We used the gym everyday, nothing special, a few treadmills, free weights and an all-in-one machine, but got the job done. What really sets this hotel apart is the staff. They were all extremely welcoming, helpful and courteous, and you can tell they have been very well trained. From the door and bell staff, the desk agents to our housekeeper, everyone was always making sure we were enjoying our stay and wanted to make it better if they could. We also used the free bikes they have available, a really cool option to ride along the river. This will be our go-to place when we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: SANDNSEAMa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great location. Everyone in the lobby checking in guests were so nice and helpful. Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alan R
Reviews.Content: Arrived and were nicely greeted by doorman and desk personnel. Offered a nice glass of champagne on checkin. Bell staff was excellent, rooms and bed quiet, comfortable and nicely appointed. I recommend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wierd lobby decor, nice room but uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler050
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredibly expensive for a room not available until nearly six p.m. when check-in time is 3 p.m. The rooms are nice, if small, bed uncomfortable, check-in wait is way too long, reservation was mixed up, and location only so-so. I wouldn't stay there again. Bell staff were great though.

Reviews.Title: “it doesnÂ´t worth”
Reviews.Author: Guiv37
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel, the lobby is very lively, with lots of young people! the room is very confortable, anyway nothing special, just like a Hilton one. No decoration at all, very simple, it doesnÂ´t worth 360 dolars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience...great location”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyLisa
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was beautiful, with great amenities and service. To top it off, we received champagne with check in. The hotel itself was a former jail turned into hotel and I loved the how they blended the concept of a jail house with a posh hotel. With our hotel package, parking was included, which was a huge bonus since most hotels charge an extra $42.00 a day to park your car. Our breakfast at Clink was very good (they have a "make-your-own" bloody mary bar, if you like Bloody Mary's), the hotel staff was friendly and accommodating, and with a bar in the hotel you do not need to leave to go out at night! The hotel is directly across the street from the red line and within walking distance to Faneuil Hall and Boston Commons. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: happyredcruiser
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience was very positive. Upon arrival our room was not ready, but we had a glass of champagne and enjoyed the lobby - lots of people watching and a great space. Reception was very pleasant. Room was well appointed and clean. We did not receive our turndown service 2 of our 3 nights, but a very small point. Great location for watching the July 4th fireworks! Also close to subway so easy to get anywhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury?!?!”
Reviews.Author: rhkim
Reviews.Content: Checked in today and I am floored by how dirty the rooms are. My room is missing a picture on the wall, the decor and wall paint is not very modern, and the carpet is disgusting! My husband and I reserved a king room and when we checked in we were given double beds! We complained and apparently the hotel is fully booked. I am very very disappointed in our room and the hotel. The room is not a room in a luxury hotel but more like a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A jail you'll enjoy”
Reviews.Author: ns1991
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Liberty Hotel for a weekend in Boston. While it wasn't exactly cheap, we felt the overall experience was well worth it. Liberty Hotel is a former prison, rebuilt as a hotel about ten years ago. You can still recognize a general layout of a 19th century jail, and they did leave bits and pieces in place. We liked our room - clean, well-appointed, good quality furniture, excellent view of Boston. The staff was very helpful. Valet parking was surprisingly inexpensive (for Boston), something like $36 for the whole stay. Boston is not a car-friendly city, so an option of forgetting your car for three days was nice. The hotel is within an half an hour walk from pretty much any place you'd want to visit. One definite minus is the bar - both the layout and popularity with young professionals. There are no spots for a quite drink - it's loud all the way up. I wish they switched off the speakers on one of the floors. That's about the only thing I didn't like about the hotel. The noise is limited to the bar - the rooms are quiet. We didn't use the hotel restaurant - it is said to be good, but there are plenty of excellent (and cheaper) places within 5 minutes walk for breakfast/lunch/dinner/what have you. You can walk to most places of interest in downtown. Boston Science Museum is a 30 min. walk away, and a fairly pleasant walk, too.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: Citymominthesuburbs
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Liberty. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is terrific, right across from the T. Free bikes are a nice touch as is check in champagne. Rooms are a nice size and bathrooms very pretty (separate tub and shower). Great restaurants and bar in hotel. Gorgeous lobby and interesting history.We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Liberty Hotel has a view of the Charles River”
Reviews.Author: Debra G
Reviews.Content: The Liberty is beautiful as you enter the lobby. The front part was originally built in 1851 as the Suffolk County jail, and continued as a jail until 1990. Mass General now owns and operates the hotel (opened in 2005). You will be served champagne upon your arrival. Do not use your debit card to pay.....it will freeze your bank account. There are four restaurants available within the hotel. Wifi is available. If you drive your own car, have the valet park it, because the parking lot will be filled with lots of taxi cabs and there is not much space. The "T" train/subway is right beside The Liberty making it very convenient to get around - Fenway Park, Harvard, MIT, or to the outer edges of Boston. Also, Beacon Square and Beacon Street (Cheers Restaurant) are only a few blocks away....easy walk. You'll enjoy your stay, but ask for another room besides the one on the third floor right above the dumpster....that is not a quite area. It's a beautiful hotel, and the staff are very accommodating, especially when it comes to "whistling" to grab you a taxi. If you get a chance, make sure you have dinner at the Union Oyster House......ummmm good seafood.....lobster.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boston Hotel MGH Hospital Families”
Reviews.Author: joansumie
Reviews.Content: Liberty Hotel great service and restfull stay for families visting MGH Hospital for family member surgical care. .Lively fun resturants, good morning breakfast and great nite dinning. Our hote room overlooked the Boston Charles River with all the boats sailing .A beautiful sunrise and sunset views.Large and beautiful decorted rooms, bedroom and bathroom with all the best amenities. A great weekend stay in Boston .

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating design and great service”
Reviews.Author: brooker1970
Reviews.Content: The hotel's design is unique and fascinating, with aspects of the old jail still visible. The lobby is a tall, cathedral-like space that fills up with dressy guests on a Saturday evening: a lively, classy atmosphere. Rooms are nice, neutrally-decorated, stocked with Moulton Brown products in the bathroom. The Catwalk bar is exclusive to guests and serves quality cocktails at a good price, with a great view of the lobby space. My companion and I particularly appreciated the service from New Hampshire girl Corylee, who was charming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: SunDapple
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Liberty hotel in Boston, for one night on a family business trip. We wanted a place in the Beacon Hill area of Boston. This hotel was on the edge of that neighborhood, but still had all the charm and great access to what we wanted. I loved the easy access to Charles St and the great shops and restaurants along that street. Bell Service was the best I've experienced in quite a while, prompt and friendly without being overly so. The recommendations he made for restaurants were spot on. Registration desk staff were welcoming and friendly (thank you, Theresa, for your warmth and the glass of champagne). Unfortunately, we left an item of priceless sentimental value in the room. We were at the airport when it was discovered so we called the concierge to see if we could have some one go to the room to get it, but we did not hear back. When we arrived home we e-mailed and got a pretty generic response, so I don't feel much was done about it, but c'est la vie. This does not in any way affect the quality of the hotel or its concierge service. Everything lived up to our expectations, and then some. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and would recommend it to friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a former jail!”
Reviews.Author: Nachtrieb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Liberty every three weeks for the last year. Good points: excellent location, Â professional and friendly staff, one-of-a-kind charm (former jail!) Not-so-good: Very fashionable and loud place on Friday and Saturday nights, lots of beautiful people to wade thru on your way to the elevators.Â

Reviews.Title: “Go To Jail”
Reviews.Author: gnolect
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel is a beautifully renovated 19th Century jail well situated for touring Boston. It is part of the Starwood Luxury Collection and we stayed one night on our SPG points. The lobby is very impressive, a large open space that artfully retains the feel of the center atrium of the original prison. While there are a handful of rooms in the old prison building, the real hotel is a rather conventional highrise block in the back. So it was a bit disappointing that our room was pretty standard issue, good sized but not over spacious, and not at all themed to the jail. It could have been any room any where. And our room faced the back so it had no view. Clearly there's a premium for front facing rooms which have wonderful view of the city. The Clink restaurant and the Alibi bar are converted cell blocks with prison-bars still in place. Clearly the Alibi is the happening place... upscale and VERY crowded. We didn't even try to go in. The Clink for breakfast was very good and a fun place to eat. Boston is a walking city and the hotel is well situated to walk. A morning stroll through Beacon Hill is well worthwhile. Overall it is a good hotel, very good service and helpful staff. The room itself was good but not great. The best feature of this hotel is the lobby. Unfortunately I expected more from the room in a luxury hotel. Definitely worth staying once, but I'm not sure I'd spend 12,000 SPG points on it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, unique - pricey”
Reviews.Author: courtneymcglynn
Reviews.Content: It's a former jail with bricks and iron bars evoking it's former status. Two of the bars are "Clink" and "Alibi". We got the room 1/2 price that was overlooking the alley for $200+tax. It was nice but other than being fairly new with a spacious bathroom, nothing special. If I had paid full price I wouldn't have been happy. Great location near Beacon Hill and Charles St.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: frappeboy
Reviews.Content: Through the company I work for, I was given a one night stay at the Liberty; It was a beautiful building - if you don't stay over it's at least worth it to go get a drink in the lobby bar and check it out. For starters, when we checked in we were given two glasses of champagne. That was nice and not something I'm used to. That's the other bit, this hotel is way more expensive then anything I normally stay at. I think the 'cheap' room was the equivalent to a 'nice' room I would book myself. Maybe this is run of the mill...not sure. The Liberty has a bunch of restaurant and bar options, which I won't get into, but they are obviously a bit on the pricey side. (We ate at Scampo which was delicious and well worth the cost.) Our room overlooked 'The Yard' (and outdoor lounge area) and when we went in our room I thought the staff had left the radio on, but no. It was just the band performing outside. We were quite worried this would go on all night, but luckily it stopped at 9pm - because it really was very loud in the room. The room was nice. Bed was quite comfortable, had a nice TV. The bathroom was spacious with a shower and a separate tub and it came with robes. Would I stay here again? Yes. But will I? No. I just don't spend that much per night on a room. But if you have the money or want a special night out, its definitely a fun place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury redefined”
Reviews.Author: Dzierbicki
Reviews.Content: This is the 6th day of my stay at this hotel. One more and this terrible experience will be over. Service does not exist. Front desk will promise you everything but then nothing happens. Whole IT system (TV, phone, wifi) has been down for entire week now. I asked for engineer twice, but noone showed up. The worst hotel experience ever and for 400$/night it is a robery. Pity my wife and kids had to experience that too.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in-room, but noisy lobby every night of stay. Large bathroom but small counterspace.”
Reviews.Author: snowBoardBunny
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at this hotel. I still find in-room to be quiet. You can't hear your neighbors but you can hear people out in the hall. The lobby becomes a party place after about 6 pm so be ready to fight your way out to the front driveway if you are going out at night... Even during the weeknights. On Friday just before lunch, it took about 20 minutes to hail a cab for me. I was 4th in line. I ended up having to raise my hand to hail it myself cuz the whistle they use wasn't very effective. The front design of the building could be better, but I love the large bathrooms, the separate bathtub/ shower. And the quietness and the aircon of the rooms is heavenly after an extremely hot and muggy day. Room service was fast our first night, but that was the worst pulled pork sandwich ever--- pork was dry, they added ham and pickles so it was too salty, the bun was reversed so the sauce drained right off the meat and onto my shirt, and the pork was NOT marinated. Also the sweet potato fries were NOT that sweet. No more room service for the rest of our stay. But all other services were done well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic escape”
Reviews.Author: sunnyb6301
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a Saturday night at the Liberty Hotel for a romantic anniversary get away. The lobby is just stunning, and our room was nicely appointed. We got a good deal through priceline, and even ended up with a view. The champagne at check in was a very nice touch. We loved it. Once caveat: as part of Starwood's Luxury collection, the hotel is obliged to let guests name their own checkout time - which is nice for the departing guests, but really challenging for the hotel to have arriving guests'r rooms ready on time. There were a number of angry guests at check in (made the champagne even nicer), and there should have been more staff at the desks to make things go quicker. However, the staff we did speak to were extremely gracious.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Stay, Will Do So Again”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: My first time at this new Starwood Hotel. I booked it using a free stay from Starwood. Very pleased with location. Next to the T stop. Views of Boston skyline and Charles River. Very interesting lobby. Good restaurants, bakeries, and convenience stores nearby. Quiet room. Only problem was extremely low water pressure such that I could not take a proper shower. History of jail/hotel as explained on the TV is fascinating.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MumaRules
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay at this hotel for some time and finally had the opportunity when we were in Boston for a wedding. Upon check-in, we were given a glass of champagne. What a nice way to start off our stay at the hotel! We had a king-size bed, which was very comfortable. The bathroom was especially nice. There was a separate shower and tub, and plenty of room in there for both. I was a little worried about the noise level since the lobby can be pretty noisy with all the restaurants and bars but was pleasantly surprised that the room area was nice and quiet. Parking is steep ($42) so you may want to look elsewhere to park your car, which we did. The location is convenient to the T, so it is easy to navigate Boston from this hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Unmemorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: islabery
Reviews.Content: This hotel concept is unique and interesting, and the lobby is definitely architectually impressive and grounded in the historical roots of the building, but the buck stops there. There were very few other impressive aspects about the hotel or about the stay. A redeeming factor was the location of the hotel - it was fantastic and suited to quaint strolls down the cobblestoned streets of Boston. The rooms were pretty standard, with the exception that the minibar was the most impressive I've ever seen! Anything you could think of (including a romantic kit) was in there! For a cost of course... The service was noticably absent during the stay, and equally unhelpful when we were trying to find locations to have our engagement photo shoot. There were very few "personal touches" to our stay, and for the most part the hotel felt too large and impersonal for us. For the price and standard of the hotel, we were grossly dissappointed. I would consider other options in the area, perhaps with more of a special feeling and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy and buzzing plus high standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: 100daysperyear
Reviews.Content: The Liberty is definititely one of the most happening hotels in Boston. Rooms are comfortable and of high standard. Internet is free. Nightlife is buzzing in the bar and the lobby (not the place to stay if you like quiet though). The place used to be a prison a long time ago, so it has some character. Only letdown are the restaurants - service is not up to par and the food is overpretentious and not that good. Price is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, noise, noise”
Reviews.Author: Jisen
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed by my experience with the hotel. On the second night of my stay recently for a business trip, a sudden persistent noise woke me up at close to 12:00 am of Sunday morning. Called the front desk, the clerk could not tell what my room number was. I had to tell him how to find it on his phone pad. Then he did not believe in my complaint and sent an engineer to verify. After verification, another room was offered to me, but with traffic noise right outside the window. Certainly wonâ€™t stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: JonesGirl_01
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for work in Boston last month and had the good fortune to stay at the Liberty Hotel while there. The hotel has beautiful, well-appointed rooms with gorgeous views of the water. There's plenty of good food and night-life in the hotel itself and it has easy access to the rest of Boston as well. The only downside for me was that my room was located relatively near the nightclub, so I could hear music faintly throbbing at night. Easily fixed by requesting a different room location I'm sure. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone traveling in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool Hotel, Fantastic Service--We'd Go Back”
Reviews.Author: nohobillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty Hotel because it had been a former prison and was part of the Luxury collection. The location of the hotel is fantastic--right in the center of Beacon Hill with shops nearby as well as the Charles River. When we arrived we were greeted by the very friendly valet (I can't remember his name but his dog's name is Nick -- same as ours) so if you ever need to know, as for the doorman with the dog Nick :-). BTW--the Liberty Hotel is pet friendly. Upon check-in, you are offered a glass of champagne--a very nice touch. One small turn off--when we got to our room, I requested pet bowls--they said they'd bring them right up. While unpacking, we received a phone call saying they we unaware that we had a dog and that we'd need to move rooms. I said I found that hard to believe because when I made the reservation I mentioned I was traveling with a pet, and also had the dog with me when I checked in! Patrick the front desk rep also asked me what my dog's name was. They obviously put us in the wrong room. Not a huge deal but we did have to gather our stuff, wait for another key and move. They did waive the pet fee (which is $100 to $150 depending on who you ask) so that was nice. The lobby is spectacular. It was the former prison common area and you can see where the cells were. In your room, watch channel 1 for a complete history of the prison and hotel. The "window" channels are also great -- esp when traveling with a pet. Put on "tranquility" to help keep your furry friend quiet when you leave--it worked for us! There is also a Bloody Mary bar in the lobby outside the restaurant Clink. You pay $12 or $14 (if you want premium vodka) and your server will bring you a glass with ice and vodka. The rest is up to you. There is an area set up with a zillion varieties of spices, salts, olives, shrimp, tomato juice and Bloody Mary mix for you to make your Mary to your liking. I did and it was fun. However, the breakfast food at Clink was just so-so. Another downer: Valet parking is $41 for the night--which seems to be pretty standard in Boston. However, when we returned from a Red Sox game Saturday evening, we found our car was no longer parked underground but was moved outside just sitting there among a very busy crowd (wedding guests and club goers). Apparently they called our ticket by mistake and the gate to the garage was broken. It was a bit hokey but they apologized and comped the parking fee after we called--another nice touch which was much appreciated. Overall, you can't beat the location, unique look, fantastic service and really cool history of the hotel. The rooms are really nice too with Molton Brown bath products. I'd recommend The Liberty Hotel to others and will go back next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “All the Luxury You Need Under One Roof”
Reviews.Author: AmyVOF
Reviews.Content: Even though we live in the area, we stayed at the Liberty for one night to celebrate a birthday. We had an amazing dinner (Scampo), a beautiful room for entertaining, and a fantastic nightlife experience (Alibi) all under one roof. And if you want to wander, the location is perfect for walking, public transportation (across the street from the Charles/MGH T stop on the Red Line) and driving (literally ON Storrow Drive.) The rooms are modern, spacious, and have everything you could need. I could live in the bathroom alone! The hotel itself is beautiful, and you get the service you expect from the Luxury Collection...starting with that complimentary glass of champagne at check-in. One small complaint: we did not have a "do not disturb" sign. On 3 separate occasions, a housekeeper entered our room while we were there. The first time was just before we left for dinner, and the other 2 times were when we were sleeping in the next morning. I am sure she knocked all 3 times, but we did not hear her, and she startled us each time this happened. We probably should have asked for a sign after the first instance! If you want a luxurious experience in Boston, stay at the Liberty.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Hotspot”
Reviews.Author: JohnJHo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty over the fourth of July week and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel itself is loaded with character and history, the restoration work is amazing and it's unique the way they preserved the feel of the old jail house. Be aware that some very nice rooms in the old jail house section are located just above a very active nightclub and can be noisy on certain nights of the week. We expected this over the 4th of July but were surprised when it got loud on Thursday. If you are part of the bar scene this will not bother you, if you have an early wake up call the next day it may impact your rest. Most of the hotel rooms are located in another wing and would not be a problem. The hotel management handled the situation to our satisfaction and we would recommend the Liberty to anyone staying in the Boston area. Convenience to the fireworks was unmatched. Food quality in Scampo's (fine Italian), Clink's (American contemporary?) and room service was all good. The lobby and second floor bar are both great places for a drink and enjoy the ambiance. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel full took forever to get a clean room!”
Reviews.Author: WorldWanderer4u
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Well located for the purpose of our trip ( watch the hockey playoffs). Arrived after 2 was assigned a room that had someone in it... took till 5 to get a room... The hotel has good service. The lobby bar was understaffed. But the rooms were clean and beds comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but cool vibe, fun history of hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmcack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty Hotel for 2 nights over July 4th holiday. The hotel is the former Charles Street jail and has pieces of that history throughout the lobby and public areas. Also one tv channel is dedicated to giving you the history of the hotel. It's a must watch when you're there. Anyway, we stayed in a Charles River Suite, which was ridiculously pricey for the holiday but chose it for the view of the fireworks instead of battling the crowds of people outside and the view turned out to be spectacular. The suite consists of a large living room (furniture was uncomfortable) with a half bath and a separate large king bedroom with a huge full bath with Molton Brown products. It's a corner suite so the bedroom was a wall of windows with awesome views of the Charles River and Beacon Hill. The room comes with a small refrigerator and a Keurig coffee maker. Only complaint is that the housekeeping staff did not replenish the pods for the coffee maker or clean coffee mugs when they cleaned the room. We enjoyed room service for breakfast the first morning (pricey) and we had breakfast in Clink the second morning (also pricey but very good). We also had dinner at Scampo which is inside the hotel. Great food, fun atmosphere. We will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoFSUSeminoles
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving we could not believe our eyes at the upscale decor and friendliness of the staff. Not being accustomed to such amenities, we were very surprised not to find a coffee pot and refrigerator in our room. Coffee was provided in the lobby each morning and 24/7 room service was available when food was needed. Excellent fast internet service, TV a little slow to respond to clicking on the remote but was a great picture and sound. A/C blew straight on our faces while in the bed so we slept in reverse with our feet at the headboard and heads at the foot. Pricey soft drinks in the restaurant but free refills. We would stay again but only for a special occasion such as this one - to see the July 4th fireworks from our hotel room. Perfect view of the Charles River!!! Very close to subway system removing the need for a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Great LUXURY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: penguinman
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how the previous reviews could complain. This is a very cool Luxury hotel. Very professional staff and attentive service. There is a Red Line "T" stop right across the street. Ten min walk to the Public Gardens. Only 'drawback' was $42 a night for valet parking. Welcome to Boston I guess. Moulton Brown batch accessories were top notch. Great honor bar with top shelf offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a hotel or a club?”
Reviews.Author: dcnewlywed
Reviews.Content: On a Saturday night, it was both. If you go, stay in the tower rooms, not the original jail part. Otherwise, you will be subjected to loud music until the wee hours of the morning. Kitchen is slow - ordered appetizers at the bar and they took almost a half hour to appear. Nice thing is the complimentary glass of champagne at check-in. Overall, would recommend, but buyer beware re: room location.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: lauraflirt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, loved the bathroom (Molton Brown toiletries) truly 4-Star. Free Wi-Fi. Yes, there is a party scene each evening in the Lobby but our room was in the new tower so noise was not a problem. Room was beautiful and very comfortable. Location is outstanding, literally across the street from the Red LIne. Complimentary bike rentals, rode all along the Esplanade bordering the Charles River, gorgeous. You don't even need a cab to the airport, just cross the street to the "T" go two stops and get on the Silver Line bus for $2. Luggage is not a problem, there's escalators. What's not to like about this beautiful hotel in an outstanding location?

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is much more exciting than the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at the Liberty because the concept is really fun, and indeed it is. The lobby space is very unique, the bar and restaurants are good, and the free coffee service in the morning is great. The rooms are pretty forgettable- basic design, small bathroom, but certainly has everything you need. We stayed in the modern tower section. Also had a bad bad view of the side of a building- in fact we overlooked a big sign of the Mass Eye and Ear Hospital! Not too exciting! The front door service was excellent (yay for the valets).

Reviews.Title: “Snobby clientele, inattention to details”
Reviews.Author: n00dles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean and has a great location across the street from both a Red Line T stop and a CVS. It is indeed trendy, but there were some things that bothered me about my stay. (I couldn't bring myself to mention everything to the nice guy at the check-out desk.) Rants: -Nice that they use refillable toiletries dispensers, but one of ours was broken (didn't bother reporting it b/c there was at least a small size backup placed on the tub) -Shaving mirror light was burnt out/didn't work (didn't bother reporting it) -Lampshade was crooked upon arrival -Huge chip on the desk...like, the size of a cherry tomato (what kind of crazy guests...?!) -Some of the staff is nice, some of the staff is just eh. For example, we stood waiting for someone to tend to us at Clink for forever! It truly felt like a really, really long wait. -Rude, insulting guests in the elevator on Thursday evening when the hotel bar was raging -Ordered room service. The burger came, but instead of bringing hot water (we had even discussed bringing up a kettle or thermos), they brought a cup of ice water. (?) -Why are the doors so heavy?? Likes: -The grilled cheese sandwich at Clink. YUM. -Our server at Clink was very understanding that we needed to rush our order. He recommended which dishes would be fastest and gave us our check very promptly. Thanks! -Seafood served on the Catwalk was great. (shrimp cocktail, raw oysters, ceviche) -Air in the room was very comfortable - I swear it didn't even sound like it was on - could barely feel any air...yet it wasn't stuffy...crazy! Not sure if I'd stay here again. Glad we got a good wedding room block rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, staff and vibe. We will be back...”
Reviews.Author: MMas9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in June '11, and had an excellent stay. The hotel itself is obviously a great conversation piece in that it was once a prison, and the hotel plays this up just enough. The decor is minimalist and modern without feeling cold, and the hotel staff proved to be very friendly and helpful. We were there for three days, and two staff members were already addressing me by name! They offer free bike rentals, and we took advantage of this as well. Boston is pretty easy to get around and the bikes proved to be a cool little add on. There are a couple of dining options in the hotel, but we didn't get around to them. However, we did order room service and the food was good and the service was prompt. The rooms were well decorated, clean, and our view of the city was fantastic (12th flr). Boston is relatively small for a big city, and it's easy to get to any part you desire. But you still can't beat the Beacon Hill neighborhood you're in at the Liberty.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with luxurious rooms”
Reviews.Author: USCgirlie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in April 2011 for business. I was very pleased with this stay: check-in was seamless, and the front desk nicely upgraded me to a top-floor room with beautiful city views. I absolutely loved the spacious room: the king-sized bed was plush and extremely comfortable (providing great sleep), the furnishings were sleek and modern, and the large bathroom had luxurious Molton Brown toiletries, separate shower and bath, and a very modern sink. The sheer size/space of the bathroom and toiletries made it a pleasure getting ready in the morning and at night! The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I will be staying at this hotel again in July, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel whether for business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The Nicest Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: OCGAL11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quite a bit and are fortunate to be able to stay in nice hotels. This was one of my favorites! Our room was beautiful with a view of the Charles River. The staff was super friendly! The concierge went out of her way to get us reservations wherever we wanted. Overall great experience! Michelle & LuLu at the front desk were the best!!

Reviews.Title: “1st experience GREAT, 2nd experience so-so, 3rd experience???(tbd)”
Reviews.Author: TMOEvent
Reviews.Content: I have had two business meetings at the Liberty Hotel (including hotel stays) the last couple of months. The first time, I had a wonderful experience. The front desk was very attentive, and the glass of champagne was a nice touch. I loved that the room was "customized" for me. It was nice to see my name on the TV and the phone. The room was nice, and I loved the bathrooms. The only con the first time I stayed there, was the bed. It is way too firm. I would think that in a luxury hotel, they would have better mattresses. It felt almost like I am laying on a floor. Business wise: Great experience. The rooms were bright, and didnt have a feel of a meeting room. The selection of catered food was great (more than your usual deli sandwiches), especially the breakfast! We did have a difficult time of other people from other meetings who kept eating our food. But the catering manager made sure we were compensated for that situation. The 2nd time was not that great of an experience. My room was actually bigger this time, and i loved it (I recommend the corner rooms, you have windows all around!), but while the TV "welcomed" me, the phones were programmed to welcome someone else. Also, our room keys did not work, and we had to go back down and get them replaced 3 times. The front desk ended up coming up to let us in, but never gave us the new card keys, so we had to go back down stairs and get them. It's frustrating when you have dinner plans, but you have to wait an extra 30 minutes just to get into your room. Also, probably the worst experience was the valet. The day I checked out, I gave the ticket to the lady that was running the valet. I had to wait over 30 minutes to get my car. In fact, everyone else who was after me, who gave their tickets, got their car in 5 minutes, but for some reason they "lost my ticket". I was very upset, and they were not even apologetic about it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: ChadJen
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was beautiful, really unique to turn an old jail into a high end luxury hotel. We were there before check in and our room wasn't ready, so they took our bag and gave us a bag tag so that we could go out sight seeing without it. We parked at the hotel and the total for the stay (one day-24hrs) was $42. When we checked in late afternoon, we were offered complimentary champagne, which we took up to our room to enjoy. Someone brought our bag up within minutes. We stayed in the old part of the building, facing Charles St. The room was beautiful, spacious, and clean. I had asked for the down to be removed prior (husband is allergic to feathers) and when we got to our room, that had all been done. The only negative was that there is an outside bar that was hopping until 2 am, right below our window. UGH. There is also a central bar in the lobby area, which is also very popular til late. Not as noisy as the outside one, but could be problematic for light sleepers. We ended up going to bed around 12:30, so we didn't have the energy to switch rooms at that time. If you're going to be out late, then the room was cool and worth it, but if you want to go to bed early, you might want a room in the new part of the hotel. The beds were comfy- not to hard, not to soft. The concierge was really helpful in recommending a restaurant within walking distance and a quick breakfast place for the next morning- both were great. All in all- will go back for sure (and stay in quieter room).

Reviews.Title: “Service was good...could have been great if it weren't for the Front Desk!”
Reviews.Author: JCP1224
Reviews.Content: Doorman & bellman were great, room was gorgeous & spacious, hotel decor was interesting yet elegant, Fabio the breakfast server was wonderful, breakfast was good, Front Desk was horrible!! Recently stayed at the Liberty Hotel as a surprise for my husband. Arriving to the hotel and being greeted by the doorman who's name I can not remember (arrived 5/31 3:15pm) was what I thought would be a fantastic start to an overnight stay in Boston until we reached the Front Desk. There are two desks for check in one of which was being used by the "Director of Guest Experience" as he was checking someone in. The second had no one behind it but did have two ladies in front having a personal conversation. We waited patiently almost 10 minutes for our turn to check in and not once were we acknowledge by the second Front Desk associate that was chatting away with her friend. She finally ended the conversation when we were already being helped and someone else arrived to be checked in...perhaps she should take lessons from the doorman on how to great guests!! The hotel lobby is gorgeous with a very high soaring ceiling. In my opinion the jail theme is not over done. We were in Room 1403 which was spacious and offered a great city view! We headed to dinner and then a Red Sox game...thank you again to the doorman for helping us get there on time. Upon check out we noticed we were over charged and had go to the front desk. Once again, there was no one there and after waiting a few minutes, I had to call the hotel operator form the house phone at the Front Desk and ask if there was anyone working. Shortly after the front desk agent walked across the lobby from behind the Concierge desk and did not offer assistance until I asked him if he could help me...not sure why he was not at the Front Desk if there was a Concierge already there. All in all my rating of average was due to the service experienced by the Front Desk. They lacks major training!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,friendly but professional,clean ! Very accommodating for pet.”
Reviews.Author: AliceSmyth
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for long week-end with small dog. Hotel very welcoming and accommodating. Rooms clean and well decorated. WiFi (free) in rooms , in room safe large enough to stow camera, laptop etc. Valet parking $42.00 per 24 hours quick and professional. Breakfast very good.

Reviews.Title: “too much like jail”
Reviews.Author: catherinejones1_123
Reviews.Content: we found the hotel jangling in decor. The staff were pleasant but the registration desk and concierge were highly inefficient, The scheme is overdone. the Cilnk restaurant for breakfast was super awful. Generally the whole experiencce is one of low graciousness and noise. Perhaps the theme is overdone or they just wish to cater to the twenty someting set.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the party atmosphere with a heavy touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Rajshah7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Liberty with my girlfriend for a weekend in May to celebrate her bday. Champagne on check in, beautiful lobby, ideal location in Beacon Hill right along the Charles, across the street from a T stop - what more could you ask for

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: F16Pilot
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Now part of the SPG family, we got upgraded to the Charles River Suite. Simply fantastic and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of Luxury Collection status”
Reviews.Author: paraclete58
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was lovely...formerly a jail converted to luxury hotel, I do not feel it is worthy of being in the Starwood Luxury Collection. Room has poor lighting, bed was very springy/bouncy...not anything like a Westin Heavenly bed. Door to bathroom was a pocket/sliding type door, which was fine. Robe was frayed and faded. Towels were very nice. Stall shower glass door leaked out onto floor. Single ply toilet paper? Really? At 300.00 a night or more, I think you can get better toilet paper. Parking is 45.00 night, so don't bother with a car. The Mass General Hospital/Charles Street Red line station is right across the street, and is very convenient. Doorman arranged a private car to take us to airport for 25.00 Concierge wanted 125.00 She was very rude. Doormen were great as was front desk staff. Loved the welcome Champagne. The concierge the first night, I think her name is Renee was nice as could be, but second night woman not so much.
