Again, hotel is beautiful, staff was good, but I do not think it rates Luxury Collection

Reviews.Title: “Sadly bad reviews should not have been overlooked.”
Reviews.Author: ajg21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is impressive, the lobby is amazing. We went to check in 1/2 before we should but were told our room was ready. We were offered our complimentary glass of champagne ( nice touch) and sat in the lobby having a drink. We went to room and had been given small room on 3rd floor overlooking the busy intersection. We had booked a Deluxe king so this would not happen after reading reviews. I called to confirm that we had been but in a premier room as we had arrived early and our room was not ready. They offered to move us ( after trying to say there was no difference in room, there is) but needed to get room ready. By this time our room should have been ready 1/2 hour earlier. We sat in the lobby for about an hour, saw the receptionist walk around but never spoke to us. After over an hour we asked if room was ready and were given a key that was ready ( why did they not tell us we could go to new room?). The room was slightly bigger with a slightly better view and di have a few more facilities. On check out we were given a bill for the room. I explained at reception that I had prepaid for the room and confirmed our bar bill. I was assured this was taken care of and the bill taken from me. I got home to find that I was charged. When I called and explained I was transferred to a voicemail. I have not heard from the hotel and only got help from the company we booked through. The bill presented also led us to believe we never got the standard of room we had booked. We are easy going travellers and do not complain. The receptionist leave a lot to be disired, the housekeepers, however, were very friendly. The hotel is great but the staff let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: funpr
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay at the Liberty Hotel. From the check-in on late Sunday evening, to the rooms with a lousy odor smell, I would highly discourage anyone from staying at this LUXURY property. the bathroom and AC was making noises all night, I was informed by the front desk the first night that it would be fixed immediately. It wasn't. there is no service at all at this Starwood property. the managers need to go to St Regis to learn about LUXURY.

Reviews.Title: “Liberty Hotel (in Boston) is an elegant hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: DavidPSingapore
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed in the Liberty Hotel for one night, I was very impressed with the hotel. It provided great service, the staff were very nice and the view from our hotel window was fantastic! The room was quite big, and came with fridge and free internet connection. Although it was a bit out of the way of the main shopping and tourist area, it was located right across from the subway which was very convenient for getting around. In addition the hotel has some history as it was converted from a prison! I would definitely stay there again if I happen to be in the Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromDE
Reviews.Content: This hotel was packed because of the Boston Marathon. However, everyone found time to be polite and helpful. The hotel was clean, the location was perfect (right across from the subway), and the staff was wonderful. I would stay here again. NoteL Be sure to read the history of the hotel. It was once a prison.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: SergeB11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had such an amazing time at teh Liberty Hotel. The rooms were trendy and comfortable. The staff was top notch. At night the restuarant turned into a lounge/club, the most happening place in town. Surprisingly, the nightlife did not disturb the the quiet atmosphere of the hotel section. We enjoyed the history behind the hotel which added a special tounch to our stay. If ever visiting Boston again we will definetely stay at the Liberty!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: lorinock
Reviews.Content: rooms overlooking the charles river and downtown boston. amazing views! excellent restaurant (scampo).would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: L0vie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Liberty Hotel. Beware - rooms do not have coffee machines. You have to ask for one. We did not know this until the concierge told us at the end of our visit. Apparently the room is suppose to have a sign indicating such but our room did not. The night life in the lobby seemed a bit strange to us, especially when we saw the Front Desk staff pouring champagne for what looked like her friends. The other staff member was checking his Iphone. Unprofessional! Our room was quiet (well away from the high energy activity in the lobby), comfortable, bed was great, shower was fabulous and I loved the vanity lighted mirror. Be sure to watch channel 1 on the tele to get a brief but interesting history of the hotel. They do provide free coffee in the lobby on the weekends until 10am, but beware everytime we went for a coffee it had run out and we had to ask for it to be refilled.

Reviews.Title: “Fun. Energetic. Beautiful. Value.”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJoeMo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights ago on a business trip. The hotel is very fun. There's a lot going on in all of the bars and restaurants on site. I got a corner jail room and it was huge and spacious, along with a huge bathroom. Both the common areas and my room were impeccably clean, the service was top-notch, and even the food at their restaurant Scampo was ridiculous (try the pizzas!). I'll never stay in a different hotel in Boston. This hotel has it all. It also is in a great location in Beacon Hill. I booked the hotel about 4 hours before I got there and I thought the rate was very good. Only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 on the sleep quality is because the T (train) outside was very loud in the morning. I live in the suburbs and I'm not used to that type of noise; it's not really the hotel's fault. Oh, and the most pleasant surprise was free internet! I am so sick of paying several hundred dollars for a hotel room and then having to pay more for internet.

Reviews.Title: “The Liberty is much more comfortable than the Charles St Jail”
Reviews.Author: STaylor82
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed the Liberty as we attended a function in the ballroom. Considering the price of the hotel room, we decided to book with them rather than leave and go to a cheaper hotel. We are quite glad we stayed. We had a late check-in, almost 9pm. We were greeted by a friendly front desk employee who gave us a brief history of the hotel as it used to be the Charles Street Jail. We knew that, but we didn't know just how old it was originally (1851). We were then given complimentary champagne, a first for us (at least when not in the Caribbean etc) The ballroom seemed a little small given the reported function size (350 ppl, party) but they had three full bartenders and two beer/wine bartenders, all with their own tables along the border of the room. The passed hors d'Å“uvre were also quite tasty. We stayed in a deluxe king room and I had requested a high floor through Expedia. We ended up on the 15th (out of 16) and our view was outstanding. The bathroom was massive, with a separate bathtub and tiled shower. The water pressure in the shower was unbelievable, we like near fire-hose strength and it was ssssoooo refreshing. The beds were above average however, I still haven't had a bed as comfortable as the Westin Waterfront (Boston). Overall, I would definitely recommend the hotel. Quick easy access to Government Center going up Charles St, a leisurely walk around Beacon Hill, or just need a classy hotel to stay at while in the city for the night, I didn't feel like I overpaid.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place to host a event - big in "profiling" customers”
Reviews.Author: natickuser
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place you can host an event.... I had hosted a party at the hotel and the service was below par and as for drinks - though the descriptions were great - there was no alcohol... they were diluted to no extent...... as if all this was not enough... they lost my coat...and after standing at the coat check-in for over 90 minutes and waiting for them to find my coat - their security comes in to tell me to move away and that "we will let you know when we find it, donâ€™t stand here and if you do, we will have to escort you out" - and to top it all, it seems that the Boston police actually "works" for the hotel and "follows the instructions" that a "C" grade bouncer gives them.... shows how great the environment is!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel right next to MGH, trendy lobby and unique theme”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Wanderlust78
Reviews.Content: Originally a prison, this hotel has now been completely transformed into a luxury hotel with a fantastic location right next to MGH. When I arrived on Thursday evening the lobby was setting up for their weekly fashion show and as a result loud music was blaring and people were milling around - however the young lady behind the reception counter was extremely friendly, took everything in stride and provided excellent service. The room was very well-furnished and comfortable and the bathroom amenities were superb. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great night out!!!”
Reviews.Author: lojo523
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very beautiful. The staff are there to be at your beckon call and they are, but what impressed me the most was Carlos , chef at the restaurant Clink inside the the hotel. He catered to my special food needs. The meal he made me was delicious. Thank you Carlos and the rest of Liberty Hotel staff for making our night ,a night to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Solid property”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSailsman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Liberty since they have new affiliation with Starwood. Excellent, clean, hip and trendy (but functional rooms). The old Suffolk County jail turned into a hotel which is also cool for architecture, design etc...Very nice staff at front desk, a glass of champagne upon checking in. Small but very adequate gym. Appears to be a great spot for a drink in the lobby bar after work. I was there with my wife and 5 year old for a little get away and it was excellent (this is more a business traveler hotel, but great for well behaved families as well). The MBTA Red Line is literally across the street, so getting to Boston Common, Downtown Crossing or South Station is a breeze. I normally stay at the Westin Copley, and I would recommend the Liberty even higher. I found the Liberty to be quiet, less busy, more personalized service, and just more relaxing. Went to the restaurant Clink for breakfast and lunch. Very good. The only downside (if there really is one) is that the hotel is located next to Mass Gen Hospital in Beacon Hill and somewhat removed from the restaurants, shops etc...of downtown or back bay. I don't think there is a lot of things to do around the hotel, but again the "T" is across the street. Very solid experience and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and hip gem next to Mass General”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: Inside this old jail is a hip, modern hotel. Rooms are nice-sized, modern and clean with comfortable beds. The lobby has a "cool" factor that is hard to replicate and the Thursday-Saturday night scene in the lobby-bar is more hip New York "scene" than one would normally attibute to Boston. Location next to Mass General allows for a 5-minute walk to the hospital

Reviews.Title: “WEIRD HOTEL POLICY”
Reviews.Author: Giveypup
Reviews.Content: So, for full disclosure, I want to say that we didn't stay, here, because I was told by the sort of annoying and falsely jovial reservations guy that my 10 year old would have to stay in his own room because the hotel had no rollaways. What the heck? I don't want to put my son in his own room. Not a user-friendly hotel for families, at all, and the reservations guy said all of this as if he were delivering the best possible news (giggle, giggle). To-die-for linens or not, we've a reservation at the Four Seasons--we're allowed to share a room with my son, there. Jeez!

Reviews.Title: “ULTIMATE LUXERY at its best!”
Reviews.Author: LovingTheOpenRoad
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying here and will certainly NOT be my last! Beginning with the INCREDIBLE lobby/bar/check in area, the ceilings just seem to go on forever, plus it just looks neat! Decorated for Christmas w/ the trees hanging upside down from the ceiling in varying lengths/positions just accentuated the 'cool' factor of this place, and not in a cheesy way at all! When you check in, the complimentary glass of champagne didn't hurt either! What an entrance!!! Rooms were modern chic, not a detail is missed! From your own personal 'welcome' on the phones and TV, to the luxurious ammenities in the bath, to the attentive staff, you want for nothing at this establishment! TRULY a 5 star hotel! I did not eat here, but I certainly will on my next stay! Also close proximity to shopping/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe a little eerie, but overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: ck0728
Reviews.Content: When you are booking a room at a hotel that was once a jail, it makes you think a bit! That said, from the moment I arrived @ the Liberty, I was treated with class. Champagne on check-in?? SOLD! The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. The lobby is very impressive, true to the heritage of the building but also swanky and cool. The rooms are large, clean and well designed. Great bathroom with a fab tub for a soak after a freezing Boston day. They could have done a little more with room design/decor to bring the lobby style farther, but they were perfectly comfortable. Had breakfast at Clink, overpriced and just ok, but that's a typical hotel breakfast experience. Overall would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “If you love Boston like I do...”
Reviews.Author: FloridaNativeJan
Reviews.Content: You will love this hotel! Right at the foot of Charles Street with views of the river. It's in front of the red line and next to MGH. What a location! We were there for a reunion and walked to the reception at MGH, then afterwards we walked to the North End for dinner. The next night we walked to Durgin Park and Faneuil Hall. During the day we walked all over Boston from downtown, the common, public garden, theatre district, Beacon Hill, Com Ave, and up to Copley Plaza and on to the Pru. (btw, the DUCK tour was great!) This hotel is high end, impeccably clean with great service. From the champagne at check in to the ease of check out, everyone was very helpful. The concierge was fantastic (he checked us in for our departure flights at Logan) The breakfast at the hotel was very nice. The room we had was great (on an upper floor) and there was no noise at all from the bar area. On Saturday night coming back from dinner at about 10 PM, we were amazed at the long lines of trendy singles WAITING to get into the hotel bar/lobby area! And it was about 35 degrees out (cold for me!) Definitely a hopping place, but not intimidating. OH, the decor----it is the most unique hotel I've ever seen! The history of the old jail is fascinating and the design work to bring it up to hip elegance is fab! DO GO for that special weekend like I did!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great bar, free coffee......”
Reviews.Author: autumnsky83
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Liberty hotel and it was perfect, we were a group of 5 and we had not one compaint about the hotel we loved everything about it... We did not think it was over priced at all because we think you should get what you pay for. Bonus: Free coffee in the lobby, we needed it after the "freedon crawl" The overnight parking was high but don't park their.

Reviews.Title: “unique and fun”
Reviews.Author: TacomaLv2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty in October. The staff was friendly,the rooms were decent size,clean and quiet (get a room higher up).

Reviews.Title: “If this is jail, lock me up and throw away the key!”
Reviews.Author: FidelioLondon
Reviews.Content: No matter where you stay in Boston you're within walking distance of pretty much everything so hotels have to be competitive.... and this one certainly was. Put your hand in your wallet, spend the extra and experience just something a bit more special. A former jail to be precise, but it is done in the best style and to a very high standard. Upon arrival into the impressive lobby via the escalators we were greeted by our check-in representitive and asked for details..... from hereon in there were no qualms, no questions unanswered and no problem too big. Spend a moment to look up and around and see what they've done to this magnificent space....... it still smacks of being a jail, but hey this is why you're here... for something different. Bags (of which there were many) whisked away and promptly delivered to the room. The room large, bathroom large, seperate shower and bath and all the robes, towels and products you could wish for, all replaced on a daily basis if necessary. The bed was supremely comfortable, with a choice of pillows - always a good sign. The concierge and front desk were impecable in appearance and knowledge without the usual condescending nature that comes with other hotels. The restaurant and bar were busy, and if you're staying over a weekend i'm sure you'll be mxing with the upper eschelons of young contemporary Boston society. Food excellent, the Cuban pork sandwich for brunch hit the spot and they weren't shy on the coffee either. If you have the funds, go here, try it, it may surprise you, spend a bit, love a lot.

Reviews.Title: “lovely but many small issues”
Reviews.Author: AndreaChilanga
Reviews.Content: Initial thoughts: Large room Great bathroom with deep bathtub and huge bottles of Molten Brown products. Fantastic robes, slippers, hair dryer, iron, etc. Nice workspace Very kind and eager to please staff - very nice upon checkin, room service, etc. Lots of outside noise from delivery truck Other room doors SLAM Can hear the person next door or upstairs not only flushing the toilet but actually urinating in the toilet ugh Can hear people walking above me (?) Very very dusty - alarm clock, lamps, covered with dust; one item in the bathroom had rust on it. Why do I have to call for a coffee maker to be brought to my room? Couldn't they have asked me when I made the reservation or checked in? Yes I do want coffee and I don't want to either have to ask in advance or pay $7.00 for a pot of coffee plus $4.00 delivery fee plus 18% tax! The phone is like a mini computer (?) and cannot be powered down or turned off. That means the bright light from the screen is on all night unless you find a way to cover it. That's evening one. More to come after day one and evening two!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building, beautiful bathrooms; skip the food”
Reviews.Author: aod326
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of colleagues for a meeting. The public areas are impressive and the reception staff friendly and efficient. Champagne on check in was very nice!Spacious (for the city) bedroom with a stunning and very roomy bathroom. Didn't like that I had to request a coffee maker for the room. First evening we ate at "Clink" in the hotel and had very slow service (1 hour from ordering to receiving dinner) and the food was very average, seemed old fashioned with heavy sauces. The food in the meeting room was also poor. Staff were very accommodating, although absolutely everything in the meeting room cost extra.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Houston940
Reviews.Content: From the glass of champagne on check in, great rooms, fashion show in main lobby, great place to stay and very unique

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Upscale and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: fleurdsoleil
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple times for business. It is definitely a higher end hotel with good service. Great modern decor that plays well off the roughness of the jailhouse origins of the building. When you walk in you get a glass of champagne, which is a nice touch. Great location for getting places downtown and the MGH T stop (red line) is right there so easy to get over to cambridge or anywhere else you want to go via the T. I also like how its right near Charles Street which is great for dinner / evening strolls. Also a grocery store and CVS pharmacy right across the street so you pretty much have everything. Only thing I would caution is that this may not be the place for you if you want to have a peaceful dinner / evening in the hotel. Restaurants / lobby get pretty crowded -especially on Thursday & weekend nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - If You Don't Mind Being Robbed!”
Reviews.Author: sugrmagStowe_VT
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Liberty before and enjoyed it. This last trip changed my mind. The valet stole money from my car. To make matters worse, it was my girlfriends birthday gift from her parents. Reaction from the staff was underwhelming, "If this alleged theft actually took place...". Steal from me, then call me a liar! That's service!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the laid back attitude in this gem”
Reviews.Author: ilovemyholidays80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our New England trip, and we have no complaints except that we couldnt stay longer. The staff all had an effortless charm and friendleness, the bar areas were buzzing, our room was really nice, and complementry coffee in the morning was a godsend after we partied till late. Looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Christine0067
Reviews.Content: Must eat at the restaurant Scampu, one of Boston's best located on the bottom floor of the hotel. The hotel was originally a jail built in 1858. Beautiful architecture and a great piece of history. Comfortable accomodations, centrally located, within walking distance to all of Boston's highlights. Is a bit pricey, but you're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but could make easy improvements.”
Reviews.Author: danamal140
Reviews.Content: Very hip, chic, hotel with tons of action in a great location of Boston. The staff and service overall was outstanding. However given the price you would think the hotel rooms could be a bit cleaner and the beds/linens a bit nicer. The bed was really hard, the sheets & pillow cases seemed clean, but had stains, the towels were coarse, and the room was very dusty all three days we were here which shows the house cleaning did not do much when they came. Regardless I would recommend, but hope they would improve the little things like clean sheets and dusting and vacuuming the rooms better. Aside from those items, if you are looking for great service and a very cool autmosphere, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel or design hospital? Anyway: terrible design hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Hamburg_meine_Perle
Reviews.Content: I would strongly discourage from choosing the Liberty Hotel Boston. Why? - Half hotel, half hospital: The hotel is directly located next to the giant Mass Gen Hospital, with view towards the clinic buildings and a lot of patients within and around the hotel - Unpleasant direct location: giant motorway interchange in front of the hotel - Design: interesting lobby, average room interior, few with good view towards Charles River, no top-quality furniture (except bathrooms) - Service: fair front desk service, poorest restaurant service (Clink), my complaints were ignored afterwards - Food: only breakfast: very poor menu and average quality - Wellness/spa: no facilities - No-Go: a (unexpensive) t-shirt disappeared from the room, several complaints to the front desk and general management remained fruitless or were ignored. Most embarrassing for a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time in Jail”
Reviews.Author: lmm2119
Reviews.Content: The Liberty hotel has everything you could possibly need, and if they don't have it, they'll get it for you. The staff were friendly, polite, and willing to go the extra mile for guests. Guests receive a glass of champagne when they arrive and the first night we were there the hotel was having a special event with complimentary wine. The hotel has numerous places to dine and even has bikes for guests to take out on the town. The room was very comfortable and bright. The housekeepers seemed to be a bit rushed. They were always on the lookout to see if you were leaving for the day so that they could make up the room. The atmosphere of the hotel was very sophisticated and was a great place to hold meetings. It was also a fantastic location - walking distance to most attractions and right along the water. The jail transformation is an added piece of character that makes this hotel unique.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, its style and location”
Reviews.Author: northernlights40
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel with lots of personality and not your typical property. The former prison turned luxury property creates alot of unique features about the property unlike any other hotel I have stayed at recently. The rooms are very comfortable, not huge but not too small. The bathrooms are great! Bathtubs and toiletry products are excellent! Bed was super comfy! We highly recommend this hotel to any Boston travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abelgolf
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and it was outstanding. Friendly staff. Excellent service by a staff that "gets it.", and thr food in all of the restaurants, especially Scampos was very ggod. well worth it to pay for the city view on ahigh floor in the tower. You are up and away from the noise in the courtyard and the view of the Charles and the Back Bay is spectacular. Yes, the lobby can be crowded at night, but with good reason. it is a beautiful area that people are drwn too. And it is obviously one 'the" places to be seen in the city right now. But it is highly recommended and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to like....”
Reviews.Author: Shantam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in August. Getting to the hotel was a breeze as it is literally steps away from the Red Line. Entering the hotel is breathtaking; the atrium of the hotel is stunning. Check in was easy and we appreciated the glass of champagne we were offered. Our room was in the new tower. It was large and well equipped, although a little featureless. The bathroom was huge with a separate tub and walk in shower with good Molton Brown toiletries. two disappointments about the room, a noisy air conditioning system and the view over an office block. It might well be worth paying extra for the superb city view on the other side of the hotel. We ate at The Clink which was fine but probably too much for what we wanted on our first jet lagged night. The waiter didn't seem impressed that we only wanted to share the shared plate of charcuterie between us! For breakfast we popped up the road to Au Bon Pain. Coffee was available in the lobby each morning , which was a nice touch We would stay here again and recommend it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Lock me up and throw away the key, i love it!”
Reviews.Author: Week38
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two wonderful nights at the Libert Hotel. From the time we arrived, service was impeccable. The gentleman at the door handling valet were extremely professional. The check in process was relaxed and efficient. They conclude check in with glasses of champagne which is such a nice treat. I was traveling in a group of four and shared one room with a companion. The accomodations were clean, the bed was comfortable and bathroom was perfect for two. The hotel is conveniently located a stone's throw from Beacon Hill and you can stroll to the public park in 10 minutes. We ate at Clink, one of the hotel's restauarants, and it was good. I travel frequently and love to stay in at high quality hotels. The Liberty Hotel was definitely a treat and I would stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at the Foot of Beacon Hill with fine Views”
Reviews.Author: Flemming_Meineche
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at this former prison now five star hotel at the foot of the Beacon Hill â€“ in other words the location is excellent if you wish to explore the city. The facilities and the room were up to the standard of what you could expect of a five star hotel. Since we were travelling with small kids we stayed in the room during evenings which given the magnificant views of the water and the skyline was an excellent way to spend the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DivaSt_Paul
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston with two other couples and thoroughly enjoyed the Liberty Hotel. They made everything very personal and made us feel they would do anything to make this a wonderful trip. The hotel is in a great location as far as neighborhood and accessibility to transportation. I can't say enough of the incredible experience. Thank you Liberty Hotel!!! Can't wait to return and recommend you to everyone traveling to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappoints again”
Reviews.Author: Bennybenny8675309
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a year ago and reluctantly agreed to stay here again. Nothing has changed. The hotel has a good location and is interesting but the staff is terrible...This is my review from a year ago- it still stands true unfortunately. This is not a 5 star hotel. It states that it is 5 stars, it initially presents as 5 stars. It is not 5 stars. It could be a 3 1/2 star hotel parading as a 4 star. I have been staying here for 3 weeks now. It's not worth more than $180-$230 per night. Here are the flaws: customer service is mediocre and sometimes poor to non-existent ( Fire the lazy people and find people who WANT to work!!! Or train them. I think they believe they here to be part scene instead of working. Not the valet staff tho - those guys are the exception.) This is the biggest flaw and why the Liberty was so disappointing. amenities are lacking-no pool, so-so fitness center rooms are nice but again, not 5 star. What's lacking in the room you ask? The phones don't work properly, the lighting is very dim, the remote control on the tv is not very good, lacking in electrical outlets for the phone charger, computer etc., What's the difference between this hotel room and a 4 star hotel room? nothing. the pluses Great views amazing lobby nice location comfortable rooms Other notes- The lobby is a scene. The well heeled come here to show off the new fancy pants and Bottega Veneta bags. It can be a divine time if that's your thing. But if you are trying to get to your room and have to fight your way through a crowd it gets annoying. How could this be a 5 star hotel? Improve customer service by 100%, increase facility amenities, improve room amenities

Reviews.Title: “so far from luxury. service issues abound.”
Reviews.Author: chicchihuahua
Reviews.Content: That was, hands down, was the WORST "luxury hotel" experience I have ever had. And I spend my career traveling the world and staying at fine hotels. We've stayed at Courtyard Marriots with better results. The day started with a 90 degree hotel room with no air conditioning turned on for my arrival. There mattress consisted of a flimsy unfitted sheet (that shifted the entire night) with holes placed on a mattress with NO bed pad. That is disgusting. There were holes in the pillows cases, and the robe (which I was terrified had not been changed from the prior guest in light of the sheet issues) so tattered and worn it was embarrassing. I was terrified it hadn't been changed or washed too. Stained carpeting. Everywhere. The most horrifying aspect was when I entered the shower and found enough long black hair to make a wig plastered all over the shower walls. It literally made my stomach turn. The service was deplorable in the restaurant too. Including my husband being asked if he wanted a refill on his prosecco, only to be refilled with a horrible cheap champagne that cost five dollars more than the good drink he had ordered. Yes it's a jail. But that doesn't make up for all the problems. Nothing to write home about. Don't stay here if you know what a luxury hotel truly is. If you think it's trendy you need your head examined. Stay at the Ames instead. Morgans does cool and fabulous hotels right. This is a cheap attempt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great views, good location.”
Reviews.Author: goodreviewsperson
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night only for a anniversary get-away. The staff was excellent - the guy checking us in made the effort to walk across the lobby to congratulate us on our anniversary. The conceirge was very helpful also. The room was very nice. We picked the city view and stayed on the 13th floor - so we had a great view of the Charles River and downtown Boston. The bed was very comfortable and the room had good technology (HD TV, free WiFi, IP phones, iPod docking clock radio, etc.) The staff sent free Champagne and strawberries as an anniversary gift. The location is good - easy walking distance to the Science Museum, the Public Gardens, etc. The hotel get's hopping in the evening, so if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing atmosphere then this may not be the best hotel for you. We would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “ask for a quiet floor if traveling with kids”
Reviews.Author: hockeymomtwentyfive
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston w/ my spouse and 2 children (12 & 15) and we were looking forward to staying in such an interesting hotel. We had viewed a youtube video on the hotelâ€™s history prior to our arrival, which had the children excited for the trip. We had a luxury corner double room w/ a lovely view of the Charles River. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was sleek and spacious. It is a great location, and we thoroughly enjoyed quick walks from the hotel to the Esplanade for a movie & concert. If I had been younger I would have absolutely loved it here â€“ but as a 40-something with kids, I would re-think a return visit. The lobby had a â€œhipâ€� club vibe and was crowded with decked-out guests â€“ which made my teenager a bit uncomfortable. My younger child was fine with the hotel until he was sworn at by a drunk guest from Alibi as we were en route to our room (there is no other way to access your room other than going by the hordes of people at the bar). Also, after bar-closing time, we were woken multiple times by loud/drunk people in our hallway. If youâ€™re traveling with children, be sure to ask for a quiet, pet-free floor, and walk quickly by the bar when going back to the room - and you should be fine!

Reviews.Title: “The worst "luxury" hotel experience I've ever had. Will not return.”
Reviews.Author: nycwritergirl
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from my "luxury king" room at The Liberty Hotel. I'm staying here one night, mid-week (Wednesday night) on a quick business trip through Boston. My experience here has, hands down, been the worst of any I've had at any high-end hotel in the world -- and I travel extensively, probably spending at least two weeks each month on the road. I arrived yesterday at 5:30 p.m. after experiencing a two-hour delay on the Acela train from New York -- originally I'd been scheduled to arrive at 3:30 p.m. Because of the delay, I needed to check in and go straight to a dinner meeting. This was impossible, however, because my room was not ready. Yes, you read that right, my luxury king room was not ready at 5:30 p.m. -- even after I explained that I literally needed to drop my things off and leave immediately, the front desk kept me waiting. After about ten minutes of standing around, the front desk told me that housekeeping was still in my room and I wouldn't be able to check in because "the internet in the room is broken." I had to absolutely insist that I be allowed to check in, and they finally let me. When I got to the room, it was 85 degrees in there. I know it was 85 degrees in there because that's what it said on the thermostat. The air conditioner was set to cool the room to 65 degrees, but it was obviously not working. I called reception to have the air conditioner looked at and they promptly sent someone up to "fix" the air con. Unfortunately, I had to run to my meeting, so couldn't stay to see what he did, but the room never dropped below 78 degrees the entire night. The air conditioning in the room is terrible. It's August. The luxury king room I am in is unfortunately situated directly above an outdoor bar owned and operated by the hotel. The bar blares music outdoors until 2 a.m. It seems that the front desk is unaware of this. I phoned down around 10:40 p.m. to find out what time the bar would stop playing music outside and they told me the music would stop at midnight. I told them I needed to be up at 4:30 a.m. for work. The music at the bar continued to blare until 2 a.m. At these prices, you could do far better than to stay at the Liberty Hotel, which has some serious basic problems with the "luxury hotel" aspect of their business. If you're looking for a party scene, sleepless nights, don't mind an overwarm room and impossibly late check-in times, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay- wonderful staff, especially Calvin at the front desk!”
Reviews.Author: lexy7374
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Libery for a quick babymoon and had a wonderful time. Upon arrival, we were excitedly greeted by Calvin at the front desk. Seeing that I was pregnant, he made sure I received a delicious mocktail upon my arrival in lieu of the complimentary champagne upon arrival. Also, every time we passed by him, he greeted us, complimenting me on my attempt at maternity fashion, making me feel like a million bucks. The room was also quite nice and immaculate. There is definately a party/fun vibe in the hotel, but it's not out of control or abnoxious and, in fact, really gives the hotel life and distinguishes it from your run of the mill hotel chain. Kudos to the Liberty!

Reviews.Title: “excellent situated, interessting history behind, good value”
Reviews.Author: Monica059
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful with a little exception when I forgot my passport in the safe. Only after 6 calls I got somebody who went to the room to check the safe if all my things are still there. The hotel is not too overdesigned, very comfortable and cosy, all is very clean. You do not feel excessively pampered but appropriate friendly treated. My room was unfortunately viewing the next building and I could see only a little bit of the river what was a pitty. I was walking around more or less the whole town - no problems at all. You could also take a train or the underground if you prefer that. Easy accessible from/to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ubersteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Liberty for a week and was unimpressed. The main focus for the hotel is the bar experience, so if you are a thirty-something hipster you will have a great time in the evening with the bar and nitelife at the hotel. If you are a bit older, know that this hotel is nicely appointed, but nothing special. The rooms are clean and functional, though there is no cofee machine in the room. The noise from the bar and the botel recycling outside is intrusive. A much better deal is the Marlow on the other side of the Charles. It does the boutique hotel experience right.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Pesapenny
Reviews.Content: Because I have stayed at the Liberty previously and had a superb experience, I had high expectations. My mom and I were having a fun weekend in Boston, and I suggested the Liberty, and convinced her to stay here, despite the high price tag. We were excited to partake in the 4th of July package, which included tickets to the rehearsal on the Esplanade, and breakfast. We checked in early, and I had previously called to verify that this wouldn't be a problem, and was assured a room would be ready, and that a note was in the res. Also, I was told that there would be a pet amenity package of bowls, bed, water and cookies for my little dog. We arrived early, and the woman at the concierge gave off the impression that it would be a problem, and the front desk seemed as if they had no prior knowledge of this. Also, we were not offered a drink of water or champagne, which is customary for check in! We were staying in the original jail, which is located above the bar. We go into the room and it was not ready for us. The phone and television still had the name of the previous guest, and there was only one set of towels and amenities. I am fairly certain the room wasn't turned over. Also, there were no pet amenities which were promised. We called for towels and a dog bed and then went out. We arrived back four hours later, and still did not have what we needed. It was about 90 degrees out, and we both wanted to shower before going out again. It took three calls to the front desk and about two hours later to get towels and dog stuff. On top of that the shower head and hardware literary came apart and broke in the shower. The staff profusely apologized, and claimed their Blackberrys weren't working- but frankly, I don't think it's relevant at all. That night, the bar was extremely loud until about three am- if the noise level was mentioned at the time of the reservation, I certainly would have never made the res. Don't get me wrong, I like singing along to Lady Gaga as much as the next gal, but not when you're trying to relax with your mom and dog, and paying upwards of three hundred a night. Unless you're going to be out late drinking in the Liberty's vibrant bar scene, I wouldn't recommend staying in the old jail. I was extremely disappointed, and spoke with the desk manager the next day. She was extremely responsive to my concerns and was very professional. She rectified the situation, and moved us immediately to a room in the tower. We had breakfast, went out, walked around, enjoyed the city, and came back to a room which was ready. Soothing music on, the dog bed and bowls...this was the Liberty I remembered! We even were able to watch the fireworks from the room! It was a great night. We ate at Scampo the first night, and it was so good we went back the second night. The food is interesting and satisfying, and the menu is diverse enough to eat there two nights in a row. (I live in Boston, so I didn't feel the need to explore- if you're new to Boston, check out other areas as well). It's a cool hotel, and I hope that my experience was merely a snafu. I must say that the staff- especially the guys at the door and valet were great. Everyone is very well trained and professional. and the hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: AKCHouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liberty Hotel for three nights. I loved the location of the hotel -- it was very close to a T stop and minutes on foot from the cute shops of Beacon Hill as well as Boston Common and the Public Garden. There was lots to explore within walking distance. The hotel itself was very unique -- it used to be a prison so there is an interesting historical aspect to the Liberty. The lobby is visually impressive with a soaring ceiling and lots of places to sit and people watch. The lobby bar becomes a total scene at night. Our room was nice (we didn't have a great view though) and our spacious bathroom had a large soaker tub and a separate shower. We were staying at the Liberty for a wedding and received a discounted rate. I'm not sure if I would pay $400 a night to stay there but for $250, it was a good value for Boston. My only complaint is that housekeeping always cleaned the rooms very late in the day. Once we came back after lunch and the room still had not been cleaned. I ate at both of the hotel's restaurants, Clink and Scampo, for lunch and thought the food was delicious at both.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Pulpo_Grande
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped foot in the Liberty Hotel, I knew I was in for a treat. The lobby was filled with an art show that night and at check in we were greeted with a glass of sparkling wine. The room was lovely and had a nice view. We had a drink in the bar and had innovative martinis with cheerful service. If I would have had more time there, I would have loved to have taken out one of the complimentary bikes that they have available. T stop is conveniently across the street although it's also in a great spot to take off on foot too. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hfutrell
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Upper floor room with lovely view of Hancock Tower and Charles River from large window. Very comfortable bed. Very quiet. Ice down the hall. Flat screen television. Large room; attractive decor. Rate included a reasonably good breakfast. Terrific location --- walkable to river, downtown, Beacon Hill, Back Bay, and T (metro) nearby (Cambridge line). Redeveloped historic jail building --- many awards --- plus new tower that contains most of the rooms. Very, very crowded, trendy restaurant/bar crowd even during weeknights...but no impact on anyone wanting quiet. Service fine, polite. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: Californiagirl1688
Reviews.Content: I thought in researching the Liberty that it would be the perfect getaway for my spouse and I. The hotel itself is gorgeous, an architecural gem, but I would never stay here again as a paying guest nor recommend it to anyone. If you're curious about the liberty, just visit it, look around, have a drink, but don't pay $300-$500 a night to be shuffled around as a second class citizen. Asking the front desk for anything like a toothbrush or a restaurant recommendation is a joke. I never received anything I requested and I was told to come down to the front desk to ask for a recommendation and then referred to the concierge that had a line. Is it really that hard to take 30 seconds to tell me a great place to have sushi?! And do not stay Thursday nights - that's their fashion show night. I could have sworn I saw employees of the hotel drinking and hanging out that night - does not seem professional and really made me mad that their priorities seem to be about nightlife and having fun, not about their hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great hotel with Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Duke_Of_Monty
Reviews.Content: My colleague and i checked in with a few hours to spare to get to Fenway. The gents at the front desk went out of their way to help us. Exceedingly friendly and helpful in making sure we knew exactly how to get their on the train. We didn't have to. the Bellman called over a brand new Cadillac Escalade for us (house car) and for a reasonable gratuity, we were dropped in style a block away from the park. The hotel itself is gorgeous with a pretty busy bar scene for a Tuesday night. Mostly young professionals. Rooms are beautiful with very comfortable furnishings, a well stocked mini-bar (extremely) and great bath products (according to female colleague). Very cool, very hip, historical hotel. Only problem i had was my room on the 5th floor overlooked the area where the dumpsters are. When they emptied them in the middle of the night, it was a bit loud. This is an annual trip. Last two years i stayed at the Millenium and the Onyx. This is far better than both. I'll likely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just Phenomenal!!”
Reviews.Author: motoman4540
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Boston to visit my parents. Having lived in Boston when the Charles Street Jail was still operating, I was interested to check this hotel out based on the the reviews here. I was not disappointed. The lobby is beautiful and a local hangout for people in the hotel and locals. Very fun. We were upgraded to a Charles River Suite, which had just amazing views of the Charles, Back Bay, Beacon Hill and Cambridge. Gorgeous. The room itself was huge and wonderfully appointed. We ate at Scampo, the restaurant located in the hotel, and the food was delicious -- not cheap, but not wallet-gouging like many hotels. We needed reservations for a 6 p.m. table for 4 on a Wednesday night, so be advised to plan early, even during the week. Having been born and raised in Boston, this hotel is not the best-located hotel -- it is a long walk to typical tourist destinations like Faneuil Hall and Newbury Street, but not bad at all, and is right across from a T station, so you can pretty much get anywhere in the city on the T. I highly recommend the hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angie652
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel is one of in itself! It is located on Charles Street, right by the river and you can pick up the train extremely close also. It is an old jail, converted into a hotel and you can definetely tell that they put money into it! It is first class everything! The bell men are so friendly and greet you with the biggest smile. One day when it was raining, I forgot my umbrella in the room, and the bell man rushed to get me one. The staff at the hotel was extremely friendly and helped to reccommend places to go and see in the city and described how to use the train. This hotel should be ranked #1 on the list! This was my second time staying at the Liberty and I would recommend it again!

Reviews.Title: “hotel having an identity crisis”
Reviews.Author: chilemom1
Reviews.Content: This physically beautiful hotel has an identity crisis. Let me say that the front desk, concierge and Clink staff were lovely, the latter being understaffed, however. In general, the hotel staff is overwhelmed, esp its parking staff, by the hundreds of wanna-be-seen/picked ups, who storm its lobby on weekend evenings. I was greeted by valet for my $600 per nite stay by a whistle (not the mechanical kind) telling me to pull my car up to a particular spot. The lack of elegance is obvious. Any hotel that is fine with having 20 something drunkards stumbling in its lobby has to decide if they are seeking the big bucks from their hotel guests or from their liquor sales. As the evening wears on, beware the stumblers as they might fall right on top of you as you try to make your way upstairs to the sanctity of a quiet room with a view. BTW, the robe in the room was complete with torn threads, having a better appearance on the inside than the outside. Get some new robes! Tacky despite its physicality. Front desk and concierge were very professional; parking staff has too much too contend with as they have room for 6 cars and have 600 driving in. I was also appalled at being refused the opportunity to have friends leave their car on the side for 5 minutes so they could accompany me to my room and accept a gift I had brought them. I was told that that constitutes a $20 park. After complaining I was told that there is no room to leave a car for 5 minutes- altho I saw limos in waiting This is an attractive hotel with a trendy club bouncer mentality, as evidenced by the KGB, earphone-wearing suits all over the place- not conducive to a relaxing visit to a lovely city- and I am not 90 years old!

Reviews.Title: “Give me liberty or give me death!”
Reviews.Author: DrABC
Reviews.Content: I came to Boston with a patient and was pleasantly surprised by this unique and fun hotel. It has quite a vibe and evenings are fun at the lobby - lounge. Don't their restaurant Scampo as well (best lamb chops around).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible.....”
Reviews.Author: BethAnnAnderson
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the building itself is amazing... beyond beautiful... we went to Boston to see a show for our anniversary and want a little pampering .. We looked into several places and decided that the Liberty outwardly appeared that it would be exactly what we were looking for.. a 5 star getway ... were we wrong.. Our room was beneath a extremely loud ( and I mean we couldn't hear each other speaking to each other) event when we asked about it we were told it would be over by 8pm. when we called to the desk for a shving kit it took 1n hour to recieve it and 2 additional calls.... we finally figured we would just go to the show and come back , ge something to eat and relax in one of the resturants in the hotel upon our return..... again we were mistaken... at night the Liberty is nothing more than a high class night club... we could not even make it to through the lobby to get to th elevator to get to our room and the staff actually stopped us at the door and hasseled us about goning into the hotel!!!!.. once we finally made it to our room the noise was worse than when we left !!! there was another event above us! going till 1 AM!!!!!! so they finally moved us at 12:30 AM!!!! we did get alot of.... very un .....real oh sorrys. a free breakfast. and a long ride home to rest from a very bad trip........ all for just over 600.00 a night!! this hotel is more interested in running a night club and keeping a crowd of drinking customers happy than the guest of the hotel. . BethAnn from central Ma

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RLDCIM
Reviews.Content: Amazing design and service. The lobby turns into a great club at night. The rooms were laid out smart with a great bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Liberty had the best costumer service at any hotel we ever stayed at and great location”
Reviews.Author: ozzi12
Reviews.Content: Best location right in the center Beacon section and right next to North E, downtown, and Back Bay. We were staying at the Liberty and going to Fenway to see Yankee/redsox game the following day, we told the staff we would watch the first game in the room that nite, when we return to our room from dinner we found a 2 chilled sam adam beers, cracker jacks and peanuts and a card saying enjoy the game compliments of the liberty! there is a line to get into the hotel on Friday and Saturday nights to get into the Clinks and other bar, but we went right through because we were staying there. What a happening place

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice change from your typical boutique property!”
Reviews.Author: travelingmc
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the lobby, I knew this was going to be a better than average stay. There were a couple people in line at the front desk, so the bellman accompanying me offered me a glass of pink champagne. Then he stayed with me filling me in on details about the hotel while I waited - and he was able to answer every single one of my questions whether it was about the restaurants, the number of rooms, the meeting space, et.. There were complimentary truffles in my room, free bottled water and free wi-fi. And, my courtyard view room actually had a great peek of waterfront with the sailboats passing by. Dinner at Scampo was excellent - the only table was in the bar, so the noise level was high, but great if you like a place with energy - packed on a Tuesday night. The staff at the front desk, at the lobby bar, at the front door and at the restaurant were all consistently pleasant and ready to fulfill any request. The best thing about the property is the unique space and the unique perks - free yoga, fashion shows on one night, happy hour for pets in the courtyard on another. I stay in a lot of places around the world and the Liberty is one that will now be on my consistent recommendation list when people ask me about my all time favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful room - made for a perfect visit”
Reviews.Author: NYCgirl212
Reviews.Content: Had read about the conversion a few years back and when we decided to do a trip the weekend after Thanksgiving, we were worried it would be a little too empty and quiet. But they greeted us with a glass of champagne, and they had a balloon and a piece of cake waiting in our room because it was also my husband's birthday. They even left a birthday card signed by the staff. In fact, the service was wonderful and friendly the entire weekend. The room was also great -- view of the Charles River, a big roomy tub in the bathroom -- and without having to upgrade to a more expensive room. We only stopped at the hotel bar for drinks but the nightlife was hopping. Really original decor and finishes and they were just putting up their Christmas decorations when we were there -- trees hanging from the ceiling! Location is right near the T and lots of great little shops and restaurants just down Charles Street. Boston is only a short drive from NYC and we were already planning our next trip back after this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: alpha5280
Reviews.Content: What was once a jail is now a posh hotel. They pay homage to their past with lots of neat little touches -- like interior windows with bars on them in the bar. Very close to the river and Esplanade. Two restaurants and one bar that also serves food. The restaurants aren't open at lunch, but if you sit down anywhere in the lobby area you can order drinks and appetizers and eat right there! Oh, and they offered free champagne at check-in (I didn't get any but I'm guessing it was a glass not a bottle). Well stocked mini-bar with a good variety of snacks, drinks, and alcohol. Great selection of pay-per-view movies. Excellent service. The bar - called Alibi - was great. Cozy with some arm chairs and love-seats. Enjoyed being able to order a pizza and a drink and sit back in the relaxed atmosphere. Also, the pizza was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CMcBuck
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston on business and stayed here because I booked way too late and it was the only thing left! I was glad I did. The hotel is a very cool concept, and you will probably pay more for that aspect of it. They did a great job with redefining the building, though, and I really liked it. When I checked in, I was given a class of sparkling wine. This was very nice after working all day. The room was very comfortable, though kind of small. I used the gym which was adequate but nothing special. The hotel seemed to be a popular place in the evening, but I wasn't able to visit any bars or restaurants on my trip. If I had been on vacation, I would have preferred to be in a different location, such as closer to Fanueil Hall or Boston Common. The hotel is right across the street from a T stop, though, so the location isn't a real negative. You can walk to the Public Garden in 15 minutes or so. I went on a run through Beacon Hill and along the water, so for that reason the location was nice. All my preferred locations were technically within walking distance, so it really wouldn't have been bad if it were a vacation. I just like having more of a view from my hotel room, and in this case my view was the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “In one word- FABULOUS!!”
Reviews.Author: urbancombatqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband, 17mos old son and I decided to spend a night in the city. We live about 40 minutes outside of Boston. We had been to the LIberty Hotel several times before for dinner/drinks at the restaurants, but hadn't stayed overnight. The lobby is amazing. It is a very active lobby, with a bar on one side and lots of intimate areas for seating in the expansive space. Even on a friday night, with lots of people at the bar, we did not find the lobby too loud. Our room was on one of the upper floors of the tower and had an exceptional view of the city and was extremely quiet away from the lobby scene. The staff was amazing and when we arrived there were both a stuffed bear and a copy of "Make Way for Ducklings" left in our room by the hotel concierge. A very nice touch. Breakfast at Clink was excellent. Although at this trip, we did not visit Alibi, or Scampo, both are excellent venus. The hotel is in an excellent location, just steps away from Charles street and the Charles River, and a10 min walk from the Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market area, the Public Gardens and the Museum of Science. Our only complaint was that parking is $42 a day, expensive even for Boston standards.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotel lobby i've ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: grvforce
Reviews.Content: actually this is one of the best hotels i've ever been. elegent, simple, and personal level services. i like thier lobby where the front desk, consirge, and the bar are all open up together. over locked by three level of meeting/wedding rooms. on a bussy weekend, its awsome and entertaining. and best of all, if ur a gest, u dont have to care about what u r wearing, while all dressed people waiting in line get ids checked. u just walk in with everybody greeting u by ur name.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Property in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nole1
Reviews.Content: Went to Mass General for surgery. For convenience, this hotel can't be beat. Walking distance to all hospital functions. 24 hour CVS pharmacy a block away. Access to subway system across the street. Charles St. has lots of small specialty restaurants to visit along with shops all walkable. Nice views of the river and back bay. I was impressed with the architecture, very nicely decorated lobby. Staff were friendly and efficient and met all our needs. Two restaurants in the hotel included "Clink" and "Scampo." Both were excellent. Comfortable beds, flat screen HD, wireless, nice bathrooms with showers and tubs. All in excellent condition. The hotel was quiet, but the lobby rocks at happy hour and can be congested. It's a good place to hang out and read when it's quiet or to go for a martini and mingle with the crowd later on. Parking isn't cheap. But, if you're visiting MGH, you get a room discount along with being able to park at the hospital for $9/day. Can't beat that. All in all, I was thoroughly happy with our stay. I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Two week stay left me feeling a bit robbed!”
Reviews.Author: reefgurl86
Reviews.Content: I was staying in the area for two weeks, as I was getting some cosmetic surgery at Boston university Medical Center. I studied reviews for this place for weeks and had several chats with the front desk staff to make sure my special needs could be met. Those special need where: A private entrance as there club scene at this hotel can be a bit of a mob Cook to order meals or at least be able to customize the menu to meet my soft food needs. After all said and done.. none of these promises were fulfilled. I think the hotel was amazing and the rooms were great however the infrastructure of this property is lacking especially in the room service(kitchen) department. The kitchen was a complete joke and a bit insulting the things they would send up trying to pass off as food. I would call down to order in room and get the same thing I had the other night and when it arrived, it was the same dish yet cooked another way with different preparation. Very very inconsistent and the food was not always fresh and hot. I ordered a grilled cheese one evening and they put mayo in it---ewww and why? They also had no idea what a Denver omelet-what they sent an omelet with two types of onion, cheese and ham-(Not a Denver omelet and I know that and I'm not a cook) I figured out that they has issues in the kitchen so i was very descriptive in ordering and they even messed that up after i spelled it all out for them. As the kitchen was not solid with there food I did not eat on a few occasions as It was to much hassle to deal with there rookie kitchen. I think I sent back half of the things ordered. Not having the type of service they promised was upsetting,stressful and I wanted to leave several times yet I was trapped as I was recuperating. Worst of it my bill was around $6,000 I was told by The manager she would do something about the bill- That too was never fulfilled. The thing is the.. front desk, bell staff, room service waiters and cleaning staff were amazing. Please do something about your kitchen it is embarrassing receiving some of the things they sent up and just insulting for the price I payed. Your rooms our lovely and most of your staff is lovely but your hotel execution of services is poor and lacking in quality If this hotel corrects some major issues Ill be the first to book but until then this hotel is just not worth the money. Michelle C-Denver

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: ThomasheenOgRua
Reviews.Content: This is a truly stunning hotel! Words cannot do justice to this place. Of all the hotels I''ve ever stayed at, this tops the list. During the booking process, I had a few preliminary queries which Jackie dealt with using great proficciency. Upon arrival at the hotel, you are made feel like royalty. The doorman was very welcomming and polite. On entering the hotel, the wow factor kicks in. The reception atrium is stunning and is a fantastic transformation of this former prison. Dakota checked me in and was exceptionally friendly and welcoming. He assisted me with all my queries (as it was my first time in Boston, I had many!). The room was amazing. The view over the river and the city is second to none. The pros in the room included the very comfortable bed, oversized bath, separate large shower, very extensive minibar, molton brown products, excellent phone system that has links to weather, flight information, news etc. A separate mention must go to the complimentary wifi access. It is a complete rip off the way other hotels charge for internet usage. So well done to the Liberty for not ripping us off by charging! Other attractions in the hotel include a well equipped gym, a funky and very buzzing atmosphere in the trendiest lobby I have ever seen. The bar is hopping from about 8 onwards and because it is in the lobby, it adds to the atmosphere of the atrium. I had dinner in the restaurant at the bar which was a fun dining experience. A very very friendly waitress gave me great recommendations including a cosmo made from cucumber pulp! Delicious. The concierge (from Wexford) was wonderful to deal and made some great recommendations for breakfast, sightseeing and many other wonderful things. The Liberty made my stay in Boston perfect. I would have no hesitation at recommending this hotel and cannot wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Very, very average. Will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: I positively anticipated this hotel after reading some good reviews and interest from my colleagues in Boston who told me it was a great location, great vibe and a converted prison. With the high price point, I was also expecting a great experience. I am sorry to say that I was disappointed. This is probably because of the high expectations before arriving but these proved to be just hype. Similar to recent reviews, the property is really a social venue with a hotel attached to it. Despite beautiful architecture and restoration, the ex-jail theme is sadly more of a gimmick than it is an integral part of the experience. I arrived on a Monday and the hotel lobby, which is shared with a bar, was quite busy. No problem. Check-in and the staff were very efficient and friendly. Rooms are situated in either the â€œtowerâ€� or the â€œjailâ€� â€“ I had no idea until after I checked in. Rooms in the â€œtowerâ€� are located in a new build which is connected to the restored jail reception area. So, I was not in a historic building or the jail itself, but an extension. My room was at the end of the hall and behind a separate set of doors. This was a bit strange since it was my room and only one other that were behind these doors. This extra door didnâ€™t stay open and only the detachable panel beside it was open. I used this 2 foot opening to get through for the remainder of the stay. Upon arriving at my room, the door was open. The security latch was used as a door stop. I assumed that a housekeeper had used this to prop the door open and forgot about it. Nevertheless, itâ€™s not nice arriving at midnight to your room at the end of the hall (already behind another set of doors) to walk into a dark room and having to knock before entering, just in case. The room was empty, fine and undisturbed. I called reception to inform them and the operator told me â€œit should be fine, but Iâ€™ll put a note in your file in case of any problems at check-outâ€�. Well handled. Room was very nice and impeccably clean. Furnishings were nice and a very nice washroom. Molton Brown toiletries were very appreciated and the nice towels. Unfortunately, the view was terrible and overlooked a construction site that was light with florescent lights for the entire night. There was nothing of Boston to be seen from this room and despite the heavily played upon jail theme, this hotel room could have been a Marriott or a Sheraton anywhere in the world. With the view, I was more likely to be in Dubai. Service at the restaurant, Clink, was very good. Breakfast was a la carte and mostly heavier items. Lunch was also quite good but nothing inspiring. The gym or fitness room is not to be found on the website of the hotel for good reason. This facility was a terrible disappointment and was the size of about one guest room â€“ two treadmills, two elliptical machines and a bike with some hand weights and a universal machine. There was no pool or even a small steam or sauna. The TV did not work on the treadmill that I used and on the bike, the sound didnâ€™t work. The hotel is not in a good location for shopping or going out compared to hotels in the Backbay or Copley area. Walking to Backbay or to the Prudential building is about 20 minutes in cold December. The hotel offers a car service which is appreciated but not always available. The part I object to the most about the property is the social venue. In some ways itâ€™s reminiscent of a Las Vegas hotel. I like my return to my hotel to be an exclusive experience, welcoming, quiet, private and tasteful. In the evenings, the hotel is a bustling social venue with two bars and this often means pushing your way through crowds to get to reception. There is loud music and people from all over and itâ€™s just really not nice. Small things also left a bad impression like very fussy elevators that require a key card to access your room (a good thing but only works after several attempts); no wake-up call because the line to reception was disconnected one of the nights; slow tv because of too many options, etc. The Liberty is not a bad hotel, it is just trying to be too many things. It is missing a lot of attention to detail that youâ€™d expect at a hotel in its price range and to live up to its hype. My best experience in Boston remains the InterContinental and I would much sooner stay there for the next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but hotel is too hip for its own good”
Reviews.Author: NYCJami
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was staying more at a nightclub that happened to have hotel rooms instead of a four plus star hotel. Returned from dinner one night and it was difficult to get through the lobby crowd and party going on the main floor to get the the room elevators. The hotel rooms were nice overall but was dissapointed with my the Luxury Corner King room category. The room description stated that rooms had " floor-to-ceiling windows with breathtaking views of Boston, including Beacon Hill and the Charles River", In reality the Luxury Corner Kings are only on floors 2 - 6 so you have stunning views of the highway that runs right past the hotel (as well as the associated street noise). Also, had a couple of minor issues with light bulbs being burned out in the room and the hotel telephone system not working one night. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay here again as the hotel location is difficult to get to and I'd rather stay at another nice hotel that isn't as sceney.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a Miss!”
Reviews.Author: skipper123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an impressive building, tastefully refurbished from a prison to a luxury hotel. The reception staff, concierge, and in fact all staff were efficient, very helpful and friendly. However, the lobby area is turned into a place to "Be Seen" at night, by many people from outside of the hotel, and it was like a nightclub on the evening we tried to go to the bar for a drink, and in the end we gave up trying to be served, and couldn't have held a conversation because of the noise. This noise continued on the hotel floors as well, inconsiderate people being to blame, and by 3am on our first night, I was still wide awake because of the noise in the corridors and other rooms. Loud music started in one of the other rooms, but someone must have said something, as that was turned off. We were moved the next day, to a higher floor, but again, noisy revellers from the bar area and the cellar night club kept us awake and the people next door held a conversation as if it was 3 in the afternoon, not 3 in the morning, finishing with having sex, which was clear to hear. Surely a newly refurbished hotel which costs so much to stay in should have had more sound proofing during it's construction, and also the hotel seemed unsure as to whether it was a luxury hotel, or a night club. I would not recommend it on the strength of our stay, unless you are there to dance, drink and disturb other occupants of rooms with drunken behaviour - and I like a drink, but have more consideration for others. Valet parking was $42 a night, which is ridiculous

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: db6540
Reviews.Content: Prior to our visit to this hotel for Halloween weekend, I became a bit concerned reading some of the earlier comments. All my concerns disappeared upon entering the lobby. This was a fabulous space and the staff at the desk were very pleasant and accommodating. A glass of champagne was offered and started what turned out to be a great weekend in Boston. We arrived on Thursday the 29th and were told a Fashion Show was being held in the lobby that night with a DJ -- it was packed, it was loud, and it was great -- mostly a younger crowd. (BTW we are 50 somethings -- guess you are as young as you feel!) When we retired to our room, the party was still going on and our room was quiet to the point where had one not been in the lobby, you would not even know anything was going on. The same held true on Halloween night when the party was even larger. There are apparently a handful of rooms in the old prison building (which houses the lobby) so I suspect those reviewers complaining of noise may have stayed in one of those rooms. The rooms were spacious, very nicely appointed in a contemporary style.The bathroom was spacious with a nice size shower and separate soaking tub. The Molton Brown amenities were a nice touch. There was also free WiFi. Not having ever been to Boston we weren't sure about the location, but it turned out to be well located -- just a few blocks to Boston Common, Faneuil Hall, Beacon Hill and the riverfront. If and when we return to Boston, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Top Notch. Could Not Get A Better Location.”
Reviews.Author: MaJolie72
Reviews.Content: I was planning a weekend trip with my mother and she ended up cancelling at the last minute. I decided to go and stay at the Liberty as planned and I was not disappointed. I had a corner room with a beautiful view of the St. Charles River and the oversized bath also overlooked the river (though it also looked directly into the windows of an office complex but luckily it was the weekend). From the beginning of my visit until I checked out on Sunday, I was repeatedly impressed with the customer service. Every staff member was attentive and helpful without being overbearing or stuffy/haughty. Room service was very fast. On check in, you get a complmentary class of champagne as well as chocolates and fruit in your room. I thought that was a very nice touch. The location is so convenient as well. You can walk to shopping on St. Charles Street and Boston Common is quite close too. The T stop literally steps away from the hotel gives you access to the rest of the city. The hotel lends its guests bikes so on Sunday before I left I took a ride around the St. Charles River on the Esplanade - what a great way to end a relaxing weekend. As a single traveler, the only complaint I had was regarding the restaurant Scampo where I had dinner Friday night. I had gone down early to explain that I would now be dining solo and wanted to be seated in an area of the restaurant that would be comfortable for a single diner. Well, they gave up my two-top and sat me smack in the middle of the "chef's table" which is normally open seating. I was stuffed between two couples - it would have been better if I had been seated on one of the ends - and it was very uncomfortable. However, the meal was very good which made up for this a bit. The waitstaff was also very attentive. One other note - The Liberty is a very popular night spot, and lots of people congregate in the lobby - the focal point of the hotel. This makes it a great spot for people watching. But, checking in later at night or heading back to your room after a night out for dinner could be a little uncomfortable because of the crowd. The rooms in the tower are very quiet and very separate from this area. I never heard a sound once in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambientation, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: crvicunav
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for a business conference. Stayed at the Liberty Hotel for two nights. Excellent rooms, and an incredible bathroom. Loved how the old gaol is mixed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Liberty Hotel is the "in" place in Boston”
Reviews.Author: miami-explorers
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel has been beautifully restored and it was a great experience staying there. The rooms are plush and well maintained. However, for the price of the room you would expect a lot more personal service and catering to. It seems that though they consider themselves a luxury hotel they to do not offer the attention that you get at let's say the "Ritz Carlton". It seems that they are trying to cut costs by having the least amount of staff they can get away with and not have guests complain too much. If you are looking for a quiet place to relax I would not suggest the Liberty. It is clearly the trendy, happening place right now and the music can be heard from the rooms, no matter where you are staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: sinclairpix
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel is a great hotel - originally built as a prison in the 1800's and only recently renovated into a cutting-edge contemporary hotel. I little pricey, but not unreasonable, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronanf
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Hotels that Ive evered stayed in. Fantastic staff, fantastic facilities and lovely food.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Boston Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: PirateQueenII
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston in July to drop my nephew off for a conference and my sister told me to find the hotel. I googled Boston and up came The Liberty.
