They were running a special rate so I signed us up and it was everything we dreamed of. Simply superb staff, terrific food, and a bar scene that lined up out the door. Rooms were spacious for Boston with all the amenities including a lighted makeup mirror which is a nice touch and one I expect from a 5 star hotel. We had so much fun I talked it up at work and went back for a girls weekend in August with 3 friends. Easy travel, right on the T although everything is walkable. Great central location for a long weekend. Don't need a car. If you find a good special, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great property with a fun lobby and great location”
Reviews.Author: EstatePro27
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to "people watch". We were checked in with a glass of champagne and our bags were brought up quickly to our room. Our view was of the river and not far from Fenway. We walked to a few restaurants and also caought cabs from the hotel very easily. The rooms were nice and spacious. We spent some time hanging out in the lobby with cocktails and just "people watched" which was so much fun. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You'd be crazy to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: littlemissperfection
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the Liberty Hotel and it made our stay perfect. Ideal place for single girls to go and have some fun. Incredible hotel, real wow factor, great bar and lobby downstairs that comes alive for the weekly Thurs evening fashion show, and insane Friday and Saturday night drinking session. Pure class. Loved the rooms, the fabulous Molton Brown toiletries, gym with cool scented damp towels, the location in Beacon Hill is just great, easy access to the T... what more could you want. Will definitely be back. Love. It.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: michu25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is interesting, to say the least but the staff is friendly, check in and check out is so easy, and the rooms are luxuriously comfortable. I casually mentioned it was my birthday and we came back to the room after a walk around boston (the hotel is perfectly located) to find a cupcake and balloons in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place >>> Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Thishotelsucks_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely horrendous. I stayed on the same floor that people with monkeys (for a local film shoot) were staying. The hallway smelled like feces and the monkeys were noisy. When I called to complain to security, they were the rudest people I have ever spoken to in the hotel industry. Next time I will stay at the Boston Harbor Hotel or the Intercontinental. Definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed! Not a Leading Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelcouple
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to stay at this hotel! The initial check in was pleasant, but everything went downhill after that. We barely slept the 1st night because the walls were so thin (heard cell phone conversations, cars below, and other amorous activities). We asked to change rooms and the only thing they would offer was a smaller room w/doubles that had obviously been smoked in a lot!!! There was no apology and the front desk guy acted like he was doing me a favor. We decided to just endure the noise (we really had no other choice). From there, we had several encounters w/the concierge who had an attitude and provided incorrect info more than once. The waiters we experienced were all indifferent and seemed bored. The bed in the room was so uncomfortable that both of us walked around Boston w/horrible neck and back pain. We have stayed in many high end hotels all over the US, and never had an experience like this.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy crap crap crap”
Reviews.Author: HockeyDadVancouver
Reviews.Content: I was just about to post a scathing review of this crummy hotel and the high speed crapped out. A cap of crap on a crappy hotel If you like hotels where things don't work and they pretend to care, this is for you. They do great lip service but no other kind. The price is high and the service almost approaches Motel 6. And tney don't clean the rooms unless you ask. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: Excellent facility, great service and appointed hotel. Probably overpriced is all I can complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, chic, awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mzdeena
Reviews.Content: One of the best located hotel by the charles river, which is by the way one of the most perfect spots for joggers, this hotel is surely one of bostonian landmarks.. An eye catching architecture with an interesting lobby, where almost every evening the hip and young society nips on their martinis.. Only 3 blocks away from The Boston Common.. It is a pity that they don't have a swimming pool..

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaPookie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful with great staff and amenities (food and drinks). The room was very nice and large. The location is directly across from the Charles Street "T" station so it is easy to get around. Also easy airport travel by "T" or cab (about $25). The only drawback was we stayed on a weekend and it is the local hotspot so we couldn't enjoy the bar at night. It was packed Friday and Saturday night with a 45 minute wait just to get in. Great bed!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Silakka
Reviews.Content: The service was so good: we got an early check-in and a late check-out with no problem at all, shampagne and strawberries (honeymooners) and the room is really nice with Molton&Brown amenities. The concierge was very nice and helpful, too. I would really recommend it to anyone, luxurious and a little bit different than other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: NYgang
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel most definitely contributed to our fantastic get-away for the July 4th weekend. From the moment we pulled up, it was overall a very special stay. The architecture and history along with the amazing decor make this a very unique hotel. Great lobby!! We had a partial view of the Charles River from our room. We were also facing the hospital which is right next door yet it was very quiet. Breakfast was great at Clink. The staff all around could not have been nicer. At the last minute, we tried to get a reservation. Wait listed at first, the business manager and his staff were extremely accommodating and called the minute a room became available. The hotel is in a good location. Walkable to most areas of the city plus the subway is right across the street. Right near the Charles River esplanade where we saw the Boston Pops at the Hatch Shell. Highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels - anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Pghtraveller007
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with wonderful service. We arrived after lunch and left our luggage with valet then took off to tour Boston. When we arrived back at the hotel around 5:30 they gave us a glass of champagne while we were escorted to our room. The restaurant downstairs, Scampo, was terrific - great food, great service. Also, The Clink for breakfast was also great - son loved the crepes! The room was great, the amenities were great......I can't say enough about our experience - awesome hotel! Architectural Gem!

Reviews.Title: “The Jail we had to return to!”
Reviews.Author: NorrisTraveller
Reviews.Content: A wonderful second visit to this ultra modern hotel combined with the Restored Charles Street Jail Building. Service this year was even better than a year ago. Rooms are spacious and the Charles River view is worth paying for! Get as high as you can in the Tower. The Evening In-Crowd are something to behold! Being located near the Beacon Hill Area of Boston, there is obviouly money in the area. The Reception/ Bar area was buzzing with a fashion show on one evening. The great thing was that this was all far away from the rooms to have no effect on the peaceful luxury accomodation. Great Service from the staff, especially when we had to return having checked out and left our Passports and Cash in the Room Safe! All was OK, Panic Over. Only negative from last year was that Tea or Coffee making facilities were no longer in the rooms. We were forced to use Room Service at about $12 plus Tip!

Reviews.Title: “The Jail From Which You Do Not Want To Escape!”
Reviews.Author: DangerBabe
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute of our four night stay at the Liberty Hotel. The decor of the hotel is amazing, especially when taken in context with the history of the building. The staff was incredibly friendly and we felt at home the minute they opened the doors. We visited all of the restaurants and bars that are a part of the property. We even ordered room service! We enjoyed them all! The promixity of the T station is great, less than 50 yards away. While the price tag might seem high, the service definitely makes it worth every dime! Wherever we traveled in Boston, people responded with envy, when we told them we were staying at the Liberty Hotel! We can't wait to return to the Liberty Hotel! P.S. Make sure to order the Cherry Napoleon at the Lobby Bar!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: KSHOWare_MA
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at The Liberty. This was my second visit and I am now convinced this is THE hotel for me in Boston. On my first visit the door staff was not very attentive and often seemed distracted. This visit was just the opposite. From the moment we approached the front door until the moment we left we were treated very well. The front desk staff was, again, wonderful and the manager, Brian, is terriffic. We dined at Scampo and all enjoyed our meals. The staff there was also very attentive and friendly. Kudos to Jerry. Our visit was to celebrate my daughters 16th birthday. The staff made it quite memorable for her - a card, cupcake in room; candle in dessert at Scampo. Many well wishes. They made a mom and a young lady very happy. The Liberty is in a wonderful location to explore Boston and Cambridge on foot. There is a T stop right out front and the doormen are always happy to arrange a taxi or a private car. I love the architecture and the history of the building. It is always refreshing to see an old building refurbished and to see progress embrace history. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: not2woryluv
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Would suggest booking corner room overlooking St. Charles River. Did have a noise problem with AC but would still stay again. Great Italian restaurtant but book before you go...it is very popular with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Harvard Graduation”
Reviews.Author: sjjtx
Reviews.Content: Our daughter requested we cancel our reservation for Harvard graduation in Cambridge and stay here. Much cheaper than hotels in Cambridge and much better service. This was our 3rd Harvard graduation in four year and was by far the easiest. Just crossed the street to the subway and went three stops to arrive right at Harvard square - no traffic to fight and no long distance to walk. Hotel was a very "hopping" place at night with a very "in" bar scene. Could not hear in my room and did not interfere with our stay. Staff extremely friendly and technology in room was very current. Very large bathroom with shower and tub. Great linens. Room was not large, bathroom large but shower was smaller than mine at home so it felt tight to me. Idea of staying in old jail was fun. Our grad thought the night life was very cool there. Definately the place to see and be seen.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel,lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: monkeyadventure
Reviews.Content: We just had along weekend trip to Boston and stayed at the Liberty Hotel. It is fantastic,clean,stylish and a great location at the top of Charles street,within walking distance to... well everything. Good quality linens and towels and the staff were really helpful. A word of warning,there is quite a bar scene in the hotel lobby,if you sleep lightly request a room on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler3636
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very interesting history and decor in the common areas, making for a unique atmosphere. The front desk staff were welcoming at check-in, offering everyone a glass of champagne. The concierge staff were helpful with directions and recommendations. There is complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning, and the restaurant Clink serves a great breakfast. The ground floor indoor & outdoor bar is clearly a hot spot at night, with a line of people waiting to get in each night we were there. The room was generally comfortable and seemed to have been renovated recently; my only complaint was with the comfort of the mattress, which was soft and spongy and not supportive at all. The console of the phone in the room allows you to pull up the weather report, information about local attractions, and flight information. The flat panel TV is nice. The bathroom has both a tub and a separate shower stall with Molton Brown toiletries. The hotel's location is convenient with a T station right across the street and a CVS drugstore nearby. It is a short walk over to the path along the Charles River. Mass General Hospital is next door and we expected to hear ambulance sirens throughout our stay but never did. Note that the hotel only offers valet parking, which carried a charge of $42 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Our Perfect Anniversary Get-Away.”
Reviews.Author: splendidsplinter09
Reviews.Content: Simply put -- The Liberty exceeded all of our (already high) expectations. It features an ideal location, inspiring/unique architecture (it was a former jail), thoughtful service/staff (welcomed with champagne cocktail at check-in), beautifully appointed guestrooms and absolutely breathtaking views of Boston, Charles River and Cambridge. It's an absolute must.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: SD60
Reviews.Content: As a member of Leading Hotels of the World, we were expecting great things, especially given the price. We were greeted with a glass of Champaign, then pointed to the lift and told where our room was. At this hotel level, I have always been shown to my room, been given an introduction to the Hotels facilities. This may seem small criticism but at over $600.00 a night, you donâ€™t expect to carry your own bags. The Hotel in its own right is very comfortable. They make a big play on the buildings history as a prison, but I felt this is overplayed as most or the rooms are in the Tower annex and the Prison features that are left donâ€™t carry much character. The place has been made too modern for that. Overall, not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maverick1945
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston and quickly learned that the Liberty Hotel was in a very nice central location. At first you will think that it isnt near anything but once you start walking around you will notice that it is really central to everything. If you can upgrade your room to have wrap around windows I would suggest it. We had a great view and made the room feel much more open. We didnt eat at the restaurants there. We did get a drink at the bar one night late. The one downfall that I could find is that it is a really popular spot for the young crowd to come at night and there was a line out the door trying to get into the hotel. We had to let the front door man know that we were guests and then they let us in. Overall a very nice hotel and would quickly return

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: MBrown357
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel had great service, complete with complimentary champagne upon check-in. The bathroom was huge and the bed very comfortable. There was no mini refridgerator in our room though - there seemed to be a logical spot for it though so maybe our room was just missing it. Room was very quiet even though it was on a busy street. Very cool bar in the lobby called Clink - interesting mix of people but a great atmosphere. A great hotel to go to if you are into history, since it used to be a jail.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: cupcake135
Reviews.Content: This former jail is so architecturally beautiful, and I love the prison themed decor. From the moment you get there the staff fawns all over you, including greeting you with champagne. The rooms are lovely. I recommend getting a room with a view of the river. The negatives: its hard to find if you aren't familiar with the area, and the bed wasn't quite as comfy as I had expected. It wasn't bad at all, but we booked the "breathtaking" room, and I had expected something a little more on the plush side. The hotel was in a good location to walk all over the city to see the sites, there's a T station nearby, and/or the staff will get you a cab. We ate breakfast at Clink twice, and ordered room service once - the food was very good. Alibi is one of Boston's hotspots and the lobby becomes a lounge in the evenings. The concierge was terrific in recommending restaurants in the North End and giving directions. I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “The genuinely nicest hotel staff I have ever met”
Reviews.Author: DocmomBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I work at the MGH and stayed one night at the Liberty during a nor'easter so that I could be close by. I brought my husband and 2 kids to make it a "staycation." The staff was absolutely lovely. They asked my permission to send up complimentary milk and cookies for the kids--and they were delicious! As other reviewers have described, the lobby is gorgeous. The kids loved that we were sleeping in an old jail. The room had a boring view of the adjacent Mass Eye and Ear but if you looked to the left, there was the Charles River covered in snow. The room was standard sized but very tastefully decorated with a great flat screen HDTV. The bathroom was fantastic with a separate walk-in shower and soaking tub. Molton Brown toiletries were cleverly placed in hand pumps in the shower--very eco-friendly since you avoid unnecessary packaging and discards. Two plush robes were provided. I only had a few complaints: 1. the room is pretty dark--could use more light. 2. Being next to a hospital, you could hear ambulance sirens and in a storm, the plows CONSTANTLY going by. Luckily I brought earplugs. The doormen, housekeeping, and room service folks could not have been friendlier. The fitness room has 24 hour access and has ellipticals, treadmills, etc. I have been to Alibi before and it is quite the scene. If you like reasonably priced Thai food, the King and I is just up Charles Street and for casual Italian food, Antonio's Cucina Italiana is 2 blocks up Cambridge St. I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it highly to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby!”
Reviews.Author: Esibox
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend with my wife and 2 small children. Things we liked: 1. Lobby was great and had a good atmosphere at any time of day. The website does it justice. 2. Original room we were allocated was pretty average, facing the hospital next door. However, we asked for a different room and they put us in a corner room with views of the Charles River. This made the stay extra special 3. Great with kids. The staff were very relaxed around the children and we were made to feel very comfortable. 4. Clink is a great onsite restaurant. Quite pricey but good food. 5. Close to Beacon Hill and the park We didn't like: 1. Paying for the internet. At this level getting online should be free of charge. 2. Parking is expensive Although the location is a little weird (next to Mass General Hospital and busy road) once inside it is very relaxing. Plus with Beacon Hill and a train station opposite it is easy to get elsewhere. Overall we enjoyed the stay and would consider staying again if we returned to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prof01
Reviews.Content: Won an auction at SkyAuction.com after hearing good things about this hotel...they were right. Hotel is right on the subway line (across the street) and a 20-minute walk to Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market. Quick registration, complete with champagne. Hotel is former jail but it's been completed redone. The main lobbly is a spectacular atrium - nothing else like it. Several restaurants but they're pretty trendy...and expensive (but it's Boston). Good food alternatives right down or across the street. Staff is excellent - friendly, accommodating, helpul concierge. Room was very comfy and modern with great view - Charles River, etc. We'd go back to this hotel in heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Mavericks Fans Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Happytown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Boston with friends to see the Mavericks game. This hotel was terrific! The people were so helpful and always polite. Make sure to have breakfast at the Clink (it was wonderful and reasonably priced). The concierge was very helpful and helped to get reservations at the Union House Restaurant. We will definetly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mom's 70th”
Reviews.Author: danasbox
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend there for my Mom's 70th Bithday. We were all pleasantly surprised! The staff and rooms were terrific. Very pollished and professional. 300. a night they should be... The restaurants were great and very busy, people were waiting to get into the hotel to party in the very cold. All made for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Knew it was a scene”
Reviews.Author: givemesun-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the area and have been to eat here so we knew it was a nightclub scene around the clock. That being said, I didn't think it would bother us too much until we were stopped twice on the way in from a night on the town and asked to show our room key. We had to battle our way through bouncers and red velvet rope clingons just to get to our room. Besides the scene. Champagne at check in was lovely, the room was nicely appointed and we found the doormen to be super helpful. One of them even offered to take the empty water bottles out of the car for us on our way home. Beautiful building that does not feel like a sterile hotel...which is nice. There were some glitches, food at the bar (cheese plate and tuna tartar) took 45 minutes in the middle of the afternoon. and thermostat was broken so it was about 80 degrees all night, but those things happen everywhere. I thought it was a good value for what we paid but we won the evening on an auction site...not sure how I'd feel if I'd paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: traveling601
Reviews.Content: Like the reviewer before, I really wanted to love this hotel. We selected it for the history and the location. We came into Boston as a group of 4 couples. First impression of the hotel on drive up is very nice. Bellmen quickly opened the door, but didn't offer to help us up the escalator with our luggage. We were greeted with champagne at check-in. For the price, we expected a much nicer room. This compares to a Holiday Inn Express without the free breakfast. The lighting in the bathroom is horrible. If you think you might want to put on some makeup, realize that you will need to stand by the window in the room to do it. A shower with no place to hang a towel or a washcloth kind of irritates me too. One "positive" thing --the water pressure is almost unbearable when you turn it up. Unfortunately, our hot water was related to the pressure, so to keep it from scalding, we had to turn it down to a dribble. Complained twice before that was fixed. On the positive: The location is fantastic for seeing the town. With the T right across the street, and the trolley within walking distance, we were very pleased. We returned to the hotel late Saturday evening to find the place packed with the young club scene. I guess this is the place to be! We could not hear any of the noise in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LADYgRN
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this hotel. Driving up to it from the airport, it looked amazing! I think it is fantastic to preserve such beautiful old buildings in an ingenious way. However, we were checking in at 9pm on a Saturday night. WARNING: NEVER do that! The lobby turns into a night club and we could barely get through to the reception desk. From there it was a game of Frogger trying to find the elevator. We found out later that they were suppose to offer us Champagne but they did not. We were initially given the wrong room (2 beds instead of 1). But as soon as I notified the front desk, they switched us right away and the bellhop was wonderful in taking us there. This mix up ended up to be a blessing, we ended up in one of the few rooms that are actually in the main jail part of the hotel. The bellhop made sure we were happy with the room, informing us that they tend to be smaller and a bit noisier because they are above the lobby. Due to the brick and thickness of these old jail walls, it wasn't a problem and the room had the old jail charm. The location is unbeatable. The T is right in front of the hotel and I puchased a $15 week pass which I used over and over again. I was able to go anywhere with ease. Their transit system is amazing. There is a 24hr CVS pharmacy right on the other side of the T which was great. Also, the start of Beacon Hill is right there and is a great walk to the Commons. Upon check out I noticed my watch was missing. The front desk did not at all seem interested in my loss. I went back to the room to do another sweep to look for it but no luck. I left my information and waited a few more days to hear from them but did not. I called the hotel again but they were disinterested. This infuriated me even more. I stay in hotels at least 40 nights out of the year, for many years and have never had anything missing. I always lock my jewelry in the safe but my watch I usually take off and put on the bedside table. It is my fault that I forgot to put it on but I thought the Hotel would want to know if things turn up missing in there rooms. THEY DIDN'T CARE! I really wanted to love this hotel but most of their customer service is bad.; which is surprising because throughout Boston the locals seemed really friendly. SCARPO (to escape) restaurant was really great. We stopped there the night of our check in for a drink to escape the crowd in the lobby. The restaurant bar was also very crowded but we managed to get a seat at the bar. The drinks were good and strong, the bartenderes were friendly and we met the owner & her husband who were very friendly. We had some appetizers at that time and came back the next night for a fabulous dinner. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Give me Liberty...”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: The Liberty is a beautifully restored main building housing reception, a ballroom, restaurant, bar, gym and a few guest rooms plus a new wing housing the great majority of the other guest rooms. In addition to looking great, it is also very smartly done and the staff are uniformly friendly and eager to please. The rooms, while average in size, are equipped with flat screen TV's that offer high-def programming (nice!); floor-to-celing windows (with views to match); slow-closing automatic doors (no slamming - yeah!); and multi-funtion phones. What was noticeably missing was a coffee/tea maker. There were some minor complaints: $11 for daily internet access (when are 5-star hotels that charge $450 a night going to catch on and stop the nickel and diming?); erratic housekeeping (turndown service is a nice idea but not when they don't replace the towels); a tiny fitness center with so little equipment that its crowded with 3-4 others in there at the same time. Finally, the food in Clink Restaurant is very good and the weekend brunch, at $35 per person for all one can eat (buffet and/or menu), is a real treat. Drinks at the bar are pricey at $14 + but you are paying for the atmosphere as well (and it is a "scene" on weekends).

Reviews.Title: “Party like it's 1999!”
Reviews.Author: aa6nz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a weekend trip to Boston from PA. I wa svery surprised with the visit. Boston is a big city with a lot of History but has a small town friendliness about it. For a large city it was VERY, Very Clean and staying near Beacon Hill a ritzy area did'nt hurt. we went to Fuenil square, where you could eat yourself into a comma! Harvard Square," parc yaur karr in tha Harvard yard" you could feel the scholarship, brain power in the air! JFK library, I expected a little more, not much was there about the assasination. The Liberty Hotel is a hot party spot..if you like to party you don't have to leave the hotel. The party is there every night...the pretty people....with money or pretending to have some and fancy cars out front. The food at the hotel is very disappointing and pricey. Don't eat at the hotel, you will be disappointed and mad at yourself! Because now you know better. There are plenty of places to eat close by, the wine liqour store is right across the street and the Starbucks is one block away. The subway is right in front of the hotel, Harvard is 2 stops north and you can travel the city on a subway pass. The subways are clean and appear to be safe, we incurred no problems.Now back to the hotel..Our room was very nice and the view was to die for. We did the Boston duck tour and went into the Charles River...the view of Boston was better from the room! I was told Mick Jagger and Bruce Willis stayed at the Hotel. The Tower rooms where we stayed was so neat. The room keys resemble prison keys..the elevators only go to the room floor that the key works for...thats good. The hotel staff were very professional and are good at their jobs..the check in was flawless especially with the glass of pink Champagne :) Tasty! My only complaint is, I like the doorman to open the doors and greet me by name coming in and out of the hotel. Due to the large party crowd, the doorman could'nt seperate who's a hotel guest or bar patron. So their service was'nt consitent, some times they would open the doors sometimes they would'nt. Due to the Party crowd it was very tough for them to keep up.....The Hotel needs to hire some more people to man the front doors. The bellmen and Valet were fine. I would stay at the hotel again...but i would get my drinks and food elsewhere! The Lobby is beautiful and very unique...The hotel is a unique experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: eschmaus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Our room was very contemporary, clean and had everything we could need - the touchscreen phone was also nice, with maps of the city, order items from the "virtual guest shop", check the weather, view your invoice etc. We had a beautiful view of the Charles River from our room # 602. Nice flat screen HDTV in the room, bed was a bit firm for my preference but still slept great. Has to have the best stocked mini-bar of any hotel I've ever seen! Bathroom is very spacious and beautifully appointed with Molton Brown products and plush robes that are silky on the outside and soft on the inside. The nightlife at this hotel is incredible, this is where the Boston glitterati congregate en mass! To get an outside table at Alibi you will definitely need to make a reservation or get there EARLY! We ate at Scampo got the cheese pizza which was delicious. Hanging out in Clink, the lobby bar at night is apparently the thing to do when in Boston as it seems this is where everyone goes. A young, beautiful and trendy crowd. Yet somehow the noise is not heard at all from the guest rooms! Although the hotel is located right next to Mass. General Hospital we were not woken at all at night by ambulance sirens. If you walk down Charles St. it only takes about 5 minutes to get to the Boston gardens/commons which are really pretty. There's 2 starbucks stores along the way as well as the Cafe Vanille which sells coffee and delicious French pastries. About a half mile walk down Beacon St. leads to Fanieul Hall where you can get CHEAP breakfast for a couple bucks. We got a cheap rate of $275/night - I booked about 8 months ago. Seems that the rates have gone up at least $100+ per night since we booked, but I would definitely pay to stay here again. So unique, beautiful, wonderful staff, they are so helpful. We were able to get an extended check out at 2pm as our flight wasn't until later and after check out we were allowed to leave our bags there so we could go out and not have to drag them around with us. Stay here, it's FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice but Clink Restaurant is overrated”
Reviews.Author: jodinicole79
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I checked into the Liberty last Saturday evening for a quick one night get away. The valet greeted us and offered to assist with bags which we declined. We entered into the beautiful lobby of the hotel, which is most certainly not like anything I've ever seen before. It has an ecclectic sort of charm and I just knew it was our kind of place. It did take us a few minutes to get through the line at check in, it appeared there had been some confusion with the guests checking in prior to us. We were however welcomed my a friendly girl Sara at the check in who gave us a quick over view and some champagne. Before we went upstairs we headed over to the conceirge for some advice on dinner reservations. Maryanne was amazing, she found us a perfect restaurant to suit my craving for steak and his for italian. She picked up and made us a reservation, highlighted a route for us on a map and told us about other points of interested in the area. I was impressed. We headed upstairs to check out our room. We liked our room very much, it was very modern and contemporary which is just our taste. The bathroom had a corner shower and big inviting bathtub, also very nice bath products from London. The kind bed was very comfy and there was a nice area for a desk and also a chaise chair as well and we had a nice view of the patio area below. We cracked open the mini bar and found a vast array of nips, champagnes, wines, juice, sodas and waters. There was also a nice choice of snacks mix and nuts. We sampled a few things and enjoyed all of them. Everything in the room was wonderful. We would have loved to stay another day. Though a little pricey I booked through Hotwire and got a substantial discount. The hotel lobby is the hot spot at night and there was quite a hip crowd mingling and drinking. We went up to our room after dinner with the intentions of going back downstairs and never made it because we fell asleep, though it looked like it was a great time! The next morning we woke up rested we were not bothered at all with any noises as I had read in other reviews. We were in the Tower section of the hotel on the 4th floor. We headed downstairs in the morning for brunch at Clink before our check out. I must say I was disappointed in that. The service was average but the food selection was mediocre. The portion of foods already prepared, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, etc were set up in buffet style but everything was lukewarm/cold in temperature. There was a small selection of fruit & cereal which looked adequate. There was also a separate menu which you could order other things from as part of the brunch. Ranged from things like steak & eggs, eggs benedicts, boston lettuce salad, roast beef melts, veggie omelete, all which sound enticing but are not so much. I was disappointed with the taste and quality of all the foods. Also I felt as though the selection was odd and not suitiable to be called brunch. And it was $35.00 per person. Defintiely not worth it. I do recommend the hotel, parking was expensive $42.00 a night but that's Boston for you, but skip on Clink just take a short stroll and go find a real place for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “bartenders should be taught they are in the hospitality business”
Reviews.Author: kmcg101
Reviews.Content: I am a 20 year veteran of the boston bar scene and found Liberty to be right in line with the current, short lived hip place to be. The bar crowd there is good. If you are looking for a place to meet professionals, this is a good place to go until the next place is the place to go. Some of the bartenders are good, polite and welcoming but I have had terrible experiences with some others. There are a few that need to be reminded that their job is to make everyone's stay there as enjoyable as can be. Instead I saw too many instances of, 'this is my bar and you will take what i give you if you are lucky.' Unfortunately, bartender entitlement is far too common in boston which keeps me going back to my usual places where they treat me with the respect a paying customer deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly Noisy”
Reviews.Author: becbuilder
Reviews.Content: We were hoping to spend a relaxing weekend in Boston and checked into the Liberty hotel. Initial impressions were nice, until we the evenings came....The lobby basically turns into a discotheque with loud music and large crouds gathering there. The music is kept at a loud volume and it was basically impossible for us to get to sleep. Amazingly, this was not told to us during the check in and the music is kept loud until 1:30 am in the morning !!!! I didn't know what say about that and we found it appalling that the hotel was renting out rooms so close to an intolerable noisy environment. all in all, very disappointing. don't stay there if you are looking for a relaxing experience in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: GreenMountainLover
Reviews.Content: The Liberty Hotel is simply amazing! The room was ultra comfortable with an oversized ultra modern bathroom and a bathtub that was sparkling clean. We had a spectacular view of Boston from our room. The workout center had great equipment and was well-stocked with clean towels, fruit, and water. The staff was also extraordinary. When we arrived to find a handwritten card and a bottle of complimentary wine in our room to celebrate our honeymoon, room service came up immediately and replaced it with non-alcoholic champagne at my non-drinking husband's request. Concierge tirelessly answered our constant barrage of questions. Housekeeping was discreet and thorough. The hotel is centrally located which made everything from shopping on Newbury Street to hopping the T to get to Fenway (the T station is right across from the hotel) easily accessible. Contrary to the experience reported in a previous review, when we were running late to the airport, the Liberty gave us complimentary use of the hotel car to get to Logan; the driver Chip was one of the nicest people we met in Boston. Noise was also not an issue for us, but we did stay during the week, not on a weekend. Our one slight issue was that because we did not have a laptop to take advantage of free Internet, there was no complimentary computer on which to connect to the Internet. The computers in the Libertyâ€™s business center were excessively priced. Despite that minor issue we will definitely go back to the Liberty.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average stay...but not great.”
Reviews.Author: Minibarmuncher
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in July and can attest to the sound proofing issues in the Tower building...you can hear toilets from adjacent rooms flush and doors in the coridor closing, etc. but the room is very nice and modern....thoughtful touches like dimming light in bathroom, separate tub shower, Molten Brown amenities, and safe and flat panel TV are quite nice. the fitness room is smallish but very good equipment and large wndows for natural light. The bars/restaurants are a bit too much of a scene.... location in Beacon Hill was very nice for us, although the ingress/egress for autos is not great.

Reviews.Title: “noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: steffi56
Reviews.Content: Instead of the (fake) champagne they give you at check in, they should give you earplugs! I read reviews of this hotel, and took the advice to book our rooms in the tower, but there is absolutely no sound proofing in this hotel, there's about 1/2 an inch of space around the - very heavy - doors. People come home at all hours of the night and it's like they are standing next to your bed, even if they whisper, you hear the slamming of the doors the whole night! Great place for night -owls, but not for families! It's not all bad, we had dinner at the hotel's Italian restaurant Scampo, and it was superb. The concierge was also extremely helpful and gave us some great tips. Location is great, rooms were ok, bathrooms a little dark, and we could have used a light in the closet. Steffi Huber, Atlanta

Reviews.Title: “Dont order the chowder”
Reviews.Author: Tulip33
Reviews.Content: You would think when you are staying in a luxury hotel in Boston, they would perfect the Boston Clam Chowder on their menu. Unfortunately not the case at Liberty Hotel. Their chowder was watery and the potatoes in the chowder were still uncooked. Very disappointed, especially after paying the 18% room service charge on the bill. I suggest going to any nearby Legal Seafood instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very upset”
Reviews.Author: Reallyupset
Reviews.Content: This is the letter I sent to the general manager: We visited Boston last week, as we do often, because our daughter lives there. We dined at your hotel twice, it being one of our favorites. We will never dine there again. It was not because of the food. It was excellent. And the service at the bar was superb. It was because of what happened when we wanted a cab. The night before, we got a cab from your hotel to the Park Plaze where we were staying. It cost us about $6. On the night in question, Thursday, we asked your doorman to get us a cab and he indicated that we could have the hotel courtesy car instead. It sounded like a great thing so we agreed. Imagine our surprise when we were charged $25 for the short ride when we got to the hotel, the driver saying that it was a private company. We were appalled that we were conned like that. On Wednesday night we spend about $200 in the dining room --there being 4 of us and on Thursday night we spend $350 in the dining room--there being 7 of us and an additional $120 in the bar afterward. It is a shame that the greed of the hotel (or perhaps the doorman)will prevent us from ever coming to your hotel again. Thank you for your prior good service. Unfortunately, the quest for an additional $25 has ruined this for us and has left us with such a bad taste in our mouths that we will not make a repeat performance.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: emptynestersrus
Reviews.Content: Whoever thought of converting an old jail into a hotel is a genius. What glorious fun! They kept the old jail cells and named the bar Clink to fit in with the theme, but everything else is throughly modern. The service was impeccable and the room was lovely. We always try and stay somewhere different when we travel because we enjoy the variety of the experience, but I don't think we will stay anywhere else when in Boston from now on. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: arlene72
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. It was a jail that was converted to a luxury hotel and expanded by adding an adjoining tower. The staff was exceptional. The room was top notch and the location was perfect. It's located on the edge of Beacon Hill and directly across from a metro station. Depending on what we were doing, we either hopped the metro or walked. We had Sunday brunch at the Clink restaurant and it was very good. I liked that it was setup to provide a combination of buffet and cooked-to-order food, and the price was reasonable. We were a bit surprised to find the bars in the hotel are quite the hot spot on the weekend nights with lines out the door (which was probably the only negative for us). Otherwise, absolutely loved the hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Noise and unsafe”
Reviews.Author: Temple-8
Reviews.Content: After sleeping in more than 300 different hotels i found the Liberty hotel one of the worst ones. I had a reservation for a 5 days. I checked out after day 2. When i arrived i ask for an extra bed for my brother. They provided me a kind of a small sofa only about 1,5m long. Since my brother did not fit in it i the ask the hotel clerk to take it away. They didnÂ´t. My first night was extremelly noise. The Hotel has an inside bar and all noises were coming into the room. The walls are paper thin. Also the air conditioner compresor was kicking in and out all the time, so every 30 seconds you could heard a loud knock! The second night was even worst. The fire alarm turned on at 2 a.m.. and It stayed on for at least 3 minutes. After that everybody was puzzed waiting at the hallways for information. We received no information from the hotel. Some people stay, some left. I end up calling the hotel reception. The clerk was very rude, he said that there was to many rooms to inform anyone. I just did no felt safe in the Liberty hotel. I end up leaving the place in the morning. When I checked out they had my room into somebody elses name with different charges. I apologize for being so negative about it. It really made my vacation a nighmare. I just canÂ´t believe that such a expensive hotel could have so many flaws

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service but...”
Reviews.Author: Skilikeagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband had a convention in Boston last weekend and since I went to school in Boston, I went along. After searching on TripAdvisor, I decided to book The Liberty Hotel. The jail renovation was beautiful and the lobby is quite large and a fun spot to hang out. I also thought a glass of champagne at check-in was a nice touch. I requested a king size bed and a "breathtaking" room and got neither. I understand how things can get busy, but we got a view of Mass General Hospital's entrance and two double size beds. I immediately called the front desk to complain. They could not move us and sent up a bottle of champagne to apologize. I like the location of the hotel because the T (mass transit) is just outside the door. It is easy to stroll on Charles Street and the Public Gardens and it is an easy stop from the airport, even though the cab fare still cost us $25 which included a tip. If you are single, then this hotel is for you. At night, this lobby transforms into a hot professionals singles spot. After returning from dinner on a Thursday night, there was a huge line outside the entrance to get in. Friday night was even more crowded. We had to push our way through the lobby to get to the elevators. A martini is $14, in case you are interested. Fire alarm went off at 2am and we walked down 12 flights of stairs. A sprinkler head went off and we went back to our room. The following morning we had a letter of apology, slipped under our door. When we checked out, they took off a night's stay from our bill. I still do not know if this was because of our room, or the fire drill, but I thought that was appropriate. The Liberty Hotel is one of the more expensive hotels in the area. The hotel staff did their best to make our stay as pleasant as possible. I question the price. The room was quiet, the decor of the lobby was fun, and the location was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in boston”
Reviews.Author: rackiec
Reviews.Content: Wonderful wonderful - this is one of the best hotels I have every stayed in. Service was fantastic. Room service great. Bar great Location great STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LBV1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful inside and out, immaculate and upscale! Ate at one restaurant on premise and found it to be delicious! There are a few bars on the property that were even busy on a Sun night. I hear that on the Fri and Sat it is really jumping! The room was huge and had just about everything you could want from a suite! Found the valet staff very friendly and professional as well as the man who checked us in....Calvin........very professioanl and polite! Top shelf place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MDtweety
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in this hotel. The location is great; just a few steps to the subway stop, the Beacon Hill shops and restaurants, and Boston Common. The staff was polite and helpful; the concierge gave me several good recommendations for dinner. They give you a glass of champagne when you check in and if you ever get a craving for an apple during your stay, you can grab one in the lobby as well. The building itself was very interesting (the hotel used to be a jail) and the lobby was very pretty and a good place to just hang out with a drink. Our room was spotless, and the bed was so comfortable! I loved the bath products and big fluffy bath towels. They even give you slippers. In the evenings, sometime between 6 p.m. and 8 p.m. the housekeeping staff brings a coffee pot with coffee and tea that you can make, turns down the bed, and puts turns on the TV with soothing nature images. They also leave the lights on. I thought this was a nice touch, but kind of unnecessary and wasteful. I found it to be at odds with their conservation policy of asking us to reuse towels and only changing bed linens every 3 days. The drinks at the bar were way too expensive. Nothing below $13. A sip of wine (about the amount you would get at a winery during a tasting) was around $7 and a full glass was about $14 and up!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, stay in the tower”
Reviews.Author: JD3
Reviews.Content: We actually had a really nice stay here. We loved the architecture in the Old Jail part of the hotel, and we decided to stay in a room in this section for this reason. The exposed brick wall was a nice effect, we had a large floor to ceiling window overlooking the Charles River and Beacon Hill, the bathroom was really nice, and the bed was so comfortable. However, if you stay on a Thursday through Saturday night, the lobby rotunda becomes a very loud nightclub, and the noise was heard loudly in our room until about 2 am. Luckily we had gone to a show and then stopped for a drink so we didn't get back to the room until 12 or so, so we only had to suffer for 2 hours. Next time I would stay in the tower section. You would not hear any of the noise from there.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JayoIreland
Reviews.Content: After alot of hours searching for hotels to stay in we eventually settled on the liberty and what a gem it turned out to be. The hotel is modern and beautifully finished the staff are professional and yet not in your face. The rooms are bigger than expected immaculately clean and the bed is too comfy. With regards to getting around Boston the city centre is just a 15 min walk and the T station is next door which leaves everywhere within easy access. It is pricey to eat and drink in but the food and service is second to none. I will return to Boston next december and will find it extremely difficult to stay anywhere other than here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: djk6162
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mother for two nights in April. Awesome experience. The staff, from the housekeeper to the concierge, were so polite, accomodating and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful, the room was very cozy and the beds were extremely comfortable. They had a very nice turndown service at night, and they left the TV on a soft classical station. We ate at Clink for breakfast and Scampo for dinner and both were excellent, as was the service. We loved this hotel, felt like a celebrity from the minute we arrived to the minute we left. Will most definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: katfix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March It is a converted jail, and we felt like we were in jail after 3 days. First, one freezing cold day, they did some type of evaluation of the ventilation system. No power, all the windows wide open, no elevators -- we stayed in the lobby for 2 hrs shivering. This should have been done prior to opening in January, not while paying guests were "stuck" right at dinner time. They charged daily - $10 per day - for the wireless, but it only worked a few hours total. No one in the hotel could tell us how to connect. The business center was totally down as well. The TV did not work the entire time we were there -- once we thought it was working, ordered a pay for view and it went out. We asked for consideration on the bill but were flatly and rudely turned down. The food in the restaurant, Clink, was overpriced and not very good. We knew they were new, so we tried to give them another chance, (it is very close to relatives in Boston) but this too was a disaster. We have stayed all over the world and this was one of the worst -- too bad, as it could have potential but the management is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Unique Hip Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tapnmel23
Reviews.Content: This is hip at its hippest! When we pulled up to the Liberty Hotel, I thought "wow - this is going to be a place I will never forget". And it turns out I was right. Despite the fact that it was freezing outside, the minute we pulled up, a gentleman opened our car doors and helped us with our luggage. Once we went inside, we were greeted by one of the most amazing hotel lobbies you will ever see. Words cannot describe how unique the lobby is, so I am not even going to try. But take my word for it - it's an architectural wonder. Open and airy yet cozy and chic. Just beautiful. And because it was happy hour on a Friday, people were arriving to have drinks in the hotel's lobby bar. Needless to say, it was a bit crowded because this hotel is definitely a hot spot in Boston. Once we checked in (which, by the way, was very easy and quick), we went to our room and were amazed at how chic and cozy it was. A thick duvet on the bed was soft and inviting, as was the sunk-in bathtub and large flat screen television. This is definitely a room one could just lounge in for a day or two. After checking in, we went to the lobby for a drink. By this time, it was incredibly crowded in the lobby and all the tables were taken. We paid a premium for 1 glass of champagne ($25) but it was tasty! Then we went exploring in Boston! The great thing is that there is a subway stop directly next to the hotel. From there, you can get to central boston, or even take it to the JFK museum! In all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The stay was nice, the hotel was amazing and the location was wonderful! I would recommend this hotel to young people and those who like chic and hip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At The Liberty”
Reviews.Author: chic9chica
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous stay at the Liberty Hotel. The service was impeccable. Our room was clean and comfortable. The beds were extremely soft. The theme of the hotel is also very interesting; lobby is very pleasing to the eye. At night the hotel is packed with attractive people going to Aura. The bar and restaurant get crowded so this hotel might not be a good place for people with small kids. Hotel location is close to Boston attractions but be prepared to pay $40 a night to park your car. For those who want to save skip the car and take the T which is just across the street. Breakfast is also very expensive and not that good. Au Bon Pain is 3-4 blocks away which is way more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Stay at this chic, luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: DzKyutee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Liberty on a visit to Boston for the Celtics game, and I have to say it's the little things that make this a luxury hotel. STAFF: I never encountered a gruff staff member at the hotel. Being warmly greeted with champagne upon entering was a treat after coming in from the rain. The lobby is gorgeous, and I appreciated that the check-in desk was off to the side and unassuming. I had guests come up to my room before the game, and I didn't feel like the staff was staring me down. The doormen readily hailed a cab for you and escorted you under umbrellas to your cab, valet, etc. There is a simple touch screen phone that made calling down to the front desk a breeze, and they readily explained the $10.95 charge for internet when I asked. ACCOMODATIONS: The room was beautiful, again the little things count. For one thing, the umbrella in the closet in our room came in handy for the rainy days. There was an extremely soft and cozy throw on the bed that made you want to snuggle up while enjoying the view. The bed itself and the pillows were soft and comfortable. The shower being separate from the tub was a plus - while the tub was not extra long, it was deeper than a standard tub, and was more than sufficient for my needs. There was also a book rack on the tub, which was a nice touch and made me feel more at home. There were several mirrors - 3 in the bathroom(1 was a shaving mirror) and a full-length mirror outside the bathroom. There was an extra shelf along one of the mirrors in the bathroom that gave it a feel of a separate vanity. Another nice touch was the comfy robes and (disposable) slippers. I had hot water everytime I showered, and the water pressure was exceptional. The bellman offered to bring ice to my room immediately after bringing up our bags and I appreciated the real ice chest, not a cheap plastic bucket. There's a wonderful channel that plays light classical music and showcases art - adding to our relaxing stay. LOBBY - I enjoyed the atmosphere of the lobby, and didn't feel it was at all pretentious. On one afternoon, my husband and I sat in a pair of the leather chairs and ate ice cream while enjoying the rotunda, and one evening in the lobby we had cocktails in our jeans after the game. The main bar is in the lower lobby, so while there are people, bouncers, etc. when you first enter, you take ten steps to the escalators and are in huge main lobby. That being said, my stay was mid-week and I have nothing to vouch for the weekend crowd. The music was never an issue for me, and you can't hear it if you are staying in a tower room(I can't be sure about rooms in the main area). Everytime I was outside of my room I encountered a member of the cleaning staff fastidiously working in the background. Their work was evident - the lobby and hallways were pristine. - I did utilize the fitness center, and found it to be basic - the equipment was new, and of a familiar brand. There were headphones provided so you could access your preferred TV/Radio station on your treadmill/elliptical/bike in privacy - though the channel options were limited. Bottles of water were available in the workout room, as well (the same bottles that were $5 in your room, go figure!). Another nice touch was that they have complementary laundering of your workout clothes 1x during your stay. I worked out every day, so this was very nice - it wasn't openly advertised - but a quick call down to the front desk took care of it all for me. NEGATIVES: No establishment is perfect, not even a 5star. Our stay was amazing, and none of what I found wrong affected that. 1)The shower door didn't stick too well - but it wasn't an inconvenience as it still closed. 2)The pocket door to enter the bathroom was off-alignment, obviously due to constantly being opened incorrectly by guests - again, not an inconvenience as it still closed. 3)Not all Rooms have the greatest view, if you back up against the hospital/clinic - we had a partial view of an office. 4)If you have no other background noise, you may hear people in the hallways from your room. For some reason, there were several children staying on our floor and when their family came and left, we could hear them. We never heard anyone else but those children, though - and we never heard them in their rooms. FYI 1)I like to walk around the area, and while I didn't feel it was an unsafe neighborhood, the traffic on the street in front of the hotel was a constant flow. I didn't consider this a negative but felt it should be mentioned. 2) There were several restaurants within walking distance, and a 24-hour CVS across the street - which came in handy to avoid the $5 sodas in the mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but Strange”
Reviews.Author: sailorg
Reviews.Content: This is a "luxury hotel". You will have a clean and well appointed room in a lovely area of town. However this place is strange. It used to be a jail and has a jail theme, which I don't find cute. Room service is "solitary dining" for example. Staff were ok, a little gruff sometimes, but this is Boston. There is a bar downstairs which people wait in line to get into! A hotel bar! Then people fill up the lobby and they play music pretty loud. I can't imagine trying to check in there on a Thur - Sat evening. When I walked back in after dinner saturday night it felt like Sex and City was shooting. But not in a cool way. Rather in a lame, this place is trying too hard to be Manhattan cool. If I want to go to a club, I'll go to a club. I go to my hotel to sleep. Also, they charge out the wazoo for anything extra. Internet is $12 a day, doesn't work well and no where could I find this price listed - not even when you click "OK" on your computer to get online. I don't like prices being hidden. Also no breakfast included. Next time, I'd stay at the new looking Holiday Inn a few blocks down that probably has a breakfast and internet included. My one big beef was they required a hold on my credit card for the total amount for my stay plus a few hundred in case I decided to drink a coke from the mini bar! That meant they had my credit card company hold $1400 on my account - basically reducing my credit limit by $1400 during my stay. I have never heard of this before and I thought the point of a credit card was that whatever I do, the hotel gets paid because that's the risk the credit card company takes on for getting paid interest. And even if you have a debit card w/ enough $$ in the bank to pay - you still need enough credit for their stupid hold.

Reviews.Title: “Very Interesting”
Reviews.Author: EVEOOldSaybrook
Reviews.Content: One must try this place if coming to Boston, with $$$ to spend. I'm a BU graduate, and it's a far cry from my days living in little rooms off Beacon Street, but loving the city itself tremendously. Now that I can afford the bucks, coming to the Liberty was a must experience. Overall, our impression was excellent. I agree with every reviewer who thought the valet parking price, in addition to a sizeable fee for your room, was a bit much. Ditto to the price tag for the food in the Clink, which was "OK", but not exceptional. Glad to see "Buzzy's" roast beef sandwich is alive and well. We had an exceptional view of the Charles River, with the Citgo sign still alive and well it seems. I would say that breakfast in the room was not special...when you are paying a delivery fee, a tax fee, and a gratuity of 18%, you don't expect the cream or the coffee to come to you from the pocket of the server! Not me, at least...it should be in a pewter creamer, at the least. The pancakes were on the cold side, and the syrup was in little jelly-like containers...not in pewter servers as one would expect. Champagne upon arrival is a nice touch. The room(s) seemed as though they were awaiting at least a touch of color...perhaps a fica tree in the parlor area. Also, I did not spot any full length mirrors...a must for those dressing up and going out for the evening! All in all, a fun place. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Chouracrew
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 6 that stayed for 2 nights in February. What an amazing hotel! The service was top notch, the rooms clean and extremely comfortable and the hotel lobby was spectacular. It was obvious that the hotel bar/lounge was THE place to be on a Saturday night. There was a big crowd, great music and lots of places to sit and people watch. The only down side to the service was that in the restaurant "Clink" on Sunday morning. My friend waited for 20+ minutes without being acknowledged. As she sat waiting, she saw another couple get up and leave that also were not being served. The food, however was tasty and warm and our server seemed to come around a lot more once he got over the initial oversight.

Reviews.Title: “Converted Jail Too Hip For Its Own Good?”
Reviews.Author: sarg814
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Liberty Hotel in Boston for a President's Day weekend getaway. We were wholly intrigued by the notion that the hotel, pretty new, was formerly a jail! Hotel developers did a great job of maintaining a 'jail-like' feel to the hotel, while simultaneously creating an upscale, luxurious property. Some great marketing minds must have been involved in the development too, lots of clever touches throughout. There are three restaurants/bars in the hotel: Alibi (sip cocktails and feel 'locked in'), Clink (fancy/snooty city restaurant) and Scampo (from the latin for escape?). If you're really into the nightlife scene, you'll LOVE the Liberty. Saturday nights the place has a line extending outside of the hotel (even in 20 degree weather) of people waiting to get into Alibi. We felt the clientele were a bit pretentious and were more than a little turned off. As for the hotel rooms, they are a little on the small side, but you are in a city, so have to expect that to some degree. Decor is fantastic - very modern, neutral colors. Bed is REALLY comfortable! Big bathroom so you have plenty of room to move around in. Overall, I'd recommend the hotel to people who appreciate, hip, trendy boutique-type hotels. The place is quite a novelty, and gives the discerning traveler something other than the typical stay at a Westin or a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: SheCallsMeParticular
Reviews.Content: The lobby space was spectacular but in the important aspects I thought the hotel failed. Our room was very noisy. Even though there was another room between ours and the elevators, the whoosh of the elevators was very audible. The HVAC system was very loud when it came on. There was no window that opened to the outside so without the HVAC the room felt stuffy, and I felt that the room suffered from the outgassing of construction materials. When I needed my car (admittedly late at night) the valet was not at his post and the desk personnel were surly when I complained about this and asked them to find him.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: cecomp76
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, unique hotel that I can't wait to return to if I have the pleasure of staying in Boston again. Check-in was a delight - so impressive as you travel the escalators up to the beautiful lobby, fast and obliging service (accommodating my last minute water view request) and a glass of champagne to take up to the room and unwind. Tone of the room was very soothing and yet not monotone as some, especially contemporary type, hotels can be. View was great overlooking the historic main building, the landscaped yard and the Charles River. All room amenities were great - both a walk-in shower and separate tub, large bathroom with plenty of counter area, comfy bed, fast room service, convenient touch-screen phone "gift shop" where you can also order travel necessities you may have forgotten -- delivered to your room within minutes. I was also able to take advantage of having the house car drive me to Faneuil Hall (only available during certain hours of the day) which was nice. This helped to offset the $40/day parking charge. (Yikes!) Minor irritations: couldn't receive NBC on my large LCD TV - a disappointment for a Today Show watcher (probably a glitch limited to my room), and only one bell hop, which required a wait upon arrival and departure. Not that big a deal. This is such a historic and beautiful place, effortlessly meshing 1851 architecture with modern style. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place that I intend to be an inmate!!”
Reviews.Author: SGMFG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Liberty for two nights during a business/ sight seeing trip to Boston, a great hotel. It reminded me slightly of Malmaison in Oxford UK which is also a converted jail. Most of the old character has been well restored. The staff are excellent and as so often is found in the US; very keen to please. The rooms are lovely, great bathrooms and the beds are very comfortable. The restaurant ,Clink ,is good we ate in one night and in town the second night. The bar ,Alibi , is fun and very busy and great for a pre diner drink; or two! The hotel itself is very well located for sight seeing, just off Charles St and near the station. Easy walk into the centre through Beacon Hill area. If you are going to Boston it's a must, I will be going back and hopefully for longer the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Liverneck
Reviews.Content: Spent a Saturday night for my wife's birthday. Rooms were quite comfortable. We had a package that included breakfast the next morning. Food was very good. Service in the restaurant was mediocre at best. Otherwise bathrooms were large with separate tub/shower and rooms were clean. Prices at the bar and restaurant were super-inflated which is the industry standard. Front desk help and bell service was very prompt and friendly. Would stay again. Did not have dinner at the hotel.
